XN3UxAZxvBD5XasejOggog.text: I had the machada enchiladas and it was excellent and a decent price I believe like 10 for two enchiladas with beans and rice (no fideo for me). My wife had the beef tamales which were good but too spicy for her liking. What I loved the most was the service. I'm speaking for me and my wife as part of this review but we also had my three kids my father in law and his wife,my brother in law and wife and two kids so we had a huge party and no one was disappointed. They brought our food out all at one time in a timely manner and we're all very kind. Our server was Cameron and he didn't miss a beat. The treasure chest they have for the kids was a added bonus and even though it wasn't immaculate toys in it, it was a kind gesture and the kids loved it. Great job Aunt chiladas.

6dvhHw8m6di2RLWZ52NnJw.text: Nice place in the middle of a residential area making it a quaint local spot. Really enjoyed the Pacifico on tap ($4.25/glass) and the Nachos gustivo pequeno ($9.00 for small). A bit pricey but still a fun place.

lcStG_8nOo_QpWvHQQoXtA.text: I was invited to go with friends to a trivia night on Wednesday.  It sounded like it would be fun.  The trivia part was fun and there was a nice sized crowd.  I had a margarita and it was a bit sorry.  Tasted like it was from the cheap mix I drank in college.  Then came the food...it was a soggy plate of nachos with cans of junk dumped on it.  I ordered a taco because I was starving and the nachos were inedible.  The taco was soggy and greasy.  While the Trivia night was fun and i will go back...I think I will get a beer and try something else next time.

94VnhTuRmnnGiYGsMfHZ3g.text: Had dinner on a Monday night. They weren't real busy. We had called 4 hours earlier to get a table for 12. They were not set up for us when we arrived. The dining area was about 25% full but they had to take 15 minutes to put a table together, by the fireplace. We had to have them turn the fireplace off as it was too hot.  Drinks ordered and it took another 15 minutes to get any of them to our table.  I tried to order Huevos Rancheros which is not on the dinner menu. Other mexican restaurants will normally make this. Not Aunt Chilada's. The waiter said the chef would chew him out if he took any special order to the kitchen. Again, they were not busy and they have Huevos Rancheros on their weekend breakfast menu.  I've eaten at this restaurant before when visiting Phoenix. This was by far the worst experience of all from the service to the food and just the general attitude about us as customers.

fqUXWod-x63snpoajZ5RhQ.text: Marie, our amazing and professional bartender/server was friendly and helpful when deciding on food and drinks! The service was fast and friendly and the food was delicious! Come get your ice cold beers and amazing Street tacos here!

ut7mb9evfAEnam-Tt7KiqQ.text: We just moved to the neighborhood and went yesterday for happy hour. The atmosphere is awesome for any occasion. The service was friendly and quick. The food was outstanding! My husband had the Mexican pizza, I had the lettuce wraps, & our friend had the mini chimis (they have a different name on the menu like chingalinga). Nothing was too spicey and after I left I didn't feel overfull or have a stomach ache which is rare bc I'm pregnant. The chips are literally to die for!! I'm thinking of walking over just to buy a bag to take home.!

_lrgCs_2Ny_EWl7iVEtg9g.text: Aunt Chiladas is the place to be. This restaurant is a phoenix staple, been here forever. Nadia, well she'll welcome you with a smile and start your dining experience off right.

VIbG6wN5dI8rXJKv5lgAlg.text: I'm giving four stars because I love to drink and Aunt Chilada's is one of my favorite places to drink. The food is OK, not good but not bad (I'm from Southern California so my standards for Mexican food are very high and sadly the food here doesn't cut it enough for that fifth star)  But the place is so cool that I would bring anyone here despite the fact that I could have better food elsewhere. Every time I come here in fact, it seems like I discover yet another dinning room that I didn't know existed. You have THREE bars to choose from, my personal favorite being the outdoor bar by the bocce ball court. It has a cool tropical feel that almost makes me feel like I'm at a resort bar (the resort bar where all the drunks hang out)  The servers are always friendly and the crowd that hangs out at that bar are always a good time. It's just a fun place to hang out and people watch. I love to come here and get my drink on.  The bonus for me is that I live pretty close so as long as I don't ever stumble on to 16th street into oncoming traffic, I could probably walk home.

rKcYOm3k_DPuAn0pvurqZw.text: Quintessential  and kitschy old-school Arizona. The food, while old-school Mexican, is actually decent and props for offering fideo.  I'm willing to overlook the fact that it can smell like cats or my grandma's place because of the building's pretty interesting history.

_mgh31jSOSetv17u3CiC4g.text: We (my 4 year old daughter and I) were seated right away at a very cute table on the patio, we were greeted with water and chips and salsa almost immediately. Our server was Carlos, he was very very busy, but tended to our every need like we were the only table there. There was another man that completely impressed me, he wore a completely different attire than the rest of the staff, he wore a red collard shirt and red cap, he was running food and clearning tables, asking how dinners were and if he could bring them anything else, if this was a manager, your team is very lucky to have a hands on guy like him. The tortilla soup was amazing and the fried icecream, to die for.

35lhPAoBMroqmjrwvo9cAQ.text: There are many Mexican restaurants you could go to in Phoenix.  Most of them are very similar with the menu and flavors.  I put this one above most.  The food is good, the menu has everything you would expect to find and a few you might not.  But the atmosphere and service put this place high on my list.  I really enjoy the mix of chips you get.  Some fluffy some crisp.  Yum,,,

r5kH-_s1ihi0v4CXvnqbcQ.text: A little run down from when I was there about 10 or so years ago but the food and service was very good! Margaritas ok and the $25.00 dollar Cadillac with aged Grand Mariner good but didn't quite make the $25 price in size or taste even with the nice glass to take home! Pretty slow and quiet but what isn't  in PHX in August!!

9m-zHG9r7CT17BWJgSZOYg.text: If only more restaurants could be like Aunt Chilada's. I'm happy that I have been able to visit several times and look forward to many more visits in the future!  First of all, this place is oozing with history. Did you know that long before Arizona was even a state, this establishment used to be a brothel? Yes, a brothel! Well now, it's of course the furthest thing from a brothel but you can still feel the history living in the walls and parts of the restaurant feel like stepping into a different decade all together.  Second of all, the environment. If there's a restaurant that screams party, this is it and I'm talking about a party for all ages. Whether you're visiting with family and looking for a lively establishment with plenty of patio seating, fun games and hearty food, or you're out with friends eager to share some laughs over margaritas, live music and trivia night, this restaurant's got your covered. This is the ideal restaurant for large parties, private parties and more. They have two very large patios with two outdoor bars, a huge indoor bar area, a spacious main dining room and a more private dining room in the back (that happens to be the original building that housed the brothel!)   Third, let's talk about the activities. This restaurant knows how to keep their guests entertained! They have live music, trivia nights, bocce ball tournaments, chocolate fountains on Sundays, and special events including a fiesta bash on Cinco de Mayo...just to name a few.   Fourth and finally, the food. The food is solid Americanized Mexican food. The Nachos are hefty, the pollo Fundido is cheesy & creamy and the quesadillas are a good greasy (the kind you want when eating a quesadilla). This food is exactly what I would expect and hope for when visiting Aunt Chilada's. It's the perfect type of food for this family-friendly, fiesta inspired establishment.   PS - did you know that these fine folks also happen to own Rustlers Rooste...that awesome cowboy establishment in Tempe complete with a live bull, slide and two stepping? Yes, these folks know how to have fun!

6an0ys2taKKX7AormhdtEg.text: Was here for the 5th meeting of the Breakfast Club UYE. Such a great group with a few regulars and a rotating band of others. I always enjoy meeting new people and it is good to see the regulars as always. It being Cinco De Mayo month a Mexican theme was chosen and Aunt Chilada's was the place. I have been to the Tempe location a few times but I think I might prefer this one. The patio area was really great. The weather was perfect to sit outside. Probably the last time it will be. I like the fact that the main restaurant has been there forever. I like historic old buildings. We sat down and a few others trickled in. Our waitress brought us out the chips and salsa and also informed us to not leave the table unattended because the birds will have no problem stealing your chips. She took our drink orders and once everyone was seated and ready our food orders. I settled on the Chorizo con Huevos with the eggs over easy. My food was very good. According to the menu the dish contained Jesus's homemade chorizo which was "heavenly", wacka wacka. I have never had this before but the eggs with the meat was very good. It was all stacked on a crispy blue corn tortilla. It came with a side of re-fried beans which had a little bit of a skin on them but once I stirred them up they were fine. The entire meal was delicious. They do include a chocolate fountain with all breakfasts but I am not that into fruit so just had a few chocolate covered marshmallows. I will say that the service was a little slow but with all of the great conversations going on it was a little hard to notice. Plus it did take a little while to get our checks and get them paid but the waitress did split them up for us which they don't usually do for a group as big as ours. Overall she did a great job for having two large parties plus other tables to deal with. I would like to go back again and try the other breakfast items plus maybe some of the dinner selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo con Huevos. Very good.

fAIABCNsBZn7zl9m6JCkVQ.text: Aunt Chilada's had me at the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips are tasty, made out of flour. Then there's the blended margaritas. They have the perfect kick. The food was also delicious. Can't get enough of the cheese. I like that some dishes serve fideo as the side instead of rice. The only bummer: I haven't been able to try the flan. They always seem to be out when I'm there.

3-ZtxKGqZpjSSv6dElKm9w.text: This place is amazing year after year! Authentic and delicious food! The service was great too! Compliments to the chefs

VtHGV4FaQc0IR1UCwVT7kA.text: The flour tortilla chips are a nice change from traditional corn. Other than that, the food is ok. The pomegranate margarita was tasty but overpriced, as was the food.

T9I_SZeROtP50qj2sYx0lQ.text: We were in Phoenix over the weekend for a swim meet and we came here on a recommendation from another family on a different team.  We had a large table and everyone left happy and full!  First, the chips and salsa were delish!  Our meals were top notch! Best Chili Relleno I have EVER had!  Then the kids found the chocolate fountain, Oh my!   The chef came out and gave us a history of the restaurant.  We had alot of fun and enjoyed our meal.  We highly recommend Aunt Chilada's. Cant wait to be in the area again for another swim meet! We will be back!

MKaCyFmYaglZjn_lgWXWdw.text: Love the homemade chips and salsa!! The hostess Nadia was so friendly and gave us a great seat!! The restaurant has great food and a fun and upbeat feel to it. This is definitely our go to local Mexican food spot!!

iuEow-SqNujHIcD73EESNA.text: This was the best dining experience that I have had in forever. Our server Angel was amazing....Great customer service- fast and efficient, on top of drink refills, split the check with no hassle ect.  Food was delicious. Loved learning about the history of the restaurant and the area.

YhzRELEZgRsEM1C4WsnglQ.text: Classic Mexican fare with a little twist.  Fideo is a nice touch that went over well with my adolescent daughters.  The signature dish has to be the chipotle cream chicken.  Wait staff was a little slow, but responsive and engaging.  Margaritas were good, too.

opUGjPZ2wRdyImS2Xpi6aQ.text: Best chips and salsa in the wide world and delicious hand-tossed margaritas. The staff is incredibly friendly, and the atmosphere is impressive. Do yourself a favor and order the Creamy Chipotle Chicken. You're welcome.

idtg-yk5RCFr1Rp9dfz_bw.text: When the Chris Parker Project plays, Aunt Chilada's is a pretty good time, but the food is just so-so. They use fideo and beans as regular sides, but you can sub other sides with no charge.  Our menu: Spinach enchiladas Chicken tacos Chicken enchilada Fideo Rice Refried beans House margarita Margarita w/Tres Generaciones and Grand Marnier Chips + salsa  Spinach enchiladas were mushy and flavorless - probably frozen spinach and too much cheese. Chicken enchiladas were so-so, a little heavy on the sauce.  Tacos and chips were great - flaky, made fresh, good eats. The salsas were both pretty tasty - one chunky and one smooth and spicy.  Both margaritas were pretty good and not expensive. Sounds like Aunt Chilada's is good for sitting at the bar, drinking, and eating chips while you listen to the band. Go elsewhere for dinner.

Ke7jF6NenLVmii2AwVvfEw.text: We have been to Aunt Chilada's twice in the last month and each visit was extremely enjoyable.  On the last visit, we sat outside close to the bocce ball court, of which we took advantage to play several games while waiting for our meal.  The chips and salsa are awesome (we all actually like black olives in our salsa, so that is a nice addition to perk it up), with the homemade flour chips our favorite.  My margarita on the rocks was nice and tart.  My daughter and I both got the chile relleno plate; the relleno had just enough spicy heat with a light, crisp batter coating.  My husband said his chicken quesadillla was great, and my son, who is not into Mexican food, had a burger that was cooked perfectly medium.  Tres leches cake made a perfect ending to our meal, and there was enough so that all 4 of us had a healthy portion.  This gem of a restaurant is hidden away off the beaten path... I'm glad we found it!

T6gG0o-43f-b2c63rofTHw.text: Ate here on a Wednesday night. We were staying across the street at the Hilton and it was nice to be able to walk there. Food was average. The flour tortilla chips were good. The service was fast. Price was reasonable. Not sure who thought it was a good idea to serve pasta with mexican.

MyADXHGBGixVZgSa0sXW3Q.text: Great old AZ, neighborhood Mexican restaurant.  Great atmosphere and food and Margaritas, I love this place!!

dzt0jX75R5T21lD4co7avQ.text: Not good. The patio is top notch for relaxing if the weather's good but I couldn't shake that chain feeling when inside. Table and chairs had a slightly sticky feeling to them (nice, eh?). Food was typical pre-cooked, oven heated dollop of too much grease and cheese. Not impressed. It's a shame cause the garden and even the nachos & salsa had me expecting big things.

rnBlzx9y03S08t4CcBxzig.text: I really enjoyed this place.  They had some real good food.  Felt very authentic... or at least southwest mexican good!

g2199TOvYFKvVNPQr-TpaA.text: I am giving the Margarita's 4 stars. The food on the other hand gets 2. A pitcher of marg with a tequila upgrade (Hornitos) cost &28.00. It is the best marg I have found in Phoenix and it is cheap in comparison. The happy hour is great, they have free food that is actually better than entree you might order. The patio is usually full of people having a good time. If you want a marg and a superb outdoor seating arrangement this is your spot. If you want food food with that marg try Los Dos Molino's.

0996sUujBQq6_Tg819qRgA.text: We tried this restaurant, because we had just arrived at the Arizona Grand Resort and wanted a family friendly restaurant on the resort grounds.  We were surprised by the friendly environment, good food and terrific service.  All of us enjoyed our meals, whether they were house specials or your American-ized combination plates.  A laid back environment with good Mexican food and good margaritas.  It really hit the spot after a 5 hour road trip!

ihqTx6bk9dkxZyLiYLGMqw.text: Great happy hour and building.  Fantastic homemade ginger ale.  They have a fun trivia league on Wednesday.  The service is a bit slow when they get super busy, but the staff are really nice.  Their chihuahua contest in the summer is pretty fun as well.

WtEyCmSD_gYJMLO24RERMA.text: The food here is not good.  Let's just start with that.  It does have great outdoor seating though and they allow you to reserve tables for happy hour.  We often will walk down there and have a drink, grab some free food from the happy hour buffet and head home.  I never go to eat dinner or anything, but really enjoy just sitting outside with a beer.

um0hRtEvIOAxa-MlX437fA.text: We eat here quite often.  My parents absolutely love this place, so this is their place of choice when it comes to mexican food.  The salsa and flour chips are absolutely amazing, but the entree dishes are just okay to good.  The service here is hit or miss.  Overall, a good place.  A very cool patio during the nice months of the year.  Just don't expect to eat the mexician food ever here.

KZeGlWdTO4lBX5rAQSpGMw.text: While my food was great,  I definately didnt enjoy the service.  We waited and waited and waited 45 mins for our food & drinks.  I felt like our waitress forgot we were there.  However she was super attentive when it was time for us to pay...

JuSA3sPhIRfIzYM1Rv1FRg.text: I was here a good 10 years ago.  Service and food was great back then.  My how things go bad so quickly!  First thing that set me off was nothing has changed in 10 years and it looks like a few things need repaired.  The wait was about a half hour.  My son almost fell after sitting in a broken chair.  Finally we were seated.  The homemade chips were good but the bottom ones were store bought.  The old put the store bought chips on the bottom trick.  I should have walked then but everyone was tired of waiting and hungry.  My son is a picky eater to say least.  I ordered a cheese quesadilla for my kid.  I specifically told the waitress, NO ONIONS, NO TOMATOES, and NOTHING BUT CHEESE.  I even told her if he finds one it will cause an incident.  She seemed to understand. The food I ordered was OK.  I had to use my salsa to make it a little hotter.  I can eat fire so this is no surprise.  My son's cheese quesadilla had tomatoes in it.  At first I told him it was just one and I picked it off.  Then he kept finding them in every slice.  I called the waitress over and explained.   She apologized and took the plate back.  A few min. went by and the waitress had the NERVE to come out and ask if it was just one.  I had already told her it had tomatoes all over in it.  At this time I felt humiliated by her actions and told her just bring a cheese crisp and I'll pay the difference.  It took a while for that to get to our table but all was OK.  While we ate a waiter dropped a napkin bringing food to another table.  When he came back I thought he'd pick it up after almost tripping on it himself.  Nope, he left it there so someone else could trip on it.  He came back a few minutes later so I flagged him down and let him know about the napkin.  Instead of saying "oh I'll pick it up right away."  The waiter boomed in a very loud voice how sorry he was and it would never happen again.  He was loud enough for everyone to hear in the room.  Again, I felt humiliated.  I guess not wanting the restaurant to get sued because some waiter won't pick up a napkin was asking too much.  The waitress did comp my sons food.  I will never go back.  At one time that area had some very nice places.  The area had CLASS.  That's not the case anymore.  5/10/14

EJ5qZpXuPK6wAe0gCEVoGQ.text: This place is horrible unless all you want to do is drink alcohol. Nothing but poor service and poorly cooked food. We were not greeted upon entering and had to tell them that we wanted to be seated. We were then brought to a dining room that had ball of the ambience of a school hall with plastic table clothes included. Our server was not even closely familiar with the food or food preparation. When asked how the fideo was prepared, she said, "they cook it".  Thanks captain obvious. My husband asked if there was anything spicy and she said the steak and jalapeno fajitas were. He then asked if anything else was and she said "Well, the steak and jalapeno fajitas are".....she does not belong waiting on people.  So the food. The food is microwaved!! Soggy, gross enchilada, mushy and dry tamale, lackluster salsa, fideo that had been in a steam pan since yesterday. The highlight was the almost average fajitas.  No bueno !

r8zrjBsHYkojCW2w6hh0Gg.text: Atmosphere is fun; food no different than Mexican restaurants elsewhere (even Boston - Borders Cafe has better food). The chips might have been the worst we have had. We were expecting more given all the hype. And all the other reviews. Since this seems to be a chain, maybe we just had a bad experience at this specific one.

sC165N2SYO8rJggNr8XW2Q.text: I give this place one star, begrudgingly. The only good thing about this place was the ambiance and the service at the bar. I am appalled by the service we had at the table. I have never been treated so badly. We had a party of 6, and we chose a table on the patio. The patio was really cool and full of party goers, mostly large groups of people. We sat for about an hour and a half without a server, so we got our drinks from the bar.  No big deal.Finally we decided we wanted some food, so a member of our group flagged down a waitress. Big mistake! The server, Cindy, was the WORST! She was so rude. She explained that no one knew whose table ours was, so no one waited on us. My sister tried to order and she snapped at her, "I am waiting until everyone is ready to order!" I suggested maybe we should order from the bar and then she snapped at me, "You cannot order from the bar! You have to order from me." We ordered our food and, after several eye rolls, Cindy left our table. I seriously should have talked to a manager because she was so rude to our party. She continually rolled her eyes when we ordered drinks. The food came and it was awful. I ordered the shrimp tacos. They were completely dry and almost inedible.  I will never go back to this establishment. I cannot believe the treatment we received. This woman should not be in the service industry. I would think, in this economy, there are plenty if servers who would have wanted to wait on a party like ours. We spent $200 at table, not even counting the drinks we got at the bar. We are all upper middle class people; there was no reason Cindy would have thought we would not have tipped her well. I always give servers the benefit of the doubt; I was a server for 10 years, so I understand they have bad days. But this behavior was inexcusable and shocking. Cindy was the rudest server I have EVER had. I cannot even explain it in words. It wasn't what she said, it was the condescending tone, eye rolling, and abrupt responses.

U7Bi5QriQWjBNMLYzsNyhQ.text: I have been visiting this restaurant for many years and have been present for the changing of the menu almost 4 times! I remember the food being better, so I have been upset with some of the changes, however, I will still make this a once a week stop.  The chips and salsa are AWARD WINNING and for GOOD REASON.  Ask for the flour chips only.  They are the reason to visit this restaurant.  Their chicken quesadilla is amazing and their food is decent, but definitely go for the chips & salsa.  You'll pay a bit much for the food, but it is definitely worth it.  Just remember to come for dinner early if you are visiting on a Wednesday or a Friday or there's only street parking available.  The bar gets to be pretty packed on these nights.

DtM53nnQiozmx-UHhjHJBw.text: This was a tough call for me. I could have just as easily and with valid reason given it three stars or, for completely different reasons, five stars. So I decided to hedge my bets and go with four.  Here's why: the food is average at best, but the ambiance is outstanding and the happy hour is superb.   In terms of straight up Mexican cuisine, this place doesn't even approach what some other nearby spots have to offer. But, their indoor/outdoor patios are always a good time, they have great live music, and a happy hour with free munchies to boot.   Cherry on top: their chips are awesome. They cook them in house and bring them out for free with your drink order.

33-h8ASAplFlp5OKN03Xpg.text: Came in for a late lunch around 2:00pm the place was pretty much empty. The chips and salsa was great, ask for the hot sauce it's really good. All the food tasted great. We all really love the fideo it's like a Mexican pasta it comes in place of rice, it's full of flavor. The service was pretty much nonexistent, maybe due to the time we came in. The order was taken fast, food was delivered fast and check was dropped off fast. There was no check back, no offer of more chips, and no can I get you anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco,tamale, and enchilada.

Ymh-TXnhAsLR63I9eEGnwg.text: I loved the service and the food. I really enjoyed the shrimp tacos and my husband got the seafood burrito. We enjoyed the time we never been but we went with a group of like 20 and yet the service was awesome.

ug-LRDzPu2mEP2lbuw26QQ.text: The food was not that good, very bland taste. The service was terrible also. Won't be going back.

JJAn3P4EX4XpbE3WCoATOQ.text: An awesome time always. Madison made me feel so welcome. I love this patio. Especially when the temp is in the 80's. Living the life.

ui1a4l0a19s7cK6_ti-BhA.text: Waiter was terrible food was terrible and I celebrate my birthday and it turned out terrible and drove a long ways to come here and was not satisfied overcharge on our bill and try to straighten it out but the waiter kept giving us a hard time waste of a trip and I ruined birthday

JI7n4PKQwzUaQFaRH7SktA.text: Amazing food. Amazing service. Huge portions. Will definitely be back. Thanks for making us feel so at home while on vacation.

5gi8jHYObuOZpbKy10r_vQ.text: Here for Cinco de Mayo!! Place is a joke... Go somewhere else!! Made us pay a cover and there are no specials... Margaritas taste like water and service is nearly non existent... Way to rip us off due to the holiday!!!

bWreXVDGTa8vj7Ki1fKxnw.text: I've eaten here both times and have gotten food poisoning each time. It's really quite a feat. I tried it the second time because a friend loved it and asked me to give it another shot.  Water bottles they bring to the table have a ring of dirt caked around the lip.  Cleanliness of this establishment is questionable at best. I ordered the green corn tamale both times and have spent my night gripping the toilet and cursing this place.

HH5MN4CZbaZ2WKWRq-KVuw.text: My wife are in town from NY and staying across the street and found Aunt chiladas. We love Mexican food and could not have had a better experience. The service was excellent and the food was amazing. Our server KP was very personable and gave us lots of advice and suggestions for which touristy things to do (as which not to). Extremely reasonable pricing, especially the beer!! If I'm ever back in Arizona we're definitely going back!

4LVz_mHD-tcQTqJurvFJnw.text: Very sad. Slip, slip, slippin' away... And, quickly. I note the progression of my reviews in just the last 2-3 months moving down.  The server was ebullient but was slow to check back to see what was needed. She kept coming to a table 2 away but would turn her back and walk away from our table vs. giving a glance to check for empty beverage glasses.  Sunday night and the crowd started to shuffle in closer to 7 p.m.  Chicken fajita quesadia was meh. And, that's the thing: for "American-ized" Mexican food, Aunt Chilada's - this one, not the awful one in Tempe - was usually consistent and on their game. Quality is starting to be noticeably less than over all the years (been coming here since mid 80s).  Used to be on The List to seek out when nearby and hungry. No longer on that list.  Sad.

LRH6xJeLvhH1aqfmjioRyg.text: Great food, good drinks and an incredibly cool atmosphere. The live music on Friday's makes for such a fun treat! I always take friends from out of town here. The staff are all super nice, and the service is prompt! This is a neighborhood favorite for me!

XGFbuQaTNLKoyScdgV5s2w.text: This hidden gem located in the heart of central Phoenix apparently has been around long before most establishments in the area were even a dream. They make you feel like family, the place is bustling, the food is down home, and the ambience is top notch.  I came on a Tuesday night, the patio misters we're going strong, the bar was full with team trivia, the dining room was bustling with families. I had the rib special and it knocked my socks off. I'd be back every night if not for the corn alone. If you truly want a taste of what Phoenix is; stop by with your family and friends and start a new family tradition at this crazily fantastic family owned joint.

Un03VG9QdmU8T4mHqSz2pA.text: Real Frat Bar scene.  Bad drinks, worse service.  Bar so bad it's an insult.  Sure, the place is a bit crowded, but that's no excuse for repeatedly sloppy service.

_RjKKiCbqhrvS9Uvoe8y3w.text: For my money, it's the best Mexican food in Phoenix. Wonderful outdoor patio and terrific service staff. I always get the seafood enchilada. It is absolutely the best!

hHOQTOHUugTRYWkjR1-Lhw.text: Meet my cousins from out of town here for lunch with our families. Fajitas were amazing. We took a table for about 7 hours catching up and the staff was great. The ping pong tables were an added bonus for the kids.

bBT7fSLOXIwdSQlVF587Aw.text: Good food and margaritas, and the patio is a great place to dine al fresco. Be advised that if you are vegetarian or vegan, you're pretty well limited to the vegan fajitas, but the good news is that they are delicious!

6bbk-IzzCUrv0Kmb5nD43g.text: Really nice place. Good food, great service.   My wife and daughters all give the food a three. I give it a strong four. It's a matter of do you like the taste.  Everyone gives the service a big thumbs up.the fajitas are good quality steak cooked medium rare.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-8hInEiDLgS_gYHrV1ds3w.text: Loved the casual atmosphere and the food was yummy! A park across the street so the kids can play after

pDSeW4mK6X2Qb4BTWLS26g.text: Staying at a local hotel and was recommended Aunt Chiladas by our Uber driver. The outdoor patio ambiance was nice but we got a side outdoor area that felt a bit secluded from the nicer scene. The drinks and food was fine. I'm mostly downing the stars because of their lack of gluten free knowledge. Their menu clearly identifies gluten free or gluten modified items yet the server wasn't fully aware of the ingredients in the menu items. When the chips arrived, there was zero mention that they mix flour and corn tortillas. Of course I bit I to a flour chip the first bite. The food was fine, nothing to brag about but the lack of gluten knowledge (especially having pointed GF items out in the menu) really brought down the experience for me here.

UEGHOJ9PeAq_pcQx_yNATg.text: Five stars for the customer service. I called with less than 24 hours and requested the patio for 50+ people. They easily accommodated us and were so helpful in pre-ordering appetizer platters.  The day of, our servers, Emily and Brittany, were excellent. Got all of our orders and service was very quick. We'll definitely be back the next time we have a corporate event.

F3406-2kjdUqSXRy-SPG_Q.text: Black Olives in Salsa. Who does that? And the hot sauce tastes like BBQ sauce. Seating is very uncomfortable. You sink down in the chairs. This is our third time here as we usually give a place 2-3 chances. Doubt we'll be back.

jDCxUg1xPoSYjZCwFjBeOg.text: I enjoyed my meal but my wife and kids prefer corn tortillas instead of flour. Reasonable price and friendly staff.

0hlq45QzR2yMWyjTt1MxNw.text: Didn't expect much but loved it! Charming interior and food was very good. Salsa and fresh but rather mild. My daughter loved the treasure chest filled with surprises.

VN3O8in4hj_ZXEUl1tfIjA.text: Great time here. Had the Street Tacos that were delicious. Stayed a bit after dinner for drinks and Sarah took the best care of us. Will return again.

sh7WeM-uBnsnNS_-oR3F-Q.text: Chingalingas are my go-to and are yummy (I request no sauce).  Lots of different options here - all good.  Ever had flour tortilla chips and salsa?  They're a nice change of pace.  Prices are reasonable and service is good.  My orders are always correct.  Best to go for lunch or off peak times - happy hours are really crowded here.

KbvptD1K0Kl5nLF7fomRMA.text: Came from Cali to visit my sister and she has always raved about Aunt Chiladas. Based on her comments we decided to go for dinner. The food was great I give them 5 stars, up until our waitress asked to close out our bill so she could leave because she wasn't feeling well and someone else would help us out. I understand having to go home because someone isn't feeling well. But to have customers sit for 30 minutes with not one waiter/waitress  to come by and check on you is HORRIBLE customer service.

p74HtxxrplIyDveseDOLTQ.text: I had expected more greatness from this place. The salsa was good, service good, atmosphere ok. I was a lone diner, and they sat me back in a dark corner. I had brought a book to read while eating, but couldn't even see the pages.  The best part of the menu was the ceviche. If a restaurant has ceviche, you know the food is good. I cannot resist raw seafood.  The tortilla soup was ok, and the chips and salsa was above average. The chips were REALLY good actually.  The bloody maria (tequila rather than vodka) was also average, nothing special. Heck, it was even on special and the waitress charged me full price. With all the advertising saying this was the best mexican place around, I expected alot better.

f5L31D_x1Jrryu6ESzQVMg.text: Aunt Chilada's is a one-location Mexican-themed restaurant which is basically the in-house restaurant for the Pointe Hilton at Squaw Peak.  The previous local locations have been closed and the North Phoenix location remains.  Already that is a plus in their favor.  Thankfully it has more fun and character and less overpriced food and drink than most hotel restaurants.  It is a decent size and has both indoor and outdoor dining areas. We had a party of about a dozen so it's hard to describe each meal.  Because I had a large late lunch my dinner I had the lettuce wraps, which came in at less than $9 and very filling.  There is a good selection of cold tap beers and of course a full bar.  Service was excellent for a restaurant that does such a large business with business travelers and vacationeers (i.e. snowbirds).  We were there during trivia night so we expected things to be on the loud, rowdy side and they were.  The only negative was after that group left and there were only a few small groups of people, the house did not adjust the background music down to a more appropriate level.  Before posting this I thought I would check out the "worst" reviews (and yes they actually are the worst reviews).  Not surprisingly the stereotype is True that most of them are from towns that are not exactly known for their knowledge and appreciation of Mexican food, you know, where they think Taco Bell is gourmet?  No, in reality, Aunt Chilada's is not gourmet, but it is decently good, the ambiance is great and the wait staff is many steps above average.

kUf7t5tMl8Ush7TwHrxQtQ.text: Excellent meal and service. The guacamole was very fresh and not overly filled with tomatoes or onion. It had a nice round avocado flavor. The chicken tortilla soup is broth based and for $0.75 the amount of avocado served was fantastic. My main entree was the Seafood Enchiladas which were excellent! Both flour and corn chips were served w the salsa. Overall an excellent experience at a super price.

E4DQQXwgob5NmFsF64ao-g.text: Ugh! Mixed review, we loved the beautiful outdoor area but the food was mediocre. I ended up with a small, dark, frizzy dark hair in my plate. Not cool! The waitress was awesome and deducted the charge from the bill. My son thought it wasn't a big deal and encouraged me to see it on the bright side, it's protein! Not sure but I likely will try other restaurants in the area.

gwXgOQLAoGi0V51iQXyunQ.text: Disappointed. Food was awful, not good at all. Tried it once and probably will not come back again. I will go else where for real quality food. Service was blah. Overall, not a good experience. No thank you!

f6uots28-DgNQdWSK5KY7w.text: On Sunday night I had a great experience at Aunt Chiladas. Not only were my fajitas amazing but our server Mario was also very gracious and took good care of my party. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in Phoenix looking for good Mexican food and a fun atmosphere.

Ma2UNF5QPmdKtKqYbwyAlQ.text: Be very careful - watch your wallet and don't listen to the waitress - she will tell you they have $3 specials and then charge you $7!! Food was so-so, I did like the fried flour tortilla chips.  But the red chile burritos are beef and not pork.  They don't serve rice, the pasta like side with carrots and peas is marginal at best. But its the bait and switch happy hour menu you have to be careful of.  They offer a $3 house margarita, but will charge you $7 saying you ordered a "BIG" margarita.  Save your money and go to Carlos O'Briens, Macayos or Top Shelf.

59-sHqOS5L2nbcdEdNBVSw.text: Angel was an excellent server, made our experience incredible!  Excellent food, tasty!  Tacos Jesus delectable. As well as the Piccadillo Enchiladas. Dessert was incredible as well!  Yum!!!

lR1M1mP2Mz9eCQmUKSOyXw.text: Have been here for dinner many times and love the food.  I always get a combination plate that includes rice and beans. The rice is so different and good!  Must try.

1hO100jFi2rBDDisE-tNlw.text: Very good Mexican food in Phoenix, the salsa has black olives in it! The margaritas are very good Nice ambiance and a friendly wait staff

Ate7xFWPlKNCplL7SuvUog.text: Five words: Back Patio, Happy Hour, Friday  First: Back Patio. There are two patios at Aunt Chilada's. One is in the front when you walk in, with a bocce ball court and an outdoor bar. The other is through the restaurant in the back. I recommend this back patio. It's very large - on warmer days they have the misters flowing freely, and the cool strung lights at night. The trees around it make it feel somewhat secluded, and as the temperatures go down, this is the perfect spot to have a margarita or beer.  That being said: Happy Hour and Friday should really go together. During the week, Aunt Chilada's has happy hour snacks for free. Usually enchiladas, chips and salsa, etc. But on Fridays, they step it up 5 notches. The happy hour food goes on the back patio, where you can get chips, usually taco meat, beans, enchiladas, veggie tray, fruit, salsa, etc. for free. They continuously refill the free food while it is happy hour, so don't fret if the enchilada tray is empty.   One of my favorite patios in Phoenix.

T6ZrTwj-Zn3Hyz8RtGkmkA.text: Wow - what a nice surprise!  I hadn't been to Aunt Chilada's in 10 years and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience this evening.  The homemade tortillas and salsa was addictive...I could just eat this for my meal.  I enjoyed a traditional chicken burrito enchilada style with red sauce and cheese...absolutely delicious.  The beans and fideo noodles were fantastic too...so tasty!   I can't wait to go back with our furry friend and enjoy the pet friendly patio.

k-GgexGcEE_1bbY_BBB3mQ.text: Nothing here that we did not like. We ate on the outside patio which was fantastic. There were six of us and every dish we had was well prepared and made us want to go back and try a different dish some other time.  We were there after the main lunch hour, took a long time eating and visiting. We never felt rushed and would like to have the same waitress anywhere we go out to eat

pRsxReIP5-24gyuSzve1yg.text: Salsa and chips are great!  The entrees are hit or miss.  Service is also hit or miss.  Outside bar is a good choice.

zaxfY8wo1d8Vzl7dn4zQNA.text: This was suggested by many people to have dinner. I enjoyed the food and service. I will be back.

igaFa_nuOy4ebP9xNYmWUA.text: I've been here before several times. The food is pretty decent, if a bit pricey, and they make a decent margarita. Tonight we had a group of 30+ people for trivia. They sat us outside as the tables inside were all reserved for regulars. They assigned us 1 waitress to take care of over 30 people. During the 3 hours I was there the waitress never said a word to me. I had to go to the bar to get the 2 drinks I had and never got the food I wanted. Now I was planning on getting a carne asada burrito ($16) and I usually have 3-4 Jack and Cokes ($8 each) so easily $50. Afterwards I talked to people who for the most part were in the same boat, waitress would talk to 1 maybe 2 people and leave for 10 min, so no one ordered anything from her, less than half the people ate, and no one drank like normal. They could have easily pulled $1500 to $2000 in sales and $300 to $400 tip for the wait staff....but giving us only one person, who never was around, and they made less than a quarter of that. I'd say go an enjoy, but realize you're paying extra for it being in a rich neighborhood and go in a small group where you will actually get service.

M6l13i9q1-sgi7UcvUiNtw.text: Super casual, bocce ball on the back patio. Great waitstaff, super friendly and fast (maybe just everyone in Phoenix is that friendly?) gave good advice on the menu too. Margaritas were delicious and my son & I both fajitas (steak and shrimp) and ate every bite, we will be back

16udEJJqXp8Ltf4eQ0hiXA.text: Book a reservation on Yelp, they are always busy.  Fresh made warm chips & delicious salsa.  Ordered the fabulous guacamole, some of the best we've had.  Everything we ordered was really flavorful.  Tortilla soup is cheesy and has the right amount of spice.  Chicken Fundido was the bomb-dido!  Tacos are excellent, fresh fried hard shells.  Kids loved them!  Chicken enchiladas were superb!  Tamales were good- not great, red beef was spicy, green corn was different.  I couldn't tell if they were short handed, but our waitress disappeared for long periods, could have filled our drinks more.  The rest of the staff was very attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

D8yaE9Z9o9jpMTIZbfwdNw.text: went here on a Monday night. AMAZING music and food. if you ever come here ask for a sever named Maggie. she was amazing and was so help. she recommended the chipotle chicken tostada and it was so good. i would like to thank this place so much for everything.

_ChgJPDPZEKb6eE0l45qdg.text: Really good food and margaritas. Service was great, Carlos was running the show. Timing and everything was perfect. Atmosphere is really good, life music on this Friday evening. Patio was poppin'.

7w75urA03sh2vW2dAJqN-A.text: You can tell a lot about a Mexican restaurant by the salsa. This salsa on a scale from 1-10  is a 1. It reminds me of a tomato sauce paste with absolutely no spice. The olives that were in the salsa add no flavor. When we ordered are  drinks they took forever to come to us. Then when we asked are water about what was in the beef taco on the kids menu she replied "just beef" which is fine so we ordered the beef tacos for the kids. Then after a very long wait for are Food the kids tacos came and It wasn't beef tacos they were BEAN tacos. How could they mess that up? The only reason I gave this place 2 stars is because the out door environment was super nice. So my wife who loves Mexican food is right you can tell a lot about a Mexican restaurant from the salsa.

pJHfI5wKY-7G5q4iH9oUqQ.text: Had a 70th birthday party here for 30 people last Sunday.  Michelle was a great help reserving the back patio for us.  The setup was beautiful.  The platters of food we ordered came out on time and everyone enjoyed the food (taquitos were gone first!) and the flour chips and salsa were a big hit.  Ashley (our server) was quick and friendly with everyone's requests.  There was even fun playing table tennis, corn hole, and giant jenga. The patio is a perfect place for any type of gathering and you won't find friendlier staff in many places.

9S4AgNVeCbkYGMcPuQ3h5A.text: I've gone to Aunt Chiladas a few times for team trivia (I love team trivia, and this place is more convenient for my friends) on wednesday nights. Randy, the host, is great: funny with generally good diction and pronunciation. His personality and the easy parking are what keep me coming back.   The tables are small, so it gets a little cramped. The waitresses are nice, but they don't come around often. I get that it gets busy, but it's not THAT busy. The food is perfectly average, definitely more expensive than its worth. I usually get the seafood quesadilla, although the jalapeno steak fajitas are also pretty good. I will say I like their chips though. They're not for everyone, but they are for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeño and steak fajitas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood quesadilla
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary chips and salsa!

WEnlEr3oCfOJhaJ0BUd9bw.text: Drink came late and food came late.  Server was charming to the big group which was nice since we are visiting Arizona.  Provided we were the first to order drinks and food  it came last or forgotten.  Food  was ok nothing that makes it notable.  But will say friendly service / atmosphere.

2SpaX4NeCa7XP4zwSWlsyA.text: On the plus side:  -Atmosphere is awesome. Such a gorgeous place. You feel like you are far away.   -Host staff were super friendly and suggested we choose a table right next to the fountain.  -Music at dinnertime in the dining room was the right volume.  -Homemade flour tortilla chips.  -Good green chile sauce, rice and black beans.  -Cold beer with fresh lime.  -More than 1 vegetarian option, and 1 was even labeled vegan. Wait staff was knowledgeable about which side dishes were vegetarian.  -Prices are reasonable.  -Food arrived quickly.  -Able to accommodate large parties--I could see several.  -Generous portions.  On the con side:  -Was not a fan of the salsa--it tasted like Tostino's from the jar.  -Vegetable burrito was filled with broccoli, cauliflower, carrot and a tiny amount of green pepper. This is a strange assortment of veggies to put in a burrito and did not taste good with the chile sauce. The vegetables were in huge chunks, barely cooked, still crunchy, and unseasoned. It was an enormous burrito meant to be eaten with fork and knife I guess, but served with a butter knife.  -I was going to send the burrito back for additional cooking, but the server didn't come back to check on us until we were ready to leave.  There was a vegan fajita on the menu. I will come back someday and try that.

8KWL0CDAXbqc48FTfp2RjA.text: Aunt Chilada's has always been one our favorites for an authentic Mexican dinner.  If I lived closer I would go there all the time. Reservations were booked, but we just walked in and got seated right away. The chips and salsa were terrific and so was the guacamole. They kept bringing more as we devoured them. We had the chili relleno and green corn tamale, both were delicious. We were impressed by the large portions, good service, and ambiance.  There are a million places in town for Mexican food but for the price I don't think you can do better.

Pix-4t0iYfbJgYl8u59FTQ.text: Fortunately they have brought back the Friday night bands, and the cougar scene seems to be trickling back. The frozen margaritas are perfect, as are the accompanying fresh chips and salsa (the taco sauce is wonderful). The service can be somewhat spotty, but it's a big place with lots going on, and food is always delivered quickly and has always been great. Really an interesting place, perhaps even the quintessential Phoenix experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

B2A7zfIPmLj8dSMN9FVmSA.text: FLOUR TORTILLA CHIPS!! Omg. I'm addicted. Their frozen margaritas are incredible too, especially with some grand mariners floated on top. Their ambience is so nice and relaxing as well. Definitely on my top 3 favorite Mexican restaurants! I stand by the first part of my review.. but after visiting multiple times since then I've realized the food is sub par. Really no good flavor. Sour cream tastes weird. Why do they not have normal rice? Even their guacamole isn't great, which is a big thing for me when it comes to mexican food. The food can be mediocre but as long as I can put some good tasting guacamole I'm normally okay. Kind of a bummer but I will continue coming just for the margaritas and flour tortilla chips.

cFPmaUkg84wZ_GaydIRdoQ.text: Not use to the flour chips...and not a fan I guess.  Food was Good...portions were acceptable  My Burro was warm and spicy.  I was surprised with the spicy green burro.  But, it was good...beans a little runny...  My wife's taco salad...well not quite what she was use to...cold machca was not appealing....

7FeKDh-Sow6XotLHC8BnUA.text: I came here after an awesome scrub down and massage at the spa in our hotel.  It was highly recommended by Coryn in the spa.  For starters we ordered guacamole which was fresh, full of flavor and chopped pico de gallo.  This was a great first impression. They also came with corn and melt in your mouth flour tortilla chips. BEST EVER!!  They were so damn good that I asked for a to-go bag. They were also a perfect match for the spinach queso dip.   As if I had any room in my stomach for anything else the pineapple shrimp came out in a half of grilled pineapple. It was basically shrimp fajitas with pineapples sans the tortillas.  I took it to go and can't wait to devour the leftovers.  If you're in the area come give this spot a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LF_ftgbx7xOALVhTtJbjjA.text: Barf is all I can say which is nice! Chairs and tables falling apart. I placed my light weight jacket on the back of my chair and it fell backwards into the guys lap next to us. Place is horrible.

8TqKSAmKFJIoChcuNXaImg.text: Decided to try it out, and we'll let's see Once is enough. Wasn't impressed with the food or the service. The meat was dry. Chips and salsa could use some work.

Pt2GolGxMRUIy8i7WZ1s_g.text: Comically bad. We actually had a blast but were  stunned by how bad it was given several recommendations. Atmosphere was fun and campy, especially since we were with kids, but food and service was absolutely terrible.

TGM8zWLfJGisAnRmbB-61Q.text: We decided to make the trip up to Aunt Chiladas based upon a combination of Google and Yelp reviews, but will not make a return trip.   The good: the chips are great and the salsa has a nice flavor, albeit devoid of any spice. The food, once ordered, arrived quickly.   The bad: we waited at least 15 minutes for a waitress to even stop by our table. The food was marginal at best. The shrimp taco was tasty, but completely forgettable. The tacos de Jesus were one of the more disappointing meals I've had since moving to Phoenix. Once we received our food, our waitress stopped by before we had even had a chance to try anything to see how we liked it and then never returned. My husband had to get up and go to the front to request our ticket once we had been waiting for over 20 minutes after our meal was finished.

W4a210ltxjdZcxh7BWgcEg.text: Great service at the bar.  Good tequila selection.  Alexa was the very attractive tattooed girl helping me. Also, a helpful guy with glasses was tending bar.  They were equally helpful, however, Alexa was a much prettier woman than the guy with glasses.  -20 years restaurant industry experience

mOp_pVmZJeuFbR-pA-KZ_g.text: Our party of 19 ate here on December 23rd and 15 of us ended up getting food poisoning.  By far one of the worst experiences in my life especially because half of our party were children and sadly Christmas was ruined for all the family's involved in our party.  I am hoping no one else who ate there this day suffered from what our family went through but if anyone else did please know you were not alone in this matter

zLZtQdbsA8jOmJk5xpOHSg.text: I'm just not impressed. The food was fair, the service is fair, the place is fair. I even went there 2 days in a row (cause I was at a seminar) thinking maybe try again. I will not try this place again. You can! Maybe you will try something that is much better than everything I had. Good luck.

Ap2kiqEInsZeZU3AcRMu_g.text: This place has taken a huge dive. Yet another great place down the drain. Why? Probably can't make money paying people 12 bucks to wash dishes. So you cut back on the ingredients. Ride the workers you have harder and wait for the place to crumble. I am not sure who made the menu but if they went to culinary school they must have barely passed.  We were seated in a basically empty dinning room. But do they seat us near the beautiful fire? Nope by the open door letting in the cold. Table was broken too. My wife kept banging her knees on the part that is supposed to be locked up until you want a round table.   You are given a huge bowl is weird looking nastiness. My wife is allergic to gluten. So she takes a bit before I tell her to stop. They have turned flour tortillas into this weird looking sopapilla type item with no sugar or cinnamon or taste. You get to add tasteless salsa too!  We were told the corn chips are hidden underneath. Why? Heck if I know. When you find them they are straight from the bag.   I get the street tacos with machacca.  I do not know if they run all the meat through the same wood chipper or what. I am used to machacca being shredded. What I got was ground like beef and full of bad fatty meat. No taste there either. By the time I get to the third and wondering why I am bothering the corn tortilla has become so soaked with grease that it fell apart. That made not eating the third one easy.  I gave them 2 for the pretty building. If you like pretty buildings and lost your taste buds in a horrible accident you are going to love this place. The rest of you.  AVOID!  WARNING the next day I noticed my brand new shirt and pants had been ruined. They looked like they got bleach stained. I used the bathroom here and I think they bleached the counters but don't wipe clean. I lost 100 bucks in clothing. By far the WORST experience ever.

zUP3oZVbEt59NfsnLyuEwA.text: I give it a 3 for the ambiance and the cheese crisp being spectacular. Service needs a lot of work. I think our waitress spoke 3 sentences to us last night. We had to flag random servers a couple of times to get more water and chips as she never checked on us. We actually wanted dessert but she dropped the check without saying anything so we figured she didn't want us there anyway and got dessert somewhere else. I hate complaining, however I'm seeing terrible service becoming a trend everywhere so unless people complain nothing will ever get fixed. People work too hard to spend their money at establishments that don't take good care of them.

eD3TPDhF-6RhX-xD_CqDpQ.text: I've been here a handful of times. The first was after hiking Squaw Peak, running to Camelback, then hiking Echo Canyon. That day Aunt Chiladas' beers were ice cold and never tasted better. Other times I've visited were for dinner. Chips and salsa are awesome. Dinner plates were plentiful and delicious. Desserts were also amazing. Looks like they also expanded to accommodate private parties.

V6cKoH5BcAB2PWOktXTkGw.text: We threw a 70th birthday party for my best friend of 50 years in May. For a variety of reasons we required a lot of accommodations (speakers, a mic, projector, screen for a slide show...and lots of margaritas.) And boy did they really came through for us! But here's the kicker, we brought all of that equipment with us from California, but couldn't get it to work. So Steve, the manager stepped up and offered to loan us their equipments...which worked beautifully. Michelle, our event planner was excellent as well; responsive, helpful and creative in problem solving.  Even though the whole restaurant was very busy that night we had excellent service and attention. The food was FABULOUS, the atmosphere was ideal and the party was a big success. I told them at the end of the event that I was going to write a rave review, that they had earned, and I hope this lives up to it. They deserve it.  I wish I could have given 6 or 7 stars.   BTW, my husband was in the hospitality business for 40 years, so we know a bit about great service and Aunt Chiladas delivered. Too bad they're not in the SF Bay Area! If my review isn't clear, then I hope this is: I HIGHLY recommend Aunt Chiladas (the one on Dreamy Draw,) especially for special events.

stahl3NZPz5pAa31lmcvKg.text: I have dreams of aunt chiladas' fried dishes... Dear god - they are good. I was recently staying up the road for a business trip and visited here twice... If i had stayed longer, i would have gone again. The salsa was a bit odd with olives in it, but the flavor was good, and it's hard to go wrong dipping into it with fresh fried tortilla chips. I'm sure i gained an extra ten lbs each time i ate here, but i'd go again no doubt.  Service here really depends on the wait staff. The first time we went, the waitress was amazing and attentive; the second... Lets just say we waited 30 mins for her to pick up the credit card to pay.

sLtW00ENzO-KF5z6Pmx7hA.text: We stayed at the Hilton Squaw peak, the employees highly recommended Aunt Chiladas. We  went over that evening and we were super hungry, grandkids were with us along with my wife and daughter in law. Our waiter was TANNER wow he was really awesome. We had food questions and he explained everything in great detail. He was very attentive, knowledgeable, friendly. We gave our orders and then the food arrived quickly!!!!!!! Wow it was fantastic, we loved the flour tortilla chips, salsa was handmade, I had the carnitas tacos, grandson had fish tacos (great) grand daughter had the machaca chimi, grammy had the machaca tacos, all dishes were excellent. Nearly all of there food is scratch made.A couple nights later we went back again, TANNER wasn't working but the food was great again, svc was good. We will be back again soon,

g0lv1VbtVvjX1TpOhcdvdg.text: One of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long time. Makes TacoBell taste like 5star dining.   The restaurant is Chaotic and dirty with poor quality ingredients and quite a few service flaws.

uLZFpCnokeFRyvbDRY_qOw.text: This seriously is my new favorite place. I can't believe I've never been there before. The place is HUGE and the service was amazing. Tiffany the manager is so personable and will love sharing the history of the restaurant. So cool.  Can't wait to go back!!!!!!

oV8BTBaVxRLLi3zuhZKKCg.text: If you're from the area, Aunt Chilada's feels like a home for all Phoenix natives. If you're not, everyone is welcoming and the atmosphere is great. With an extremely spacious patio filled with tvs and a bocce ball court. The food is good, the price is around a date night price, not an every night out kind of realm. I'd suggest it to anyone while the weather is still nice, because the patio is worth the trip.

Zbjnx4-KB7NN_Joxp_DJfQ.text: Ana was a real server.  Although my grandparents did not speak english, and she did not speak spanish, she still managed to make them feel welcome. Try the shrimp pineapple and the pollo fundido. It was also such a nice environment.   Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food was amazing.  Try the pineapple stuffed shrimp and ask for Ana.
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ana was an outstanding server.

Gd0gN2uAQleYa01fKcSCqQ.text: We had my moms celebration of life here, Michelle did a excellent job working within our budget and the event was wonderful and the food was good.

NqeH8kFPPbrdaOiHUkYQYQ.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere, great staff, especially Madison. She was attentive and efficient and made our time they're very very entertaining. Thanks to all at this wonderful place, we'll be back.

l4P7w5vfvGHimNbw2Fm9xw.text: I first visited this restaurant back in the mid 1990s and enjoyed everything about it -- the setting, the ambiance, the food, the staff, and the entire experience of being in a historic setting.  Being that I reside in southern California, I hadn't really enjoyed the opportunity of returning until now.  Exactly as I recalled!  This visit, I brought a friend who is a new citizen of Phoenix.  We both raved at how Aunt Chiladas is a tremendous step up from your average Mexican food eatery -- on many levels.  The staff was friendly and attentive -- especially our waiter, Patrick.  We modified our choices slightly off- menu, and Patrick offered suggestions that might enhance our orders.  He knows his stuff!  My friend told me he'll be bringing people in whenever they visit, and thanked me for finding the place for him.  Kudos!

_MQHMEnYNVztZWvG7u3BKQ.text: First time stopping in. The atmosphere is very laid back. The food was amazing! Great portions for reasonable prices. Our bartender Madison was great! Very attentive! We will be back again for sure!

zaM38Xava1MUMww64Zlj7Q.text: Over the top service, ambiance and food! It is causal with a southwestern flair. If you have a chance, ask the 4th generation? owner/manager about the HISTORY of this Iconic Phoenix Mexi-eatery.  The bar is comfortable (we ate at the bar 1st time in-we were there for an event...-) Had the Jesus Tacos-- great stuff! Had to come back and try more of the menu-- and it just so happened that Hatch Green were in season, and Gr Chile stew was the featured item that evening-- my personal favorite. I also bought some roasted/peeled Hatch for take -home-- I would recommend this place if you have out of towners and want to show them a GREAT example of Arizona style mexi-cuisine. Family-Owned and operated AGAIN, Thank goodness!

qs8L78doK093d2J2jOP-Jg.text: Two words: chocolate fountain. Two more words: TORTILLA CHIPS. Let me elaborate. FLOUR tortilla chips. They're incredible. Like, can't stop eating them incredible. They're like little triangles of heaven melting on your tongue. Salsa, guac, hot sauce, it's doesn't matter! I eat them plain! By the handful! I actually dipped the tortilla chips IN the chocolate fountain.  But I'm getting ahead of myself. The decor at Aunt Chilada's is rainbow cactus chic. Not a dull table or view from anywhere in the restaurant. The service is top notch. You can tell a lot of people have been working here a while which makes me believe they treat the staff well. The plates of food are large, complete with refried beans, pico de gallo, lettuce and cheese. All of which you can scoop up with the TORTILLA CHIPS FROM GOD.  But really, the food here is incredible. The chocolate fountain is on Sundays for brunch. And the tortilla chips are all the damn time. It seems a bit off the beaten path, but well worth the drive. It is a must-go every time I'm in the area. Go forth and salivate.

ztWPuvqcpyzajJfYcVqTVA.text: Look at me varying my locations.  I left Scottsdale.. holy cow some of my friends would say!  ;)   I was prompted to hit up this place by two girlfriends who live nearby.  So I ventured out.   I hit up the Happy Hour here.  The day we went they weren't able to provide any draft beers because the system was broken. Okay, I'll give that a pass. It was annoying, but eh.  Specials included drafts (which we couldn't have) $3 Coronas. I opted for the margarita which was served in a shaker.  These were $12 but there was about 2 1/2 drinks in there so it came out to be a sweet deal. What I really loved was the free small snacks they offered.  Fruit, chips/salsa, and chicken enchiladas are served during HH.  Free food!    The chips we had there were ridiculous. In a good way.  Chips and salsa/guac are like crack to me in the first place.  But THESE chips were like freebasing meth (I'm not a drug user, I promise).  They were wheat based chips and were outstanding.  It was out of control.  I have been told and told and told some more that the brunch here is to die for.  I will definitely be back to partake.  I didn't order any food because hey, they gave me free enchiladas and I"m not one to look a gift horse in the mouth.

WRZcsQVnHcIYA-goRHg4aw.text: I thought I was going to really impress some friends when they discovered the highly touted "famous" chocolate fountain feature of our surprise Sunday brunch.   Allow me to help manage YOUR expectations, so you're not as disappointed as I was: Yes, there is a chocolate fountain and it is included with your $8-13 brunch entree; but, buy your own(probably identical) model at Wal-mart for $40 and save yourself the heartache of a disappointing meal.   Granted, we came for the "famous" chocolate fountain but we were prepared to enjoy breakfast first! Another disappointment.   I had the breakfast burrito and could only stomach the beans. The potatoes tasted like they'd been in the freezer too long. The eggs in my burrito were chewy not "lightly" scrambled in the slightest.  The machaca had decent flavor but it was further ruined by the enchilada sauce that tasted straight from a generic can!  One of my guests had pancakes. Sadly, these were neither light nor fluffy, instead they were chewy and tough just like my eggs.   "The myriad of accompaniments you can serve with the chocolate fountain are only limited by your imagination" in theory, but at Aunt Chilada's this past Sunday, your choices were dry chunks of cantaloupe, flavorless honeydew, pineapple cubes, (shall we say "aged") marshmallows, and the unimaginative standby: strawberries. Oh! And, crispy lady fingers.   Full disclosure: I did not tell our server how much I hated my burrito or the pancakes and she DID ask how everything tasted.   Truthfully: I was weary from the disappointment. It's one thing to send back an entree but to say everything was unsatisfactory?! I just won't recommend it or plan to return.

-8fiEK0b7gx0N7GcO7UGFw.text: Have been to this restaurant several times. Decent food, but not the best Mexican food I've had. Like the atmosphere and patio is nice when weather appropriate.  Service is usually good, but the latest lunch visit would say mediocre service, but acceptable. Left a 15% tip on credit card receipt. When I got my bill, the total was adjusted and worked out to over 20% tip. Not impressed. Not enough money to file a complaint, but based on this, I won't be back.  Be sure to check your credit card statement. Hopefully this is not a regular occurrence and just an unethical employee who should be fired.

xlUIeRFndtL6BzhL03iU2A.text: I was a bit hesitant to return. My last visit left me feeling a bit cold. (A new-ish girl working the outside bar was giving a LOT of her attention to a particular patron, and drinks, food, etc. was slow coming)  Marvin was our server tonight. He's got LOTS of energy.  Had a carnitas chimichanga. Delicious, as always!  Love the flour chips, and the hot salsa.  I will be back.

EPyo2G_rX4DORYkraJybLw.text: Fun place to celebrate a birthday and have some good Mexican food. We invited our family and friends to celebrate a  Birthday. The staff was friendly, and accommodating. The decor is very "Mexican" which helps create an authentic experience. Margaritas were good as well!

N9fK3M-iXipc001_ZyXFfw.text: We really enjoyed this meal. The chips and salsa were delicious. We split the fajitas. It was plenty of food! And so delicious. The service was great too!

PPcxCjGHslYn2n9Y635s8g.text: Location is very interesting, and the outdoor seating area is awesome. However; the food and service is subpar. I've been here a handful of times with others (not my first choice) and I am never impressed.  This place could be so much better if the food quality was just improved a bit, and service got a notch upwards.

A_fTdpZpZXBL_tPHDASAqw.text: Overall this was an amazing experience. The entire staff was friendly. I had interaction with 6 total from start to finish.   Salsa and homemade chips were delicious and it was hard not to fill up before my fajitas came out.  The menu had several local beers and the server mentioned a few more.   Birds were everywhere outside which added to a great atmosphere , my only warning is you may want to sit under an umbrella if you would freak out when nature calls for one of the birds.   From start to finish I loved the whole time here, just wish I had made it to their Thursday night trivia. Until next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-fBDA7HDTlQaYjC5cZVtJQ.text: Visiting Phoenix for our anniversary, we wanted GOOD Mexican food. Aunt Chiladas did not disappoint! Food was excellent, service was superior, everyone was friendly, and if it had not been for the Haboob that popped up and drove everyone inside, we would have enjoyed the patio and bocce as well. I would COMPLETELY recommend this to anyone. Large tables (12+) with families mixed with booths and tables - not noisy, fast service, plenty of attention and filled glasses. Being a former Valley of the Sun resident, when we come back to visit, we are coming back to Aunt Chiladas!

GdplzopQ6O4lJw7-Hyh28A.text: Totally awesome place. Margarita are awesome. I had a machaca taco and chicken enchilada and it was awesome. the homemade tortilla chips another big plus. Highly recommend.

969amqJEV-RY85PsZRQwSw.text: We have always loved this restaurant. The food is great, and the service was always great.   Until today.   The service was terrible. It took nearly an hour to get our food-the whole lunch took nearly two. The server "forgot" to note a gluten allergy on one dish. Our glasses sat empty most of the meal. All this despite a nearly empty restaurant.   When told about this experience, two separate servers were indifferent, offering only a toke. "Sorry".   We won't be back. Pity. This place was a favorite.

jvMgFAbkT92kD4rkjlG73w.text: Overall I loved Aunt Chiladas, good food, good drinks, great atmosphere, games, you name it. However, the service I received at the bar... not so great We were hanging out her before our flight back to Nj. Our bartender Sarah seemed fine, she was friendly and gave us what we needed, however when we got our check- I wasn't too fond of her anymore.  We were drinking margaritas all afternoon because they were on happy hour, she didn't explain to us that there were two different sizes- and that the larger size wasn't on special... so we were charged full price for A LOT of margaritas. It should be common courtesy to explain the specials to us instead of just serving us the more expensive one without even asking. But that's not all.... that was just mildly irritating...  it was Mexican pizza night, so I asked for a pizza order sheet. Sarah gave me one sheet, I looked at it, it was broken down where you could choose 0-4 toppings all for an additional cost, ok no problem.. but then she takes the paper back and gives me a new sheet telling me "oh sorry this is the new one, use this" ok that's fine. The new sheet she hands me has just the meats as an additional cost and the rest of the toppings listed as "complimentary". Even better!! I thought.... so we check off a bunch of the "free" toppings.. Well when we get out check, we were charged for all the "free" toppings... turns out the first menu she gave us WAS the correct one and the toppings were not free.  So after the margarita upcharges and the pizza upcharges, our check was around $70.... not exactly what I expected. Did she really think that I'd give her a bigger tip if she intentionally drove up the price of my check? Sorry. I think not.  We closed out and walked around back where a much nicer, and HONEST, bartender was working. I don't know her name, she was pregnant. She was great! No problems, and she explained the happy hour sizes to us without us asking and instead of just giving us the large and charging us more.....  I would love to give this place 5 stars. But I was SO angry after receiving my check... However I'll definitely go back there if I'm in the Phoenix area again!

feMNvO3rhu9-NYCWiJ-NOg.text: In Mexico we say "no hay mejor salsa que buen apetito". Roughly translated- there is no better sauce than a good appetite. Well, we came with a huge appetite and the food was STILL terrible...I have to believe that the guys in the kitchen must be embarrassed to tell their friends and family they serve this mush under the pretense of Mexican food. I imagine they write home to their mothers saying they work at Taco Bell to save what remaining dignity they have left. Hyperbole? nope.com This place was terrible. At least the drinks were strong. Too bad they aren't strong enough to kill the taste of the food... The place claims to have award winning salsa and chips but it must be one of those participation awards they give everyone because even that was terrible. The wait staff was nice... So at least there is that...

EYWs88gdRKeU4o1jEoda9g.text: Great ambiance and nightlife. Neat patio with bocce ball and live music on most weekend nights.   This place has a long history, dating back to its origin as a trading post for the local mines. That explains the jumbled layout and location inside the neighborhood.  The food is classic "Gringo Mexican food" - well done. The flour tortilla chips for the chips & salsa are fresh, and besides classics like burritos and tacos there are some unique dishes.

AetT38_W9kNfx2oJ3xe2-w.text: I love the ambience at aunt chiladas.   It's very unique - a good place to have a margarita.  (Although I didn't have one today.)  I had lunch there with a friend today.  I ordered a chili relleno thinking that even with seeds it would be at least as good as the last time I had one.  This one was too salty, the egg was dry and tasteless.    I took the remains home and put the chips and relleno out to see what wildlife would turn up to eat it.  A javelina showed up.  Even the javelina tried the chili relleno but rejected it!   Dog food and chips were acceptable to the pig.  I reported this to my son who said that definitely the food has gone way down hill over the last several years.   Since this place is in my neighborhood I sincerely hope that they can improve the taste of their food.  I will be watching the food reviews before eating there again.

mHLdg9_-oF96xV1wLFr5aw.text: I would give a negative star if I could. Service was horrible. Worst service ever Sunday afternoon, almost no one in the place.The bartender sat us and gave us the menu. My husband and I sat by the bar area (inside) and almost 15 minutes in the place and we didn't get even a glass of water or a simple acknowledgment we were at the place.  There was no initiative to help the only waiter available.  When you're busy you might get away with a little delay that but when there are only 5 tables (including ours) and one person working and the rest doing nothing there is no excuse.  That was our second time going to this place and with over 1000 Mexicans restaurants in Phoenix and this kind of bad service there is no reason to come back ever

SOCK547l23nqg0MLKq_3KQ.text: Sat at the outside bar with no bartender. A server (Emilie) took it upon herself to help us out and make sure we were taken care of. She was so sweet. Food was amazing as well. We will be back!

x8EpR4PYrESjylOl_TjQMQ.text: This is a hidden gem. On the work trip and staying next to this place at the resort. Everyone I ran into from the airport recommended this place. Best chip and salsa! The salsa was chunky, fresh, and great flavor...and it is complementary. Ordered 2 green chile enchiladas. Delicious! comes with rice and choice of bean Laid back ambiance that needs a remodel as it is outdated Alittle pricey for a mexican food place that is so laidback but the food was worth it

qne5bmH2NRqCJ7os1RLrPw.text: Service was. 4-5 they were awesome! Even came it to sing to my son for his birthday.  The food is good too. I personally like a lot more spice. But it was good and came out really fast.

EKKva-xQ9IhxdqgRMNr1Kg.text: I used to love this place, but it has really gone downhill. Service was VERY slow for our last two visits, and the quality of the food has fallen as well.   Last night, I watched a waitress dump an entire glass of ice water down the back of a lady sitting a few tables over, which was an honest mistake. What was irritating, was that customers were allowed to help clean up the the mess on the floor, and I didn't see a manager approach their table before I left a bit later.  It's really too bad. This used to be one of my favorites.

WbvEnJNiVWPRKuSeLUzacQ.text: This place was great! I went there for a baby shower and it was was wonderful. The room was super cute, I love the ambiance of the place...and the food was amazing. I cannot wait till the weather cools down because the patio looks very inviting. If anyone is looking for a venue for a party, look no further!!!

aRkhzoMPBsVQAIRmaogYBw.text: First off this place is an Arizona staple. Everything on the menu is delish and should be tried. If you are unsure, bring your friends and make your own sampler platters by each ordering something different and sharing. If you are into chips and salsa, the mixed homemade corn and flower chips with the salsa are a must. The building is massive with rooms to seat large parties or just a small quiet table. Outdoor fun and games are also a draw for families or adults just looking for a good time.

crbsULBZiK_nthdSC0gAQQ.text: What a great! Food is fantastic, clean, and authentic. No need for over seasoning or extra mounds of sauce, the flavor is perfect on its own. We ordered for pickup and it was ready quickly with all the trimming included. Highly recommend.

9dVL-S0nWptOPFAcUnT7ZQ.text: We love the out door seating feels like you have landed in Mexico...   so if you go looking to relax enjoy some drinks and decent food it's one of the best.     Best place in AZ for cinco de Mayo.  (May 5th)
