iBDbx76brKg1HYV8feroLw.text: I like green enchiladas!~ Getting caught in the Rain.... Seriously, this place delivers time and time again. Order your super favorito dish and be sure to follow it up with a fried ice cream to share. Caution on the chips and salsa, they can ruin your appetite fast, They are served so warm and crispy you might forget the meal all together.

XflVVGr9Zlr03AramQr5Mw.text: Great atmosphere and delicious food! We will definitely return. The margaritas were strong and yummy as well! Great local spot!

JBWtjWFWzkZEGL6bfFdDlw.text: The food here is very good!  The chips and salsa that come out at the start of the meal are great. The chips are a combination of two different kinds and the better ones are on the top of the bowl!   I like the shrimp fajitas. The portion is very big so this meal is always bagged and brought home for the next day.    Our server most recently was Angel, and he was excellent!   The only issue I have is it seems a little overpriced for what it is but that comes with the territory of being by so many hotels. This is a True staple of Phoenix!

JZfLFtoDplFqWTyhZ-aUcQ.text: Went here for lunch today and had the chingalingas. If you have never had them, the description doesn't do the meal justice. They're AMAZING!!!!! I want some more now. Lol. But this place is really cool. My first thoughts off the bat we're seeing something that's out of Disney. Hidden, and different from what's around it. It's great though. I really enjoyed it. Staff is amazing and I really like the multiple areas they have set up. If you enjoy Mexican food and a great atmosphere, ain't chiladas is definitely a place to try!

Q4lJ0FlJiz2vML2CSKdw0g.text: Love this place from the home made chips and salsa all the way through the deserts . This place has been a part of Arizona for very long time and can see why.. I have even done take out and it was just as good.

e0BuwL0XL8PNdEvyKfmSIw.text: Sad choice. All bland. Salsa tastes like it is made with canned stewed tomatoes. Rice is flavorless. Beans undercooked. Carnitas tasted old and greasy. I was so ready to taste great Mexican food. This was not it.

zWbl7sFDT5cbSI_lVu9oJg.text: Just wasted $38 on this place.  First and last time I'll go there. Stopped to get take out, almost impossible for anyone to wait on me. They don't even have a take out menu. Had a carnitas burrito, very dry with a piece of bone in the meat.  The rice was terrible and the beans were so smoky I couldn't eat them. The only reason I'm given it one star is because my husband enjoyed some of his meal.

aJ-qP8DA2dCBk75X5rImYg.text: So I only doc it one star because there was only one Vegan Entree but...... I got the vegan fajitas and my goodness they were delicious and perfect! The fajitas were fresh sauteed onion, peppers, broccoli, cauliflower and carrots along with Guacamole , black beans and rice ! It was the ideal Mexican food! My husband got the red chili burrito and inhaled it within 5 minutes a Chipotle sized burrito! The atmosphere was really great for our friends surprise party.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan Fajitas

oQywn1aJciQBKN_KrQ4gNQ.text: Delicious.  I had the special shrimp tamale, my friend had the Taco Salad with chicken and my other friend had the bean burro enchilada style.  I had 2 spicy bloody mary's and my friend had a margarita.  Our waitress Cat was fantastic and made our 1st time here a great experience.  They have a great outside patio and I am sure at night it can very romantic.  I will definitely be back.

OC6oqZI8wyL41uucSCPVTg.text: Who in the world is scoring this place higher than a two? I'm giving it that high of a score simply because my meal itself, (chicken fajitas) were above satisfactory.  The smell of years and years of spilled beer, margaritas, and old food greet you as you walk in the door. You're then seated at a dirty table lined with a thick red vinyl table liner that's so sticky my water cup that was already placed there literally stuck to it. (We should of got up and walked the other direction at this point, but have been there years before, and we're in the area, so wanted to revisit... things were not as I remembered, that or my taste for authentic Mexican has really developed! The chips are a mix of flour and corn, no flavor, and heavy on the greasy side. The salsa is horrid, can tomatoes, sliced black olives, and a few onions and cilantro. No flavor at all! We did ask if they had a spicer version, and the waitress brought out a pureed tomato and red chili sauce. A HINT of spice, better but still not much flavor. The chicken fajitas arrived hot and on traditional sizzling cast iron skillets. The onions, peppers, and chicken had a nice char and flavor. However the sides that accompanied the meal was a little less than palatable, the "Spanish Rice," is actually rice-a-Roni, the beans Bland, and brown shreds of lettuce beneath what should be "Pico de Gallo," again can looking tomatoes and onions. The high prices on the menu do not reflect the quality of food! Do yourself a favor, spend your hard working dollars on real Mexican food, at a million of the other fine, and hole in the wall restaurants, that flood Phoenix!!  Two chicken fajitas and waters with tip, grand total  $35.60 (lunch menu) Disappointing!

CtiWS08r9GEenUiJitEkEQ.text: It's a great place, and a beautiful atmosphere, what's not to like , if so I said they did not like this place, I woulf not trust them

60vZ4WnBhywra34R88ZnEg.text: Great food for a great price! Loved the salsa & guac, and the veggie burrito was one of my favorites!

RDuxRkgYerWb6XhVDbWWdg.text: Is that all you could reply??? The service you provide and the cleanliness of your restaurant is about as important to you as how you now run the restaurant.  Very sad because I used to love coming.

ORmzAzLrqnYy1DgnEFbeOA.text: Great atmosphere, wonderful service, awesome food and absolutely the best homemade salsa!! You won't be disappointed! They have live music on Fridays and Team Trivia on Tuesday. If you haven't been, try it, you'll love it!

cneLM61u4QoATtFuzqcmKA.text: We were here for a private anniversary party so the seating was fantastic in the small, private dining area. The food was delicious. It was served buffet style but presentation was beautiful and the food was well seasoned.  Parking was a bit cramped but the restaurant was also quite busy, but we were lucky to get a close parking space.  The house red wine they served was very good and their chips and salsa were also a great addition to the meal.

l3E1Pttd0Xg9o4Dt8TJLcA.text: I live around the area and have gone here five times now. On Wednesday nights, they have Team Trivia and it's a lot of fun! Randy, the host, is super energetic and awesome - def gets the crowd going.  The homemade tortilla chips are A M A Z I N G. They are complimentary so make sure you grab some! Most of the time I've gone, I got the spinach & chicken enchiladas. It is pretty good and definitely my go-to. I've had their original margaritas as well and I gotta say that it's worth the price.  Parking is very convenient. There is a lot of seating indoors & outdoors. Overall a fun place to go to with coworkers and friends after a long day.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio bar.
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio bar.
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken taco combo during Team Trivia night.

DqS28tJ4iApHLcRA3wE7jw.text: I've come to really enjoy Aunt Chiladas! I hadn't heard of them until referred there by a former employee when I was looking for a place to have Sunday watch parties for the Indianapolis Colts fan club I help organize. Unfortunately the 2017 season was not kind to the team, so our attendance was low. But Jennie and her staff were always cheerful and positive when we came, no matter how small the group was. Because most of the Colts games were the 10a/11a early games, we pretty much had TV of choice... and sometimes given sound, or even the big TV and all over sound!   Their chips = BOMB DOT COM. d00d-- how do they make them so effing fluffy and not like a normal tortilla chip?! I could pretty much eat a basket or2 of those myself when I wasn't terribly hungry for something on the brunch menu (besides mimosas and chocolate fondue).   Their menu is massive BTW- and they serve massive plates! Pretty much anytime I'd order from the menu I'd leave with a to-go box. Even the simple things like quesadillas are bigger than my hands! Totally worth the price.  Aunt Chilada's spot is also quite unique to AZ being that they hold AZ liquor license #1 and the building literally has history in the woodwork. Ask one of the family members for the 411 on the building and you'll get taken on a stroll thru AZ history.

1Ng6nAFMaw5sTLaLSgCgOA.text: I lived in Phx for my 1st 18yrs and I had never been here!!  I brought my family with me and my aunt and grandma and my grandma had never been here and she usually knows about all these places.  Very cool place.  I got the El Pollo Fundido and the prickly pear margarita.  the margarita didn't have much flavor difference then a regular one so I would try a different drink next time. The fundido was great and I couldn't get enough of the sauce. The flour chips are really different and good also.  Will be back!

sWrxBS2B6z7vgF9IKex99w.text: What a fantastic place! The service, food, margaritas, and atmosphere are truly 5 star. My family and I are staying at the Pointe Hilton across the street so it was a nice walk! We ordered a guac, top shelf margarita pitcher, steak fajitas, and a chimichanga. Very authentic and delicious! I should note we have a 2 year old and he had a little play area to run around. Very family friendly!!

8bMUL7lnfoKS-OgQlQQp_A.text: I went to Aunt Chilada's at the recommendation of a friend who used to bartend there.   When I arrived, I was immediately asked if I was meeting a party here. Nope, it's just me... I was seated and brought a menu along with flour tortilla chips (yum!) and salsa.   I started with the cheese crisp. This thing was amazing!! It was a cross between a sauceless pizza and an open faced corn quesadilla. So good. In retrospect, I would've finished that and eaten less of everything else.  From there, I ordered the 2 combo plate: Cheese enchilada (how could I go to a place named Aunt Chilada's and not order one...) and chicken taco. The enchilada was good, and the sour cream I ordered with it had an almost whipped texture. I took one bite of the taco, and decided against it. It was a crunchy corn tortilla, the chicken was breaded and fried (crispy chicken in a taco?).   If I went back, I'd stick to the cheese crisp and a 1 entree plate.  There is also a banquest room, and a large outdoor seating area with a bar and bocci ball court.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Combo plate- chicken taco, cheese enchilada
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious cheese crisp

dfCcy-KNBTCKpaCojATxCw.text: Nope. This was not good at all. The servers were friendly but everything tasted like they were microwaveable meals. The lettuce on my plate was actually super wilted and lacked any substance. We ate inside and there were flies and gnats everywhere - one landed in my wine!

TlK93ngziskIlHkxlJIAjQ.text: We hosted a family reunion/birthday party here. I live out of state and organized the entire event via phone and email. Michelle, events coordinator, was fantastic to work with.  The event was perfect, food delicious and the adult pinata was a blast. I highly recommend Aunt Chilada's. They made it all so easy!

NqldNEXqQdcX505L40Iibg.text: Great chips and salsa! They put black olives in their salsa, which I love but he hubby hates!! Great atmosphere! Service is good and the food is decent! Two bars! One inside and one out! Huge dining area!!! Check in out!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Bar

9EabUzYG-OJnxIA_xVPoxw.text: Not the most Mexican-y of Mexican places I've been to, but passable as Mexican food. I have been here several times and never been blown away. Its been here for as long as I can remember, and is a stable as long as I can remember. Tonight we went for their happy hour and I was surprised to see that they offer a free buffet! Chips, salsa, mini enchiladas, taco meat and beans. Not bad! People were still ordering full meals though, but I was all about the freebies :)

2CzN6VZbDVnqgDuFQoToaw.text: Aunt Chiladas hosted the latest Yelp event and what an event it was. The food was excellent. i was especially partial to the tamales...ate several. the chips and salsa at each table were excellent as well. the margaritas from the bar were nice and sweet/salty, just the right ratio.   we'll definitely check them out again for their regular menu!

nWWm5XPKO14CP566TMcLrQ.text: Setting, food, prices, service... All of it top notch!!!  I simply love this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KduA7V4Wpjz-72a4JA782Q.text: Yet another fabulous Yelp event held at this locale. Great food.....and I am not a Mexican food lover at all....but again the food was very good. The atmosphere is authentic Mexican....a Bocce court right next to the walkway....fantastic patio for our yelp event....good live music....and there was even a "Hell's Kitchen" celebrity chef serving up shrimp in a grille pineapple.   Yelp done it's usual prize giveaways....which are always fun....there was fiesta theme for this event and there was even a "Adult" penyata which I don't think anyone was able to break open....LOL!!!! I found out they even do a free buffet during happy hour Monday-Friday 4:30pm until 6:30pm.....that's awesome. So while I don't drink or really like Mexican food.....I highly recommend this location for it's authentic feel and great patio to sit under the stars and Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

xqzFrptDAktzwwgnIvKDaA.text: I just held my husband's surprise 60th birthday party at Aunt Chilada's and it went perfectly!  Everyone was amazing - from Michelle who coordinated my event and assisted with drink and food selections, to the servers, to the manager, to the front desk ladies.  Everyone was attentive, courteous, and helpful.  The food buffet was great (everyone loved the green corn tamales) and both the food and drinks were very affordable. There were no hidden costs and no worries.  They even included tables decorated with linens and balloons at no extra charge. I highly recommend using them for an event - they made sure everything went perfectly and we had a blast!

K9tSr_LKs7dTgNp4zq31_g.text: The 5 stars are for the chips and salsa! I had never had the fluffy yet crispy- MELT IN YOUR MOUTH- tortilla chips before.   It was an experience.   Even if you order nothing else from the menu, try these.   That is all. Adios.

KbrK6k4L_ox72czOYlWOZg.text: One of my favorite places to eat here in the valley! Great tasting Mexican food! This place has a very homey authentic feel to it.   I used to come here once a week for my business meetings with Mona Vie. The place has a lot of room and is great for large parties. Our group of people always have a great time here. The staff are very friendly and pay close attention to your requests. I would definitely call for a reservation if you plan to have a group larger than 4 or 5 people. This place can getting a little busy during the usually dinner rush. Just a word of advise for you.    Last time I ate here I tried the chicken enchiladas they were amazing! I had a Margarita also very good.   I definitely recommend visiting this place if you're looking for a great Mexican food themed restaurant.

lhHugwPO8-_XDCLxzO39kA.text: The queso didn't have much flavor to me but the chips were nice and crispy.  The shrimp tacos were amazingly fresh packed with lots of flavor!  The Trouble in Paradise was delicious as well!  Overall good experience!

snvFS4lgJdRftrdrKl8n8g.text: Good service and God awful food!!! One star b/c of great service brought it up... And could not go lower.   OMG the food was horrible and lacked taste at best.  The guac was worse than what comes from a bag!!   We had a table of 8, service was great! Food weak bland, lacked interest or taste. The only dish that appeared worth ordering was the street tacos.   The jalapeno steak fajitas were tough as leather and well tastes the same.   How does a place like this survive in Phoenix?  Oh must be east coast tourist, well thank goodness for them.   That is all.

RZi0MeU88PFcp1ybEDc8yQ.text: Went for our daughter birthday! What a disappointment and waste of $$ our table was lopsided almost spilled out drinks several times, wait for food was 45 minutes and the restaurant was empty with 1 other table besides ours, food was nothing special! We spoke to Marvin the evening manager about the wait for food and his response was sorry but we have a huge party. No excuse!  If you can manage a party and main dining room then you shouldn't be in business. Unfortunately we chose this place to eat because it was near our hotel! I plan to call the hotel to let them know not to recommend this place for their guest! I should have stayed to eat at the hotel and spend the extra $$ especially when celebrating a special occasion! I give this place zero stars!

e0H0ZMK89Poa0fx11g4S8g.text: Aunt Chilada's is one of my favorite places to eat outdoors in Phoenix, when it's not cold, and when it's not 100 million gazillion degrees.   They have rockin happy hour specials, great margaritas, and pretty good Mexican food. It's a little gringo, but it's yummy, and when my parents were buying, it was great! ( I ate here a lot in college).  I'm a fan of the chips and salsa, too.

ne2vaiB_mOd6ricMsyT6RQ.text: Worst service ever but even worse is management does not care! We've been coming here pretty steady for the past 5 years and the service today was horrible! When we arrived we were greeted and we asked to be seated indoors. We were seated in the back where we sat for 25 minutes before a server came to take our order. Once our drinks came we placed our order. We each ordered a chorizo plate, our order came and upon taking the first bite we found the chorizo was so spicy we could not eat it! We were already frustrated with noone coming to check on us after we had been seated and now the chorizo was too spicy to eat! We waited another 10 minutes, before our server came to our table to check on us, when we finally asked to speak to a manager to let them know about our terrible experience. A manager comes to the table where we tell him about our frustrations with the service and food and his demeanor was very nonchalant. We got the impression he just didn't care. At the end of our conversation he stated "so tone it down a bit?" (meaning the chorizo) while he hurriedly walked off as his staff told him "the linen people were there". No apology, no care that his restaurant and/or staff weren't doing well, nothing! A simple apology would have been fine. Needless to say, we will never be returning to Aunt Chilada's. Hope Aunt Chilada's remembers they are there because of the customers.

o43uCGjQ55b7B1whkd7npA.text: I came in today for a nice labor day lunch, the hostess was really friendly and greeted us right away. We Sat down and our waiter Angel was just phenomenal. I was having a heard time deciding what to eat and he recommended the seafood quesadilla. It was delicious, he never let out drinks get to empty he was ready to fill them as soon as they looked remotely low. The environment of the restaurant feels like you're just hanging out with friends having a good time. I will definitely be coming here at least a couple times a month.  Our waiter asked us about our day and he seemed genuinely interested in what we had to say. As we left the same lovely hostess asked us to return, very friendly tall skinny lady.

nt7-_2z9FUl6w68tm6YKYA.text: Bailee did an amazing job serving me and my friends we felt very welcome and the street tacos are amazing definitely coming back!

i6GARWNcNFSf_2-i-tiz6w.text: A dear friend passed away and I helped plan a Celebration of Life event at this awesome restaurant!  The "newer" back patio was beautifully decorated and the food and service were amazing. Thank you Aunt Chiladas for making a sad day as glorious as possible.

opR7sLYh5WDglk4UK8NOOQ.text: This is exactly where you want to take out of town visitors to for a delicious, casual, fun dinner. Make sure you reserve or wait for a table on the patio - don't worry there are heaters in the winter & spitzy misters in the summer. I've been having dinners there on the patio since I first moved to Phoenix as a kiddo and it never doesn't seem magical in the evening. Like you are in another place / another time. Important tip: Ask for extra flour chips and the hot sauce to compliment the full & wonderful salsa that comes with the chips. Those flour chips are sooooooo uhhhhh that it is nearly impossible to convince your mouth that you've had enough of tasting them. The fajitas are good, the tacos are good, the buffalo chicken is somehow good, the enchiladas are good. I can't say this is gourmet fare, but it is pretty delicious and the perfect fare for sitting on that patio. Family friendly, dog friendly, crowds friendly. ALSO - how did I almost forget to mention their happy hour that has a full spread of their food for you to nibble on while having some drinks!? Def check that out - but not the same scene as bringing out of towners to dinner on the patio.

B9gNgFQCYfUsNGfaNI54qw.text: Average  Recently, I attended a retirement party at Aunt Chilada's Mexican Restaurant for a co-worker. The restaurant is large with  indoor and outdoor seating and the bar provides nice dining options to accommodate large parties.     Aunt Chiladas offers a large variety of Mexican/Tex-Mex options. We had the taco bar, tosadas, chicken enchiladas, rice, beans, salad, and chips and salsa. Everything was hot and fresh but to be honest there was nothing too exciting about their dishes. The food and service were just average. Although, I would have to say that the chips and salsa were really tasty.  Maybe, I caught Aunt Chimadas on an off day. Prehaps, I will visit again and give it another try.

rpgR6rL1VIP_BSW9Ykw6Bg.text: Great food!  The fajitas were fantastic!  Great atmosphere and huge patio seating error!

M44howiuP-ti8DOXPy48ng.text: So this place was highly recommended by our resort.  We make a 730 reservation and got seated early.  After 25 minutes of sitting at our table we flagged down our waiter and asked if he could help us.  He said that he was busy with big tables. Never once did he greet us or say he'd be with us in a minute.  We ordered our appetizer,"guacamole," and dinner entrees, as we got the vibe that we were not going to be waited on. After almost 30-35 minutes later we flagged our waiter over asking about our appetizer.  He said they ran out... never thought of telling us.  He brought us complementary queso but never brought the chips.  Food was subpar, horrible service, never refilled drinks or asked if we needed dessert or anything else.

U0C8bfyIPFTSEHIzUpUoQQ.text: so let's get this clear, it was good. not the best tho. the chips they serve are strange and extremely thick for being from a tortilla, but the other chips they had were fine. also they served this interesting thing. i thought i was rice but it just looked like spaghetti cut in half super weird. she said it was mexican pasta but i've had that before and it didn't taste crunchy the way it did. anyway will not go back pretty much ever.

nMwTFr9i1UldhckIdW9asg.text: Ordered chimichangas and enchiladas with a house margarita and horseshoe blackberry margarita. Margaritas were good for being a house margarita. $7 each I believe. Enchiladas were delicious, meat was greasy in the chimichangas. Lots of food, ended up bringing leftovers home.

ig__aXLgo9ylHEkQQ3l2uw.text: We called in (7:00 on a Monday night) to place a small carry out order, after being placed on hold for a few minutes, the team member came back on the phone and completely unapologetic ally stated "actually we are not doing take out orders at this time". I asked what exactly that meant.... I mean "no take out orders"?  "Yes, the restaurant is too busy so we cannot help you with that tonight". So 1 star because Idk how possibly a restaurant can be that they turn away business...and offer no apology for doing so..but I guess we will not be giving them an opportunity in the future. Too bad too :(

BPa4I3BdZLcRMoQI_wIwIQ.text: I visit the Phoenix area for 1 week every March and I never miss a chance to come here. Their patio is one of my many happy places in the valley. Atmosphere and food can't be beat.

eSCtIQuNsITmpLDoCvXwjA.text: Love Aunt Chiladas. Great vibe. Cool comfortable place to chill and enjoy a beer and some good ok' Mexican food. Really enjoyed the cheese crisp and guacamole followed up with a chicken and shrimp fajitas. Our server Charisse kept the cold beer coming. The owners Michelle and Tiffany stopped by to confirm our satisfaction with the food, drinks and service. Wow, what a nice touch. And the have a great outdoor space for groups and parties. Give 'em a try. If you aren't happy call out the owners. And the also have one of the valley's best cinco de Mayo parties.

2uGA8D_tvYb2hZKv05yt3Q.text: Meh it was ok street tacos are not street tacos now my co worker ordered tacos Jesus and those looked good and looked like street tacos, someone needs to send cooks to East LA to see what street tacos look and taste like now the tamale was ok but you can tell they did an southwest mex twist in it as well, please stop messing with legit Mexican food just make it the way it should be.

v1B3K3tiydS_QhxvDFadlA.text: We picked the perfect night for a dinner at Aunt Chiladas. The moon  was bright and the warm air breezy, and sitting outside on the patio was just what we all wanted. I had forgotten to make that request on my reservation, you have to sit outside to eat here. Patience paid off when one of the other reservations changed theirs to an inside table and we lucked out! The hostess was just as happy as we were, which was so sweet. We also had the best table for our group (two little ones and a baby) away from the noise of the bar festivities. Dogs are also allowed on the patio, and two very big well behaved ones were right behind us. We all love dogs, so it was not a problem. Waiters were great all evening, prompt and polite and accommodating, even checking if the boys (ages 5 and 3) drinks needed to have lids, very smart idea. Chips and salsa were very good, the salsa has a really nice texture too, olives? Our spinach and chicken enchiladas were great, nice sauce and good size pieces of chicken, the rest of the table were happy with their meals as well. We were able to sit and relax for as long as we wanted, never feeling that we needed to hurry. There was a wedding or some sort of celebration inside so the music was fun to listen to. The boys loved running back and forth on the bocce ball court after they ate (thank goodness!). Thanks for a great night Aunt Chilada, we know we can always count on you for a perfect restaurant choice with out of town guests. Make sure the staff gets a big thank you as well, great job!

dLldLbHi8SD9E_ZurBntsQ.text: Great Happy Hour and Margaritas! Maddie our server was great!! Nice outdoor seating and location was very convenient! We will be back!

GGtE58bnqsrxYRIXWUn3sA.text: My family and I are in town on vacation and have eaten their food two times in the last 4 days!! Saw the other reviews which led us here, and so glad we did it! We have a large group and have now tried a good portion of the menu.  Quesadillas are huge and filled to the brim! We had cheese, veggie, seafood, beef, and chicken. We would order all of them again! Tonight I personally ordered the Chicken in Chipotle cream sauce and I would eat that sauce on anything!!! Chicken was cooked to perfection, and the sauce!!! I put it on the beans, the rice, the chips, a shoe, Jesus it's tasty!!  Well done!!! If we ever find our way back here we will be coming again for sure!!!!

IxIk4fltWmhfmNZHFf8Nog.text: I have been here multiple times for team trivia nights nothing has ever impressed me. The service has always been a little slow. Which I understand is due in large part to trivia. Still, you have a standard that you hope they adhere to.  The food has always been mediocre. Not actively bad just...disappointing. The chips and salsa are complimentary and I believe they're homemade, but there's something about the chips, they're flaky or something? Not my cup of tea.  I've had the fajita burrito which was disappointing. The rice and beans were blah. Like I said, nothing about this place was offensive it was just not good. I'm sure I'll be back but it won't be my choice.   I liked the bar. Attentive bartender, decent selection, average prices.

WKQ1jcoHz_0aO6-_o9yA0w.text: I used to love this place about 20 years ago. The food was consistently great and service was pretty good was well.  NOT ANYMORE. I was part of a party of 16 dining on Saturday, December 22 and all I can say about that is, just don't eat here. My husband ordered the Tacos de Jesus, and I ordered a taco salad with chicken (gluten free) and both were terrible. My salad came out almost 5 minutes after everyone else's food, not to mention the fact that it was wrong. I had ordered it with jalapenos, which weren't on it at all, and it was supposed to come with sour cream, which wasn't on it at all either. However I was so hungry and everyone else was almost halfway done eating by the time my food arrived, I didn't bother to send it back and wait any longer. Regardless, I barely ate any of it because it was disgusting. The chicken was rubbery and flavorless, and there were so many beans in it the lettuce was wilted and slimey. It just didn't taste good. I tasted the meat from my husbands tacos, and it tasted the way I would imagine wet dog food tastes. It was not good at all. The overall review of everyone else's meals in our party was very similar. This place was not cheap and I felt bad for my family that they had paid for dinner for 16 people, and this was the quality of the food and service. We won't be back again. Such a bummer.

zIgvHh6chWZsgH6hFqwPrg.text: So so bad.  I can't even say we were actually able to eat. We walked in and waited for 5 to 10 minutes while the people at the front fumbled around to find us a table. Originally they told us it was going to be about 30 minutes but luckily they found us a table quickly. After we sat down we quickly ordered a drink, we were there for happy hour.  The margarita was all right but very small and very weak.  The waitress actually never came back so we just left cash on the table and left.  We saw several wait staff walked by us quite a few times before we decided to leave. We drank our entire drink and then waited about 10 more minutes for her to come back but she never did.  This was on like a Tuesday night, now I can see why the reviews are so bad.

uuqUW1yh37_6W75Od5hD5g.text: We had two birthdays in our group.  The employees came to our table and sang.  The dinner was good and our server was exceptional.

DnRHh76g-80UjYrEEF7KVA.text: It started off ok. But then after getting are drinks and placing are order we waited over 30 minutes and still no food. Needless to say we got up and walked out. Terrible service.

mlPp9PJzwiaWlq9upDDxyg.text: Great food. Great ambience.great service. Some meals are a bit spicy. So make sure to tell the waiter about the spice level you want. My Chipotle chicken burrito was perfect though.

97DJ6M2XyM44T4dqkFoVfw.text: I just left this restaurant 15 minutes ago and decided to sign up for Yelp to write this review.   Listen, Aunt Chilada's, before tonight... was a mediocre restaurant near where my boyfriend works. We'd sometimes go there for lunch if we needed a quick bite, and the salsa was good. So it was there to fill our need if we really had nowhere else to go. That being said, tonight was a disaster.  I'm sure it's because they had a few large groups of people who'd already sat down before us in the banquet room, wherever that is. But we waited for over an hour for our food. When it arrived, my burrito had cheese in it (I am lactose intolerant and asked for none). The waiter was courteous and zipped back to get me my correct order, but came back a mere ten seconds later with a cold burrito. Really? I know I've already waited, but at least give it to me warm.  All in all, the server generally ignored us because the table to our left was angry they weren't getting any food, and the table to the right of us had a solid 30 people in it. So, I get it in a sense. But it would've been nice to have them tell us straight out that they had a 46 person table on the other side of the restuarant that just ordered, and that the giant party to our right hadn't gotten their food yet either. It would've saved me a lot of time. Definitely was not worth the money, and never will return again.

URL3UKTWQNyGKQAAxTi2aw.text: Very disappointing. On a previous trip to Phoenix I went here with friends.  We had a great time sitting outside drinking and catching up.  I thought the food was good; however, I went here with my in laws today and it was NOT good.  I actually returned my food and I NEVER do that! There are so many other mexi places to go in Phoenix don't waist your time at Aunt Chilada's unless you are only getting drinks (chips and salsa).

aaTLzNuwXQqejAOAyz5ccg.text: I was not impressed with the food overall, it wasn't bad by any means.  The salsa was tomatoes with stuff but no hot/bite at all.   Yes, the flour tortilla chips were good and nice to have something different.  Just nothing to write home about.  Server was a good server.

XaVY5P_QptjdSmyhWCfS0w.text: I am going to give Aunty Chiladas 3 stars only because I have gone there since I was like 10.  This place has been a staple in the valley before the 51 went by etc etc.  It definitely looks like it has been there for a while and needs a good  asthetic cleaning.  Our table and chairs were sticky and it was pretty dirty outside on the patio.  There were chairs and miscellaneous items on the outside of the restaurant and it needs some TLC.  Chips (flour) are good but salsa has black olives (yuk, personal preference) and the hot stuff tasted like it had vinegar in it.  It has a great patio for daytime drinking.  Overall the food is above average.  I ordered the fish tacos and they were good.  My accomplice ordered a combo with your typical rice, beans, enchilada, taco etc.  The food was hot and good.  It didn't have a wow factor but the price was good and worth the money.  Holy smokes.......The service was awful.  I am not going to mention any names but it was slow in terms of business and even slower in terms of service.  I hope that they do not correlate but they usually do.  C'mon Aunty you are better than this!!!!!!    If you live in the neighborhood then it is worth going here.  I probably will not make the drive again.  Good luck Aunt Chiladas.

nIVqJqpDdk4oa7bp17G59A.text: I understand that this place is an old classic, but it seems more old than classic at this point.  It just feels dirty inside, the food is medium quality at very best and the service struggles.  They try hard, but it looks like the staff is on their own.  Probably my last visit unless there is a serious change.

JfOa_LoMg8PdlYsJ4gaFxQ.text: This is a difficult one, because I use to love Aunt Chilada's.  So here's what happened yesterday.  My family decided after much talk that we wanted mexican food, so I suggested AC, because even though I haven't been there in like 3 years, I us to love the food and service.  When we arrived around 3pm, we notice that there were hardly anyone there, my husband thought that was strange.  We decided to sit inside because the outside looked pretty lonely.  The guy at the door directed us to the right of the restaurant, there were one group of two ladies, that were leaving and us... so we wait, and wait, and wait... then a group of about 4 people sat down, and we still waiting... I notice that we didn't even have water, we looked around and there were two girls sitting to what it looks like the back area, complaining and talking, I know cause they were loud.  Out of know where comes this waiter and completely bypass us and went straight to the table that came after us... My husband looked at me got up and we left... that's when the waiter said hi... it was so bad.  What I also noticed is how dirty this place is, the fixture have pounds of dust, everything is dusty and looks dingy, so my though was, what is going on here, my husband responded, if this place looks this bad, I wonder about kitchen... sad, so sad, WHAT HAPPENED TO AUNT CHILADAS...WE ARE NEVER COMING BACK.  Down the street is Los Reyes de la Torta, is on a little strip mall, but the place is clean, service is impeccable and food was amazing... at least something good came out of all this.

U2kX9YFT7NSxmZX7Rnjdrg.text: Had just gotten off a long flight and wondered into Aunt Chiladas for the first time.  Loved the food and the margaritas !!  Will go back again.

eM0G2QBWW3SES-ThupCKUA.text: I attended a graduation party this weekend at this place and it was lacking a lot of things. The  service was very slow and only one waiter for a buffet of thirty people, which left a lot to be desired. The best thing I thought was the Grilled Salmon and Fideos oh and cant forget the fried ice cream the was excellent! The chocolate fountain was a huge disappointment, there weren't enough strawberries and all that was left were cantaloupes and honeydews and when we asked for more they said they did not have anymore strawberries...that's not good service of planning for a prearranged party. Would not be my on my list of favorites to return to anytime soon

Ybxt8hfdKDZ_8m9jvkNXFA.text: Great set up, great location, great flour tortilla chips, but everything else not so great.  I have tried a few different dishes, and they were not very good.  Too bad, it's a cool set up.

-7p6cBrrmTzblA2pZWE6EQ.text: The atmosphere is decent, but the food is absolutely terrible.  It is nothing but chewy meat covered in cheap cheese and grease.   The quesadillas are served in a pool of grease and the nachos are some of the worst in Phoenix,  The quality is an insult to the prices charged and an affront to good Mexican food.  Stick with the beer.

V5UUY-MS-I7a2Bh_oYhBtA.text: We hadn't been here for several years and got a coupon so decided to try again for dinner .  First impression - DARK!   Seriously, so dark we can't read the menu (servers had to provide flashlights) and then could barely see our food.  Food was OK, but a bit pricey for what we got and service was a bit slow and sporadic.  We got a sopapilla for desert and it was strangely salty and sweet.  Overall, "Meh" was our reaction.  Probably won't be back.

JtuPIRCMO3QhKcMjVm1k4A.text: love going there on Friday happy hour nice complimentary chips and salsa etc..  Good crowd, fast service never needed to look for my server. Nice food when I have eaten there on occasion.    Recently had lunch and love their "Street Tacos".  Will be back.

iU_SpW8Kz1AAgKUuVXvqXQ.text: I like to stop here on my way home from work on Thursdays and stand at the end of the bar.  The bartenders, Therese and Luby, are fast and professional.  They don't just stand behind the bar watching sports like at some other places but actually interact with the customers.  The servers are always nice and say hi when passing by.  The happy hour food is good and free though I rarely am hungry when I stop by after work - just thirsty :)  I would recommend stopping by when you are in the area.

aUCJQZhAEotb_B97CJZkyQ.text: DON'T GO! Don't waste your money, energy time or patience.  Remember .... You will never regain those precious moments of your life back!!!! DON'T DO IT, DON'T GO!! This place was so horrendous, I downloaded the yelp app just to leave a fair warning to any other unsuspecting folks. Seriously. I refuse to use Facebook and here I am writing this review. Here goes. I moved to this neighborhood abt 4 months ago from the East Coast and so many people rave abt this place. It's right by the resort, so I've been thinking that to survive it's gotta be decent right? I've driven by on a weekend, a weeknight... Always packed, no parking anywhere in sight with what appeared to be great and fun outdoor seating and a sprawling interior. So I finally make my way on over today... Mid afternoon on a beautiful Saturday when there's still parking and outdoor seating available. So excited.... I'm thinking... Yay me! Great food, clearly popular, nice spot to sit out and munch on a gorgeous day..... NOT!! Such an unsuspecting lamb I was!!!! Despite poor layout for parking and no clearly marked entrance... I find my way inside only to be wandering around looking for someone to seat me. After a few minutes at the hostess stand, popping my head around the corner to the inside bar with no acknowledgment, I make my way outside to the patio bar and inquire abt seating..... The poor woman behind the bar was fighting with an empty keg or something and only suggested someone would seat me from the (unmanned) hostess stand. I return inside and magically there are two employees there, clearly neither a hostess, no hello, no apology, no smile, no "hey you have toilet paper on your shoe"..... NOTHING.... just blank stares. I inquired abt seating. I finally made my way with my mute escort to a table after clearly expecting far too much from them to stop a random conversation to do their job.  It took a good 5-10 minutes before anyone showed up to my table.... Salsa with chips that were fried tortillas or more like the fried noodles in a Chinese restaurant.... A glass bottle of water.... And a waitress that seemed like a strung out 13 year old. I finally gave up asking her to repeat herself as I couldn't hear or understand her (I am a perfectly healthy, multi-lingual 30-something) and just ordered a beer.  It took her a good 10 minutes to deliver and return to take my order. The food? When it finally arrived? Awful. No flavor. The plate was all watery. And she spilled that watery whatever on me because her wrist was too weak when she was delivering my plate. Geesh. The food was not fully cooked through and was cold. It all tasted stale, freezer burned and just plain gross. That outdoor seating? The few tables of people at this time of day were all cramped in the same area with one larger family party.  Rather annoying and unnecessary. Was not once asked how my meal was, if I wanted another drink (maybe a few shots would have taken the edge off??!!?) When my check came? The waitress charged my card for the table next to mine and visa versa and handed us each other's credit card. Then when we both sent her back to correct it, she returned and handed us each the other's void. We had to coach her that neither of us wanted or should have the other's personal info. She seemed annoyed.  And we were so exceptionally calm and nice unlike so many would be. Unreal. Oh!  One more thing....  a bird in the tree above me crapped on my arm right after I was seated. I love animals. I do. I like to believe bird poo is good luck. It's a stretch here. All I can conjure is I was fortunate enough to get that extra napkin early on so I was prepared for the cleanup when she spilled my plate of watery crap on me.  Oh! And I actually got my debit card back and seem to have escaped without food poisoning. But the night is still young. We shall see. What a horrific dump of a place with awful staff and service. Just plain horrible.   NO STARS!!

4unxLgaRGC6Pq7PvnJcU8A.text: We waited 30 minutes tonight to get a table for 4 then once seated there was no service available to the table, no chips and salsa delivered, no waters, no one showed up even after speaking to the hostess twice.  So I went to the bar to get 2 margarita's and the bartender reached under the bar for a 5 gallon white paint bucket of premixed margarita's with tequila to fill a pitcher to pour the drinks.  We were out of there so fast and went to In and Out Burger instead.  DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!

MJQrthnK_VetwlFQeLWClA.text: We had a bachelorette party at the Pointe Squaw Peak and came to Aunt Chilada's for dinner. Their website says you have to arrive by 4:30 in order to reserve patio seating, but upon calling we discovered they don't adhere to that policy. Too late; we had to sit inside. The server was so rude that we asked for another. Food took an hour to get. They got at least two orders wrong - three times! They refused to split the tab. We discovered why service was taking so long when a member of our party went searching for the restroom and discovered the entire staff huddled in the hallway talking about our horrible table. I never saw the patio, just the nearly empty room they sat us in to wait for food. The food was typical Mexican food. I can't remember worse service at a restaurant.

ZlCFNg9uvd02wTWf5QKUUQ.text: Every year in the dead heat of summer I retreat to Hilton Squaw Peak and my first stop (after the lazy river of course) is Aunt Chilada's. Oh, the atmosphere, the history of the restaurant, the food and the friendly faces make me feel at home every time I am here. Whether it is sitting outside at the outdoor bar or seeking refuge in the air conditioning it is simply the best part of my trip. All I have to do is follow the painted chili peppers from Hilton ( I actually use them to get home if too much patron was consumed .....just kidding. I call the Hilton to have the golf cart pick us up! Duh! No, really that is available for hotel guests!) The fish tacos are the best I have ever had and I am a snob from California.  The salsa is southwest style and really good. Very good beans and rice and free buffets daily at happy hour. Who can complain! Bands on Fridays are fun too. Overall this is a gem in the desert. Always featured on Fox TV  and was also spotlighted on Drinking Made Easy. If you haven't been then you are missing out! Live. Love. Eat at Aunt Chilada's.

iC9eA6gIi7r7hOQTjnwpAQ.text: Have gone to this famous restaurant for years but this last visit was horrific; the bean burrito was filled with bean soup - all tortilla and no beans to speak of and the beef tacos tasted like chlorine. The side of peas (and whatever) was disgusting.  The only saving grace was the waitress was very nice.  P.S. Management dismissed our pleas and were too busy to care.  Won't be returning and won't be recommending.

K7HgI0lPPoryxyXvnuwyKw.text: Went to Aunt Chiladas for a happy hour. I cant really comment on the food other than finger food which wasnt good nor bad.  But i can comment on the salsa which I have had pleanty of.  As far as it being the best salsa in AZ that is far fetched.  It is decent if you mix the hot and mild together.  Actually it was much better than I expected.  I have a few recommendations of places with better salsa.  Much better salsa.  1.  Pedros in Glendale.  2.  The pico at comedor guadalajara.  3.  The green salsa at los dos molinos.

dhbgK_I2F6e6X0i06M76ng.text: Bocce Ball's, that was a some spicy Tortillion! What do you think about when you think about Bocce?  I know...my thoughts turn immediately to Mexican food, too! Aunt Chilada's has set up a bocce court right next to the walkway in the courtyard. When I first saw the bocce court, it was jarring...like walking by the sushi bar at Houston's...just because you can doesn't mean you should.  But, someone near the top of the Chilada family may, in fact, be a marketing genius! That thing really got a workout while we were there the other day. The Beautiful Carin and I hadn't been back to Tia Chilada's in a year or so, but we needed to reconnoiter...my strong and handsome son, Zachary and his lovely wife, Sarah are visiting next week and they want to go (good memories of another great visit:) We wandered in at happy hour (absolutely the best time to visit the Chilada family).  Lots of people drinking, eating chips and salsa, etc. (though not as many as past visits...the economy?).  We had no trouble getting a nice table out in the patio area, so we could watch an Italian sports staple being played in a Mexican restaurant:) The people watching at Aunt Chilada's is wonderful..all walks of life, all shapes and sizes...all getting their drink on with cheap margarita's and cheaper cerveza:) It's a tried and True formula for the transition from drone infested, uptight (I know, a word right out of the 60's) work-a-day world to a somewhat more relaxed, slightly (or heavily) inebriated night-time world.  So much fun to watch...esp. the guy with a six pack of margarita's under his belt, trying to bowl the bocce's.  It would be pretty tough to generate a bocce injury, but I think he managed it:) The service was a pretty good...we never had to wait too long for refills and they kept the chips and salsa coming ( the flour tortilla chips are one of the best parts of Aunt Chilada's:) Carin had a serviceable chicken chimichanga, and I had something called a tortillion (which, interestingly enough is numeral based nomenclature for this dish, reflecting the number of calories per serving)...shredded beef, cheese, beans, tomatoes, bacon (bacon!!!!), wrapped in a giant tortilla, dipped in egg batter and deep-fried...it sounded better than it was, but I ate about  1/2 and brought the rest home (might still be in the fridge, growling at me...not sure..afraid to look:) Nope, it's not the best Mexican restaurant in town, and it's not the best bocce court you'll ever see, but combined, they make Aunt Chilada's a decent place to have a bite and a cocktail, and to play the games that people play:)

tXdgJleVXfXWc2-uBdvsGA.text: Was not that impressed.. We were highly recommended to try this place out and decided to go for dinner.. Our waiter had no interest in us being there. The manager walked up to every table but us!! I would recommend going here if you want a good margarita ( that's about it) we will not be back!!!

t9Lh5-qYmkU7wywwU_6xCQ.text: This place is hands down my favorite Mexican food restaurant I've ever been to!!! The chips and salsa were the best I've ever had, the patio had a beautiful atmosphere/environment, and the appetizers/entree were phenomenal! I can't believe this place is only given 3 stars because I would've thought it would have at least 4 star rating, if not 5 stars! You won't regret it if you choose to eat here!!

Gp0KPLiMc3LBUP8-gX3hyw.text: The food was fine and the staff was friendly. I appreciated how easily they split the check between our group of 8.

TC0jBCcBchKj0FQW1ggTUw.text: Came in for lunch yesterday and order and bean and cheese burrito. Food was good and so was the service at the bar. You even get free chips and salsa thrown in with your meal when you take out. Definitely a quick place to grab lunch and head back into the office.

U4DMEowy87Y5eVL3J_u7Bw.text: The oldest restaurant in Arizona and the food tells you why they've been around so long!!  Outstanding food. The salsa and chips are made fresh and excellent. The outdoor patio is large, covered and unique. The chicken fundito is a must try.

NHgTB9QCLQCLpFBN-zETqw.text: Slow service....Mediocre canned food....skunky refried beans....bland canned tomato salsa....only place in all of Phoenix that I've had whole black olives in the salsa....still trying to digest that one (literally....!)  Eating here is not recommended....  The only saving grace was tonight's band....  Cold Shot and the Hurricanes ....better advice,  see them at the Rhythm Room ....SRO!!

b8zxMFcR6IeA_JduGSzRhw.text: Great Mexican restaurant down the street from our hotel. The staff is very friendly. They even have a treasure chest kids can pick a toy from after dinner!

J6o2LVgPCit0kAdlewmC0A.text: So I am eating my words from my review in 2010.  The dust bunnies on the ceiling are still there - I looked (minus a star).  We ordered the cheese crisp to start and it was really good.  The tortilla crust wasn't soggy at all and it did not swim in oil.  Both salsas went well with it.  I ordered the fish tacos.  The fish was not rubbery and had plenty of fresh flavor.  The plate also came with a lemon wedge and a lime wedge.  Perfect meal.  Also liked the Spanish rice much better than the fideo.    The rest of the table ordered the quesadilla sampler and a bean burro.  Both looked pretty good, but I was too busy enjoying my tacos.

x1BvnbauTSFdfbrO3pk6cA.text: Completely obsessed with this place! It's my favorite! The flour tortilla chips are amazing! The drinks are strong which is a blessing with how much drinks cost these days and they even made me something personal that was not on the menu! The staff is so sweet and friendly! It's a hidden gem with a great atmosphere and not everyone knows about it so that's a plus!

laBLyH-Bsk0o5vO8vZwnvg.text: This place is great! Good drinks, food and ambience! This place is perfect for happy hours and fun dinners! Lauren was our bartender and she was very fun, fast and attentive to our needs! Will definitely be back here!

NfbnsWbrZRrTX3LXQpQvNg.text: The food is awesome. I love the fish tacos and the creamy chipotle chicken. The only downside to the restaurant is the servers & the cleanliness... Or lack there of..if the waitress's became a little nicer and the restaurant a little cleaner..I think they would increase in ratings and business.

Gsw8jHwLDoLeCFrw0garDQ.text: You want to talk about a dreamy draw...... Bar tender Lauren is the dreamiest of all draws.  Oh and her Margs are good too.

tBqpn-2gqQ-eO2a0WEb43w.text: get irene's wrap with a side of chips and salsa! absolutely delicious and very fresh. i order this every time

yldawKTENV-xyOfFFc_WXA.text: Aunt chilada restaurant is super good, lot of food, coming on our trip from California to texas, we passed to phoenix and i was searching for pet friendly restaurants,  and i found this one, omg, we got lot of food, chips salsa, food very yummy,  i give 5+star

kQ2qWqnigo3ZMLl7T4suew.text: When asking for an extra tortilla for my fajitas they gladly gave me one and charged me an extra 2.50 without telling me. 2.50 for a tortilla after paying $15 for a fajita plate. That's pretty steep. And without saying a thing when inquiring. BS

kJxFj1sSvxCPZYoYqP8Qug.text: Visiting from ca, it is excellent for casual dining. very nice server. Wife had the shrimpand scallop enchiladas with verde sauce and a plus. I stole half. I had polbana chiles with beef and jalapeno crem cheese sauce and it also very good. Generous portions great spicy salsa with cumin and pico de gallo with olives was different.

JFJHSbzZuNufxDXXzkfZLA.text: Had a baby shower here today. Our server, Manny was AWESOME! Food was great! Beautiful day!

FiGIckukEqhikI4cZjel6w.text: Adorable spot for some great food.  You kind of have to dodge the birds outside but I thought their food was delicious.  Would like to go at night and enjoy the cute patio.  When friends come into town this will be a place we will go.

vjpcjR04iTB0Ctd9iPZRbw.text: We loved the patio, the service was simply amazing! This is for sure my favorite place in Phoenix.  The chip you can tell are homemade, and OMG the salsa.

CeLP-87gfdh3UtJGIqWhiA.text: Had a birthday party there. It housed our 80 really close friends and a couple more parties. A gf ordered the chicken enchiladas, which usually are dry and not so good. I tried hers and ordered my own. Fantastic food and service. Excellent atmosphere! Completely satisfied, and I'm hard person to satisfy with food. I'll be back real soon.

iSLX_HAJo6q3mukdU-AGzw.text: Somewhere between BAD & BLAH...  describes the bland food our group had here. The setting is very nice & the margaritas are good but that's it. The food was very bland, lukewarm, just disappointing. Usually so-so Mexican food can be made more tolerable with some salsa but even the salsa here doesn't help.   Also, if there are unruly children using the bocce ball court crashing the balls into the wooden frame like when we were there, it makes the lovely outdoor patio a much less desirable place to be.  Definitely will not go here again.

7hSyiYM5tkkYigclyMtxcw.text: Only gave it five stars ,cause there is no way to give six or seven. The best Mexican food around. Drive 45 minutes to get there. Happy hour has fabulous margueritas at great prices, and the food cannot be beat!. Even the table salsa is top notch. Can't wait to return and take someone who has never been there.

QhbtwHaAmc3Nqf7fKSdJwQ.text: We visited Aunt Chiladas patio because we wanted to bring dogs.  We were welcomed so nicely!  They have a whole area dedicated just to dogs so you are sitting with other dog friendly people that come.  This is such a great place to sit and relax and have lunch.  The food is fantastic.  We are vegetarians and they added Vegan fajitas to their menu.  They were fantastic!

u5NMq4EYQFyWO3y0c0fFzg.text: Just ate at Aunt Chilada's and it was very tasty. Some people commented that they didn't like the noodles (fideo) with the beans but that was my favorite part! I didn't really care for them alone, but mixed in with the beans it was delicious!   I ordered number 7 (cheese enchilada + green corn tamale) which was good, albeit pretty standard and my mom got the chicken tortilla soup which she said she would definitely get again. And I'd have to agree with the other yelpers- the chips and salsa are FANTASTIC!

_YYE3zsplPxAHLnfgPyxiQ.text: My husband and I met some friends here last Friday after work. It was my first time being at the original Aunt Chiladas . I had been to the one in Tempe but didn't realize they are not affiliated?  The history and the character of this location is amazing.! From the service of our waitress, to The delicious taco bar and the personality of the chef JD , it was an overall phenomenal experience . Exceeded my expectations ! cannot wait to go back!

jakrx0yZBizmPImznvjCpQ.text: Food was tasty, service friendly but imprecise.  Margaritas not bad.  Vegetarians be sure to ask about everything because they use chicken stock in lots of things.

eHFa4P64xQ7xw0VjePDDgg.text: LOVE the flour chips and delicious chunky salsa! Had Dan as my server and he was too rad!!!!! Will be back for sure!!!

p9LEsqCoOXYKqe-4CgyE_g.text: Aunt Chiladas is amazing!! I had the chicken pechugas. They were really good. Melted cheese over a chicken enchilada. The beer was really cold and the staff was amazing! Marie, the bartender was telling me the history of the restaurant and how the place has a haunted history and that following prohibition, they were granted the first liquor license. Everyone was really friendly and it really felt like a home town bar in the neighborhood. I will definitely be back when I am in Phoenix. Big props to to Marie!

YwLR9yjL3IuDI3NmOXcdPA.text: We went here while visiting our son and grandson in Phoenix  I cant say that I was too impressed with the meal. I got a beef tamale and 2 beef enchiladas which were OK but far from anything special. The Fiedo was pretty tasty and we both thought that the chips and salsa were good, especially the flour ones.  Will we go back, possibly during happy hour for the free buffet and because the chips and salsa here are very tasty.

T18eUmvYXnRa1dGGOGn1Dg.text: Husband & I went for dinner one Sat nite followed by breakfast the next morning while staying at the Hilton down the street. The spinach & chicken enchiladas were to die for, but the other three meals were mediocre. Service was unimpressive due to MIA and apathetic servers both times. Three stars for cute southwestern patio & enchiladas.

daEv1tZWQ8l7MxDKD2dXUA.text: Terrible experience, don't sit on the patio. We waited at least 25 minutes after being seated for lunch.  Nobody ever came to our table.  Finally somebody showed up and went to 2 other tables who had showed up 5 minutes or more after us.  She didn't have the courtesy of saying "I'll be right there". The place was slow so there was no excuse.  Not sure if the food was any good. We walked out.

GusPRlVeR_ul3U4hjwMNjg.text: This was a fun place, which had been recommended by a few people I know. A bit difficult to find because of the mostly residential setting and very crowded due to happy hour.  In all honesty the service was slow though the server did keep coming back to apologize.  Bonus was that for the healthy eater there were options. Often this is a very difficult task!  I thought the chips and salsa were good - flour chip ones were great. I do wish that their "hot" salsa had been spicier though I do have a love of exceptionally spicy food & for me, habanero salsa is "medium".  I would definitely go back though. Good evening overall.

i_jS-c7VPpXIZEvaOAxMRw.text: Aunt Chiladas is awesome! The food is great especially the delicious chips and salsa! The service is superb our server Tanner was professional and courteous!! Definitely a favorite !

UzN8MUWp5nRHY-POusnRoA.text: If eating in a filthy daycare center is your idea of a great dining experience, this is a must try place for you!  We stopped in for brunch last Saturday when we were feeling in an adventurous mood and looking to deviate from our tried and True brunch spots.  It was a beautiful day so we asked to be seated outside and as the hostess lead us to our table, it became apparent that there was NOWHERE on the patio and perhaps the entire restaurant that would offer us any solace from the excessive number of running, screaming, sticky fingered children who had apparently consumed too much sugar at the chocolate fountain.  Now, I understand that when sitting outside in the Phoenix area, tables and chairs aren't always spotless due to the dust factor, but one would have expected that our plastic tablecloth would have at least been wiped down sufficiently to remove the layers of food that had accumulated over what I'm guessing was at least the past few months.  After a significant wait, a server (not ours) showed up with some water that was served in glasses designed to hold enough liquid to quench a toddler's thirst (although, given the number of toddlers present, perhaps this was intentional) and some chips, salsa, and hot sauce.  The chips were of both the flour and corn tortilla varieties and were rather heavy on the grease.  The salsa was so mild, the only real flavor that it had was that of the sliced black olives in it, which is not necessarily a quality one seeks in a salsa.  The "hot" sauce was actually just as mild as the salsa and was served in a glass bottle that was so filthy and had so much food stuck to the outside of it that my hands were actually sticky from touching it.  At long last, our waiter finally showed up to take our drink order: a mimosa for me and a bloody mary for my husband.  After another ten minutes, he finally reappeared with the drinks and had I not been quick to cover my white shorts with my napkin, we would have been heading home for me to change since he'd spilled the bloody mary while carrying it and cluelessly reached across me with it to set the drink in front of my husband, causing a stream of spilled tomato juice to run down the plastic tablecloth and onto my legs.  The only redeeming factor that pulled this place up to three stars was actually the food.  I ordered a two item combo with a cheese enchilada and a bean & guacamole tostada and when the food finally arrived, it was clear a one item combo would have been more than enough as both items were huge.  All of the tostada ingredients were fresh and tasty and the cheese enchilada was flavorful too.  My husband had the huevos rancheros which he also thought were quite good.  This place is definitely a good value for the price as it's very inexpensive, but having heard that they actually host wedding receptions here, I would have expected a lot more in terms of the atmosphere and service.  It's a place that we won't hurry back to, but won't cross off the list as I've definitely had far worse food and overall dining experiences at other Mexican restaurants in the Valley.

N9jGOTxWUYfLcVuCmcB0fw.text: This has one of the best patios in Phoenix. If you're looking for a place to have a margarita, people watch, and enjoy awesome weather, this is the place to be. I love the food.  I personally can do without the flour tortilla chips; I'll usually dig through to get to the corn ones! The salsa rocks and I've always had good service.  A Phoenix must-visit IMHO.

IOpMm3WXNE5tz2vRYAR_QA.text: I actually ate at Aunt Chilada's twice yesterday and have eaten there quite often over the last year.  Lunch was good with both the food and the service being done right.  Went back last night because it was a beautiful night and we wanted to sit on the patio.  Initially the hostess was not very accommodating but reversed track and sat us on the patio.  Chips and a bottle of water showed up pretty quickly but unfortunately no glasses.  We sat there for about 10 minutes without seeing anyone else.  I have been in the food service business for years so I am pretty forgiving so this was not a big deal.  What was a big deal was that they were apparently having a function for a girls softball team and while the parents were inside their girls were on the patio "playing".  12 - 14 of them yelling and screaming and running around.  While they do have a bocce court on the patio, its not a playground although this was not the first time we have seen children using it as such.  It was the first time there were so many and so loud.  Had we been served a little faster it might not have been so annoying but with nothing to do but sit there and listen to all the noise we decided to leave.  As we got up the waiter hurried over and asked if everything was OK.  We explained we had come for dinner and the noise was too much.  To his credit he asked if he could give us a gift certificate which was nice but didn't mean much as we had made a special trip to enjoy a nice dinner at a nice restaurant.  If we wanted to be around of obnoxious kids on a playground we would have chosen Chucky Cheese or Peter Piper.  Probably won't be returning any time soon as it is a drive for us and not knowing what to expect (nice restaurant or kids day out) its probably not worth the effort.  In regards to the girls softball team, the parents of the Hotshots should be ashamed of themselves.  I coached travel ball for 15 years from 10U through 18 Gold.  My daughter is a coach for one of the premier high school programs here in AZ.  Never would one of my teams been this obnoxious and rude.  The Hotshots have been around a long time and have been a premier program in AZ for a long time.  If any of the people who are running this program happen to read this, you may want to tell your coaches that as long as your team is wearing its name on their shirts they should act with some class.  When my daughters played in college, the first thing they were told was you represent the school in all you do.  We told our players the same thing and that is why all of my seniors received scholarships to play at the collegiate level.  They could play and they were respectful and had class.  There is more to being an athlete than just what happens on the field.  This team was an embarrassment to your program.

7xGOd8mVe_UoAtXIuhoR1g.text: Every Friday night, there is live music and every single time we've been there, the band has been awesome.  It's a great atmosphere.  You can hang out inside and dance or go outside and sit down with your friends and still hear the music.

rVR3na_3C6BllT0U2Mms1g.text: I'm a little conflicted in giving Aunt Chilada's a rating: I've been to the restaurant many times and would possibly say it's my favorite Mexican place to go for dinner (not that I've been to too many Mexican places since I just moved here and my boyfriend is a creature of habit).  The main problem is that the food has been a disappointment more often than not.  Love the hand shaken margarita, which comes with your choice of top shelf tequila and a floater (we usually go with Cointreau).  The flour chips are also really delicious, even if they're not authentic Mexican.  I was iffy on the salsa at first, since it has most of the garden thrown in (olives being the main rogue ingredient), but it's really grown on me over time.  Don't have too many recommendations on entrees.  The fajitas are ok and come with enough to take home for lunch or dinner the next day.  Pretty much everything else I've had has been a failure: greasy, oily quesadillas, dried out machaca and chicken in enchiladas, a chili relleno that was 75% breading.  Thing is, by the time I've enjoyed my margarita and some flour chips out on the awesome patio, I don't need much else to make me happy.  Two stars for an indoor experience, four stars for the patio.  Average it out for three overall.

OgFS7W14r_kH28bkeCzDIQ.text: Really liked the food. The fiancee's sis got some sort of veggie fajitas...I'll DEF get that the next time I go back. Not much else to say, it was a mexican restaurant. They are so numerous in Phoenix, it's hard to be super impressed. I'd definitely go back though. Everything on the menu looked tasty!

ii6J63wW6tCM8DV0brgclg.text: Chips and salsa are great! Great friendly staff! Awesome homemade hot sauce!

NTEiHCTshkz72q_-NOuehg.text: Another hidden gem of Mexican food. We were staying at the Hilton right down the street and my son and I were craving some yummy Mexican food. The chips are to die for. They are a mix of both flour and corn tortilla chips and the salsa is just so unique and fresh. They have a great menu selection of all different types of entrees along with a great kids menu which is always a bonus because I have a 7 month who eats whatever I'm eating and a nine-year-old. I ordered the shrimp fajitas so much flavor and very fresh. My son ate quesadilla chips guacamole rice beans.. also he got a hot fudge sundae that was bigger than his face. We live out in Glendale and I definitely will meet at the half hour drive plus just to come up here again because it was that delish.

nnoXsNDM00eFbeMaC45oJg.text: Absolutely GREAT mexican food! Great service. We met the owner who actually assisted in serving us and was friendly. We were referred here by the staff at the nearby Hilton. I love finding great restaurants on vacation that are worthy of returning to.

jH6q7PGmF_QCJ2sxYOwcIQ.text: This is a great little Mexican place, that our family comes to every year when we are in town for Spring Training.   The atmosphere is fun, and lively. They have a big outdoor seating area and plenty of indoor space if it's a chilly night.   The food is fantastic! NOTE they serve Beans and Fideo as their sides but you can ask for rice if that's what you prefer. The Fideo is excellent though! My go to item is the cheese enchiladas! So delicious, probably some of the best I've ever had. I recently had the grilled fish tacos and loved them!

hpisxzoXGwn8hiRntTgGiQ.text: Great food and a great environment. Aunt Chiladas is tucked away in the heart of the Pointe neighborhood and encapsulates the aura of the community. The food is exceptional and their Margaritas are the best I've had. Would highly reccomend.

uRtWCxIIeEPepDlXpsO8IA.text: This is filling, unhealthy, amazing comfort food. If you're looking for light cantina style Mexican, this isn't the place. Their outdoor area is nice and the service is good. I've taken my out of town visitors here and it's been a win.

ul4sU13qKdSfQl6N6WVJQQ.text: WORST MANAGEMENT EVER! I do not recommend this place to anyone. Recipes tasted like can opened instead of most Mexican joints that are fresh made! I live in the valley very disappointed. I will say the server did a great job and was above average. Hostesses, like usual were young and on their phones the hole time. Manager was not present on the floor touching tables to check in experiences. When we checked in I left my card with the hostesses and told them I want to pay since I have family from out of town visiting . They told me they would make sure the server knew. When the server came back with the bill my sister visiting from out of town handed him her card. Little did I know the hostess forgot to give him my card so she actually paid. How embarrassing. The manager with frizzy black curlyish hair late 50's returned my card tossing it on to the table saying they thought you turned in a lost card then bolted off and never returned. First of all if that were the case then apologize that things were not handled correctly and hand the card back instead of tossing it into the queso bowl on the table. Secondly, re-run the transaction and make it right. Our entire table was shocked that leader of the restaurant would ever act like a 4 year old throwing customers belongs into food the way she did and then run off. She was at the table less than 15 seconds. We will never go back and never recommend anyone to stop in. I saw the 3ish star reviews before taking my family out. I guess this less than mediocre restaurant is perfectly fine with the low rating the way they train their lazy managers.

Ix8jOVdPxtpJ3ILvpsC1Dw.text: We love Aunt Chiladas. Been coming here for many years, got married here. Excellent food always. Michelle, Tiffany and the entire staff always go above and beyond to make our experience great!!! Nice hidden gem in Squaw Peak!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach Chicken Enchiladas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak And Shrimp Chimi covered in Queso
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Excellent Margarita Cheers

emPU_tDAeDJCVAqMcMar0A.text: Some pointers:  (01) The fried flour tortilla chips & salsa are pretty addictive.  Beware because you might find yourself accepting 1-3 baskets of them and not realize just how much you've consumed before your entree arrives. (02) The service is on the slower side, but the staff is accommodating and kind.  Given that we were there on a night with several large parties, Aunt Chilada's threw in a free dessert for the table to share.  (03) Don't expect to find many healthy options.  The best word I would  use to describe my tamale + cheese enchilada plate is SMOTHERED.  I haven't had that much cheese in a loooooong time. (Totally not complaining).  This may not be the best place to keep a new year's resolution, but it is a good place to gather with a group over a typical Mexican meal.  Everyone will find something they like here.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

F9kh_2K6Jm7NjB5H9Ok49Q.text: Our wedding and reception was held on the large patio.  The staff were amazing, the food was delicious!  Salmon, steak and all the Mexican food trimmings.  The service was stellar.  Our guests all commented on what a great place this was to have our wedding.  Thank you all for making our wedding day go off without an issue.  I would recommend anyone that wants to have a great event contact Michelle and the aunt chiladas team.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9juAQXSojqX0-9SCIjd4mg.text: Enjoyed a casual dinner with friends on their large outdoor patio with portable heaters. Festive atmosphere and good Mexican food. I'm glad they have Vegan Fajitas on the menu so I can eat healthy. Each entree is a large portion and I was able to split it with a friend. Enjoyed the friendly service. Be sure to read the history on the menu as this place is 125 years old!  A couple minor issues: we really needed a candle on the table as it was quite dark and we had to use our cell phone lights for ambient light. Also after visiting Straw-free Sedona it was frustrating to see plastic straws in every water glass. Sure wish restaurants in Phoenix would eliminate plastic straws as they end up polluting oceans and lead to death of seabirds and turtles.

rNaY8vq5zMVRCVfC43Xd6g.text: Excellent service we did our daughters wedding here they thought of everything and completely took care of everyone. So pleased we did her wedding here she was very happy on her special day.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

r0KpXkCGSWZd2IEeWXVz4A.text: Such a fun atmosphere, it makes it a place you just can't help looking forward to visiting. Patio is huge with gorgeous fountain. Service has never been poor. I wouldn't say it has been out of this world over the top fantastic only because the past couple of times I have been there, I have sensed a lack of genuineness in the servers enthusiasm.   Moral among staff members doesn't seem to be the absolute greatest, but it is not all together bad either. I think it likely may have to do with the many stressors that come with working in the high-demand "pointe" resort setting that they do.    One thing they get a definite thumbs up for is that they offer employment to the permanently disabled. I have seen them folding napkins and preparing place setting on more than one of my visits. I think this is wonderful especially having worked for the Social Security Administration for as many years as I did & being that a portion of my career was spent as a disability claims representative. I know that often times the abilities of our disabled community often go under estimated. Way to go Aunt Chiladas!   Right about now, you're probably wondering, "Okay, but how's the Mexican food, right?" Marvelous! Admittedly, it's not the most authentic you'll find in Phoenix, but they offer their own blend of American & Mexican options and their own brand of delicious. Thumbs up from me.

6RUXUpZm5sTb7OANfy331w.text: Been here a few times and a great experience each time.  Great Mexican food. Nothing too unusual but good nonetheless.  Their flour chips though!!! Be sure to be the first at your table since there's only a few per basket. Really good! The place is big and has outdoor games which is a plus when the weather isn't oven hot.  Great place and I think it's family run, which adds to its charm.

Hfs-p-7Nv8zZlb3g7ZSMbQ.text: Well I returned to this place with my boss after five years and I'm glad I actually tried the food this time around. The lunch fajitas at 12 bucks were excellent and very filling. They arrived sizzling and this chicken was tender and easily got tucked into the hot flour tortillas with all the usual fixings. We might have already been full from eating those deep fried flour tortilla chips we found in the opening chips basket.  Those received great reviews as did his sour cream enchiladas. Some tables are a tight squeeze to sit inside, but just get a table because the food is worth the visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sour cream
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fajitas

TtfvY93K-vGAQV6AK6-4DQ.text: We've been coming to this restaurant for many years. Tonight we ordered the most simple order. A couple cheese crisps and taco salad Service was so bad.
