Took over 30 minutes. When it did arrive it was wrong and bad.  Owner came over to argue everything was fine Server finally came back to bring bill. Asked if they thought a discount would be added. Told nope.  Have to say  last few times quality has gone down hill. Highly unlikely after all these years well be coming back any time soon. Plenty of good Mexican restaurants around.

8bXn2lB8nrm0wWLBJ6EO4A.text: 1. Flour tortilla chips are to die for!  2. Very attentive staff. 3. Family friendly environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I2MZrS0Qm50NgtTBAjP6OA.text: Absolutely amazing service! Absolutely amazing food! I had the fajitas!  So yummy!  And the Clooney margarita!! Place was amazing!  I have food allergies and they were super accommodating!

oDc6Yzqoya3YKEjJOw8YCA.text: Food and service is always excellent.  Love the chocolate fountain.  I have been coming here for many years.  Keep up the good job.

7CmoBaMniAcaYF-v9OvjiA.text: Great service! The food was very tasty. Chips and salsa was yummy, my margarita was done perfectly...

5C_6mZwdPumqsi0yNS5Qzg.text: The food is good, unless you like traditional tortilla chips and salsa. The chips here a mix of corn tortilla chips and flour tortilla chips. The flour tortilla chips were honestly the low of my entire day.  As far as the fried ice cream goes, the vanilla ice cream was good, but the rest fell flat. We were looking forward to the frosted flake crust, but supremely disappointed with the result.   The live music was dope. Would have been nice to have karaoke also.   *my friend would give this place 3 stars, but the additional star is only because it's close to her house*  Overall, not the worst experience, but not great.

Ci_CHZzlTKMa1pB1tyRNrA.text: Definitely recommend this place for a large party the staff was completely professional everything was right on time and everyone had a fantastic day great job to all who helped her grandmother celebrate her one hundredth birthday

ZKTs_RqWzwe-CbS6lvqZXQ.text: I've been coming to Aunt Chilada's since the mid 80's.  Always a reliable place for food and drink. The layout is ideal for large social meetups. Tonight was exceptional. Sarah (Sara?) the bartender was the best ever! Completely attentive and on the ball. Respectful and friendly. Amazing ability to multitask and not leave anybody waiting. Even remembered my name! 5 stars and 2 thumbs up!

9bNamBXXfobO2R0tY1zMCQ.text: Food is good.  Service is good.  It is not the best food ever, but it is a great local hangout with a fun atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy bean, cheese and chorizo dip

dtVh2WTfekvfc-oFh2VM6w.text: Food was ok, but it took forever. They were promoting their Mexican pizzas, and you would think they had prepared for people to order, but regardless the place was not busy at all, it took over 1 hour and when the pizzas finally were out, they sent one and then the second 30 mins later.  The pizza was too spicy.  The waitress was very kind, but too busy to refill our drinks, which because of the pizza being too spicy was a very needed.

OwHg2zn2qEKH2CfCEoDdhA.text: One of my favorite places have recommended to out of town Visitors no complaints their soft chips are great

vZzE-1CL84Y-4Mhyl8sEBg.text: Queso fundido has got to be the best thing I've eaten in phoenix.   I was stuck in the area for a full two hours at around 1pm and decided to have lunch at walking distance from the endodontist I had an appointment with.   It was hard to find the entrance, and almost gave up. Hint: it's on the back parking, right next to an old car husk.   Once inside I was the only brown person, including the staff, which felt odd but I kept going. Walked to my table in the deep part of the semi-huge building (it's not a warehouse but it's very nicely divided to give you a sense of spaciousness) and sat next to a fountain with tons of silk flowers instead of water. Why am I telling you all these details? Because...  It's how this food is best described. It looks strange, and like it may not work. But once you experience it, the whole thing clicks and takes you, not to the same boring Fauxican food taco bell, but to a place where flour tortilla chips marry an almost sweet salsa (with black olives!!!), right before the entree chicken melts along with all the cheesyness around it and yet their house made of a chimichanga shell (complete with a fideo backyard) remains crunchy and soft and expertly seasoned in all the right places.   People seem to love working here, and why wouldn't they? They work in the Disneyland of magical Mexican food.

7qUAi5KrnsvEkBQ67ceFew.text: The service was good and our waiter was really nice and helpful.  The chips were disgusting. The salsa was good though.  I ordered the bean burrito, it was not good. The beans tasted weird and so did the tortilla.  My husband order the fajitas and his tortillas tasted old and were crusty.    Definitely would not recommend.

u_HHMDFoyYcoyEPhD0MNog.text: This place is tourist friendly foodie restaurant. The wait is long "over an hour"and a lot of empty tables. Be aware and if you have children with you because of the LONG WAIT TIME.  The food is good.

_njP0v9l2evK9p7T8F2iFA.text: Well we went there today for a late lunch and first off they serve fried flour tortilla chips with corn chips on the bottom but they will bring a basket of stale corn chips on request. The "mild" salsa has corn and olives in it, (who does that) and it had no spice at all, and left a bad after taste. The hot sauce was not any better. The guacamole was very good. We decided we didn't want to chance ordering a meal, so we paid for the guacamole and the beer and got up to leave and on the way out the hostess, who I think is one of the owners with a raspy voice, asked how we enjoyed the food, and she evidently didn't really want to know the the truth because she became indignant so we told her if she didn't want an honest answer she probably shouldn't ask the question. On the bright side the waiter was extremely nice and understanding but I don't remember his name.

FtZcCri40U5Vr3k6RVXxkw.text: As far as mexican chow goes this was pretty good. Staff are nice ladies who don't mind a cowboy comin in for a plate of beans

IqCcVizscsf-XuPtyTO95Q.text: I just went in for a takeout order, first time here. The setting and design of the restaurant is top notch. So cute. And everyone in there is so smiley and nice! Great customer service. I haven't even eaten the food yet but I definitely am giving them 5 stars.

bdhsh_8QGR9inL065D9V1Q.text: I Love this location the patio/ outside area is nice and relaxing. If you love pineapples you have to try the stuffed one with shrimp so good.

LQWOqmGaiOh9Bufazi095g.text: The only thing I get here is the chicken enchiladas with spinach. The most delicious enchiladas ever! Don't like their chips and salsa though. The best place to sit for good service is the inside bar.

R2Lp83Y-HVyYM81wCwWhiw.text: Bleeeaah!  Our first visit here.  I think the appeal is the landmark building and a touch of nostalgia.  Good service can't make up for the completely unremarkable (dare I say "bad") food and we did try a number of different entrees, all delivering the same marginal quality.  There are so many other really good choices for Mexican food in the Valley, I see no reason to return.

Vs0E_qxNWyKMR4mLjW2FrQ.text: My wife and I really enjoyed the food this evening. The employees were so happy to help out with any questions we had. The food was above average.  The patio areas was what sold us. We will return at a later date for another great experience.

yxcBqkfs3YsGkhrDLbv0GA.text: Before anything, I have to say that the thing that stood out most to me was the staff of this restaurant. Every time I come, the servers and bar staff are amazingly friendly and greet customers in an inviting way. The servers start guests out with flour and corn chips with the salsa, which me and my group happily scarfed down. They are always warm and fresh. The food is good, and the drinks are exquisite, with enough options for everyone. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice meal with a cozy atmosphere.

uI85zsVUVhuVWZ7qHqLBAg.text: If you like a restaurant that allows a table of 10 women celebrating a bachelorette party to yell vulgarities and profanity while you are dining then this is place for you. Evidently lots of people like this place cause it was packed. Good chips and salsa, Mediocre food. Won't be back but they won't miss us

KMKaXt9SvYnTL52rAVMYcA.text: Service was adequate. The bougainvillea is really pretty. Dont come for the food-bland, oily, and completely uninspired. Everything is full of cheese.

xkfEJVtyohkg8LwsE_bwyQ.text: Hands down the best place to take the family for Mexican food. The kids loved the chocolate fountain. Food is great. We had the breakfast torta and the Aunt childas omelette. Both amazing!

obue3KhMElRedTErq7vqEg.text: Great Food & Better Service! Our waitress Emilie was amazing! Prompt, Courteous, Professional 5 Stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aaOco2JCHwHoGWCVzJ7LTA.text: A terrible HH!! We brought 20 people for a pre-homecoming party... All purchased alcoholic beverages- some ppl multiple beverages .. Food consisted of three banquet trays( one nacho, one enchilada, one chingalinga) HH was suppose to last until 6.30 food stopped at 5.45. Servers kept pushing he expensive stuff . We will head somewhere else with our dollars .. Great example of sad hour ... Nothing happy her

SNdtr-EgShbMK7Krvl47kA.text: I used to live walking distance away from Aunt C's, and it was always a good time no matter what night we'd pay a visit even before the bocce ball court was installed.  The prices I think are a little inflated for their attachment to the Squaw Peak Hilton but as a regular you figure out that the flour chips and salsa fill you up VERY well and a couple of cold beers/margarita's go a long way with an appetizer and can be considered a meal.    There may have been (very) few slip-ups over the years of visiting thus the 4 outta 5. But I have to admit we had our wedding rehearsal dinner here in the back room and they handled everything exceptionally from the whoops, we need another table, to wowing my new family here in AZ as well as my family from back east with great food and sopapillas (yum!), as well as keeping the margarita pitchers filled all night.  The outdoor patios and gardens make this place feel as though it's your own back yard, keep up the good work Aunt C's!!!!!!!!!!!

G1uADqvqyFkAyk9mgPzGsQ.text: Went for early dinner tonight (Friday, June 3rd 2016) - got there around 5:00 p.m.  Was seated quickly.  Service was good.  My dinner partner had the fish tacos (1 fish and 1 shrimp) - enjoyed both but would choose the shrimp only next time.  I had the fajitas - mixture of chicken and steak - very disappointed...so much so that I only took one bite of a piece of chicken and one bite of a piece of steak and told the waitress to take the meal away.  The chicken tasted like a baked / microwaved chicken breast that was then sliced and put atop some vegetables (no green peppers at all).  The steak was slices of a lower end cut of beef - cooked rare as there was blood oozing from the slices.  No grill marks, not seasoning, bland taste and very poor presentation.  I ate the condiments (guacamole, salsa, sour cream beans - still could not figure out what the ramen noodle type stuff was).  The tortillas were tough and stuck together - severed in aluminum foil.  The chips and salsa - which is complimentary for each table - was so/so....a mixture of chips with some being what one would expect (salty, crisp, not greasy) and others that were very thick, soft and buttery / greasy tasting.  Overall it was a poor experience for me and I would not return.  Shame - just moved into the neighborhood and it's only a couple blocks from my home.  Note:  they did remove the fajitas from the bill.

e28SLv6nSbhIaqgKddkyzA.text: Hands down the BEST chips and salsa in Arizona. The flour chips and the salsa are soooooo good. Seriously - SO good. Its fresh and chunky and to die for it. Its almost worth going JUST for the chips and salsa and a margarita. I'm shocked that Aunt Chilads only has three stars - its one of the better Mexican restaurants in the Valley for many reasons.   If you want an ambiance that makes you feel like you're in Mexico - this is the spot for you. Sit outside and you're surrounded by a cute bar, plenty of seating, music and lush greenery that just makes you feel like you're in a Mexican Cantina. I think they even had bocce ball. The margaritas are great and the food is good too. No complaints here.

8Vr7ELvdY5rzA6J7_2RZxA.text: My family and I absolutely love this place!  Absolutely awesome restaurant. The chips, salsa and guacamole are all incredible. Also, the jalapeno fajitas are to die for if you like spicy food!  I'm so happy that I live in Phoenix now so I can finally go here often.

Fr6pkB7UeJzEf0qbPVOH1Q.text: Aunt Chilada.. You bad senorita.. Here's your grade.. No bueno.. You get an F.. I drove all the way from my hood to go & visit you across town.. You treated me like a step niece that you hated !  Drink order took forever.. & was wrong.. No H2o.. Despite 3 , yes 3requests.. Order was wrong., took a bazillion million minutes to get.. And the waitress was not a happy girl.. Nope, Aunt Chilada she was not.. And your chips were stale too.. The cheese on top the taco came when of all things I finally get to pay my debt to you for bad service and nibbles.. And then she forgot the credit card.. What the heck, Tia.. Was she getting her nibbles & snack on across the way with my card.. ?? Well.. Sorry , but you let me down..& it'll be a long time before I visit your casa again...

fYTCTcNM3A44d0Abl_VUIQ.text: My friends go to the free buffet most Fridays after classes so I joined them. I was excited because they rave about how good the food is and the drinks are cheap!  HOWEVER....the buffet was set outside on the patio where it was freezing so the food was cold and gross.   Why would you put uncovered hot dishes outside. Sternos cant keep up with that. I guess starving students are less likely to notice cold food??  I would rather pay than eat that buffet again.  Makes me wonder how their regular quality and care to food temps is.  Not excited to try that again. Cute outside space, games and places for dogs. Spring may be a better time to enjoy this venue

raA-Qg6Jm-u46zI7zk16uw.text: Aunt Chilada's is an amazing Phoenix experience! Always a great time with yummy hand shaken margaritas and bottomless yummy chips and salsa.  Best of all the service is great, especially from Nadia the hostess with the mostest!!!

hUxNkp0jnlGDjpNDAcVQXg.text: This place was really good. I absolutely LOVED their flour tortilla chips. I'm pretty picky when it comes to Mexican food, as I was raised on homemade Mexican food, but I thought this place was pretty decent. They have great customer service. The ambiance was great. Oh, and I can't forget, the margaritas were amazing!! I would love to come back to this place again, when I'm in AZ.

DAv98s8toW3-7yZWimUHXw.text: Disappointed in the food. The items we ordered were flavorless. Our orders were brought out wrong. Our server was seriously super slow. On the flip side the place is rather nice with a huge outdoor patio. Unfortunately, I do not foresee myself returning here.

HxlkCO96-7PwLthNRxOwEA.text: We went there this past weekend.  There are always private parties going on during weekends, so be prepared to wait to get seated.  Once we got seated, we were right in the middle of traffic, which was not very pleasant.  My husband ordered a chimichanga, which he was not impressed with.  I ordered the fish tacos, which were really good.  We do love their salsa and chips.    In the past we used to come to Aunt Chiladas frequently.  The atmosphere is fun and laid back.  We felt like something had changed this past trip, aside from the menu.  We didn't get that warm fuzzy feeling we used to get while visiting.  I don't think we will be back.

I1oywO2yAiStx_yQH7gzkw.text: The food here was not incredibly  authentic, but was very good. The atmosphere was causal and family friendly, and the waitress was helpful and polite. They did not take reservations, which was a shame, but had lots of open space with tables. I got the carnita street tacos- HEAVEN ON A PLATE!

dHucPmesLHMiYHasTXEDhA.text: Attended a yelp event here tonight with my boyfriend.....never been here before. The food was excellent and it was served buffet style. Had beef tacos, taquitos, tamales, chicken wings....followed by fried ice cream, sopapillas and flan. All of the food was wonderful, tasty and packed with flavor. Enjoyed all of this on the outside patio. Will come back again.

OBCAtt6QmqsdQediOJdMdA.text: Yep. Still sucks.  Went their recently for a friend's birthday. Didn't want to but it was for one of my oldest friends and I didn't want to disappoint her.   I only ordered drinks and had some chips and salsa. Drinks were good but the chips and salsa weren't great. The server seemed annoyed I wasn't ordering food, but do you blame me with my past experiences? I had a taste of my friend's cheese enchilada and vegan black beans the staff is so proud of. Not impressed.  Yelpers please keep in mind that some of the 5 star reviews you see posted for Aunt Chiladas quite possibly may be an employee. How do I know this? Because I got a message from an employee after my last update. She said that she knows which bartender I am talking about that was rude at my HS reunion and said "he is really great, just not for banquets." She also said "I do not know why any server would yell at you, that is just ridiculous." And my personal favorite "And yes, there is bacon and lard in our re fried beans. I have no hispanic background, so I am not sure what is traditional. But they are pretty tastey." But then she says " With that said, I really hope you come back."  Direct quotes. And this employee has a glowing 5 star review for Aunt Chiladas and she says nothing about being an employee. Isn't this breaking some sort of Yelp rule? And what business does she have messaging me unless she is a manager?   Sorry but I wouldn't trust any Mexican restaurant in the Phoenix area that has less than 4 stars. There are many better choices.

JyFVBob_3hdTeRWtDVOdJA.text: Very friendly staff and great prices. Do yourself a favor and get the Prickly Pear Margarita. The chips with the salsa were a mix of flour and corn which I really liked.

2EcgrO6zYFOGrWCjzo6EbA.text: A Mexican restaurant & cantina that stands out in the southwest; unrivaled chips and salsa, quaint setting, striking and gracious staff.  Craving curbing classics like fajitas, enchiladas, tacos and tamales could easily have one overlook enchanting favorites such as shrimp stuffed pineapple or comforting chingalingas.  Inimitable ambiance has supported everything from weddings, charity events, and blow out Cinco de Mayo celebrations, to intimate date night getaways, happy hours, or Sunday brunches with visiting loved ones.  Monday night football, casual business gathering, or weekend day drinking; Aunt Chiladas is the neighborhood drop in for regulars and the stuff out of towners reminisce of once departed.

qgiOA0LGQMrd8jQc7LFSfQ.text: Birthday party. 30 people. Buffet style. I wouldn't go there again, but it was nice enough for that night.  Food wasn't spectacular, and there wasn't any sort of view. I guess it's a great place for a party, though.

PJ8GQB47eMgNGaT1zsj9Tw.text: I really wish I could put 4.5 stars, because I usually don't put five as a rule, reserving that for mind blowing experiences. But, it's earned a special star, and it's a good 4 anyway.  My husband and I eat here regularly, and often stay up very late.  This is only place open late at night, anyway near us.  That deserves a star. Most places close at 9.  If you call to order take out at 8:45, some won't even take your order.  I'm from Chicago, even in the suburbs, there are usually places open during the week, at least until ten.  The food here is, for the most part, outstanding, gourmet, & good Mexican, but it's a fusion.  Familiar with good Mexican food, like I said, from Chicago, even visiting/eating in Central Mexico, such as in Michogan, it has only a slight similar quality.  But, unlike most "anemic," and Americanized Southwest food, this stuff is full of flavors. They have as an appetizer, what I called 'flautas," they call them, taquitos? Those are awesome, probably the closest to authentic Mexican street food.   The salsas, the ones you pour over certain dishes, and the generous portion they give you of fresh salsa is delicious, again, Americanized, but not "weak," as with most Southwestern food I've tasted. The seafood enchiladas and quesadillas are amazing, packed, stuffed with seafood, scallops, shrimp, etc. and do not taste fishy.  This place is on the pricey side, yes, but they give you a lot of food.  I would say you could split it, and you could, but the food is so good, you are going to want to pig out, seriously, I love to share my food, but when I eat here, it's mine! The flan is really, really good.  The people are kind and nice so far.  This is a favorite restaurant for me. I did eat here once for breakfast/brunch, and that was very delicious.

VjdTYqNyE-LHBJ5QZClwIQ.text: Went here back in May after work to meet up with some folks. The complimentary happy hour grub was alright, nothing to write home about: standard chips, salsa, and, no surprise, enchiladas. They only had really small plates though so it was hard to fit much of anything on them.  Standard Mexican beer selection plus hottie waitresses who looked and dressed as if they could have been working at Hooter's but ended up working here instead because, as luck would have it, there ain't no Hooter's by Squaw Peak....yet. Also, there are pretty large outdoor seating areas with lots of trees around.  Aunt Chilada's isn't a bad place by any means, as you could go much worse when it comes to gringo-ized Mexican joints, but it's nothing much special either, college-age hottie waitresses notwithstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m3LNlTnEnqJ-fbjG_2zQlA.text: I've been here a few times. Very cute atmosphere. I definitely recommend it. I came with a very big group today, everyone around me loved their food. I had to send the soup back because if was luke-warm. However, they were very quick to make up for the mishap, and the service was excellent. My friends were all thrilled with their meals. The tortillas before the meal are excellent as well.

DWevxwqgpqxo_pCzjUb9dA.text: jumping up and down, flailing my arms and shouting is probably the only way to get served here. we counted three servers that walked by three times and nobody cared to take our order or ask if we were served. we walked out hungry without being served and in desperate need of a cocktail. this place might be good, but our service experience will keep us away, forever!

b13fT1CK1GYw-JNXZbi_Iw.text: My husband and I just moved here from Chicago and we've have Mexican food every Saturday for the last 2 years.  Needless to say, we've been on the hunt for the best Mexican restaurant here in the Phoenix area since we moved here 2 months ago.  Our criteria is simple:  (1) Margaritas, (2) chips and salsa, and (3) food and fajitas.  (1) Margaritas --  Thumbs up!  So far Aunt Chiladas has the best Margaritas I've had in the valley and we've been to quite a few places including Tee Pee (where the food is good but the Margaritas suck).  We ordered the hand shaken margarita and its a pretty big serving with lots of the good stuff in it...  (2)  Chips and Salsa -   Thumbs up!  The chips are unusual in that they are flour not corn and come out nice and hot.  We liked the salsas and I love black olives so the fact it was in the salsa was a big yum factor for me.  (3)  Food/Fajitas - Thumbs up!  We ordered a few different things including the Chingalingas (yum!), steak fajitas, and enchiladas.  We also really liked that they give noodles (fideos) with refried beans instead of rice.  Those are awesome.  The steak fajitas were the bomb  The only downside is the service is just way too slow.  I mean, we waited and waited and waited.  They were nice enough but bring a pillow because it'll be a while!!

nKVjKsHIf6nU6O3rTVunZA.text: Nice and accommodating wait staff. That was about it. Parking is weird. The front entrance is not where the parking lot is. It's on a side street. Then when you walk in you have to keep your kids from putting their hands in the algae filled fountain. I think the goldfish live off algae. They do wedding receptions there if you're into that sort of thing. The salsa and chips are overrated. The carne asada burrito was horrible. It tasted like charred asada. The kids liked the kids menu, but I've definitely had much better Mexican food. Please clean the algae filled fountain. Goldfish deserve better!

44Xoy67hT0uxpvaTt2sgcA.text: Very SLOW service for a Tuesday night with light crowd.  40 min to get served.  Typical Tex Mex food.  Nice atmosphere but doesn't measure up to the many Mexican choices in Phoenix.

W1HjmuCg2_9pW0r1S-_DXQ.text: Service is decent, food is just okay, and location is a little hard to find if you don't know what you're looking for. It's a crazy fun place during happy hour - voted one of the best in Phoenix.

bcIu3nyAOzCf8jeES0d-_A.text: Living in San Diego, I expect authentic Mexican food when I go out to eat at a Mexican Restaurant.  Sadly, I did not get that here.  The wait staff was very attentive; I will give them that.  The kid's meals were large portions, and their kids french fries were actually really good.  The chicken fingers looked a little scary, and the quesadilla had very little cheese on it (the part my 1 year old will actually eat).  My chicken fajitas were fair, at best.  The guacamole was pretty good, as were the refried beans.  I have no idea what the Mexican rice was all about - it looked like cut up spaghetti noodles with Mexican spices in it.  It was not rice.  The chips that everyone raved about?  I wasn't a fan.  They tasted like rejects from a taco salad shell to me.

8YgjAhA_J-C_mKRNhAhFBw.text: Four stars for the fun atmosphere and friendly bartender. :)  My friend and I never ended up ordering food, just a few drinks.  There was actually almost nobody there when we arrived mid-afternoon, but the outdoor seating area was so cool, and the bartender so warm and nice to chat with, that before we knew it we'd been there several hours.  It was a Saturday, so it picked up a lot as the night went on.  The thing I liked best was that there were several "locals" (of all ages) who go there all the time, so it was kind of like everybody knew everybody, and even if they didn't know you yet, you were still a friend.  Sitting at the bar, people were having conversations with everyone around them, beside them, across from them, wherever...whether they knew each other or not.  It was that kind of vibe.  A lot of fun, but in a chill way.  I'd like to come back with a bigger group of friends, this would be the perfect next-stop after spending a day sipping cocktails on the lazy river at the resort.  And I see now from other reviews that I'll have to give the chips and salsa a try when I come back.  So yes, then I guess I will need to come back.  There, it's settled.  I will be back. :)

-vP78OxBfdVPr3W0fkZcHA.text: We were invited here with some friends and the food and drinks and service were alright.They were not terrible, but not worth going back for. Just very cheesy and greasy and I am sure a fat and calorie bomb!

l-J2zCI0VB-W5otqbxN_aA.text: I sat at the outdoor bar under a straw rooftop and the March breeze cooled down the Phoenix 90-degree March heat and I truly felt like I was in Hawaii. The margaritas were S-T-R-O-N-G and the crowd was lively and fun!

vK5GbYopMMCDu8dZOCL7nw.text: Been going to Aunt Chilada's for over 10 years now and I'm sad to see the quality of the food and service declining.  I had my wedding reception on the patio 11 years ago and could not have been happier.  Went for dinner last weekend for my wife's birthday and don't know if I'll ever go back.  Our group waited over an hour for our meals to arrive and during that time our waitress only came to the table once to take drink orders.  No one should have to leave their table and go to the bar to order a drink.  The one time our waitress did come by she said there was a mix up with our order.  When it finally arrived 3 of us asked for side of sour cream.  Unfortunately it never came.  Luckily for our waitress we had a large group so gratuity was automatically added to our bill.  Otherwise she would not have seen much.

Bhe1OKkkhyKxHVCKd1TCwQ.text: Chips here are great! Nice outdoor area that is dog friendly.  Food is good..not great.

WYGZ3HcC0uFDcJQ-dcsL3A.text: A tasty blast! Games, music, good food, great drinks and an authentic, uplifting atmosphere (especially the huge patio!)  I'll be back for sure.

rSIU5A7If7eovtsGIyzPuQ.text: Too bad the chips and salsa are so darn good because we filled up so badly we could hardly eat our meal. The food was still tasty, however: I had the chicken mole, DH had the chingalingas, and the kids each tried a mexican choice off the kids' meals. Our server, Sara, was awesome - she offered to switch out one of the kid's meals when he complained about it being too spicy. For the record, he ate it all and said it was delicious.   We've eaten there before and decided the best place to fully enjoy this restaurant's fabulous atmosphere is out on the patio so go when the weather is just warm enough to dine al fresco and when it isn't crowded with a private party.

4VY9chmMpMJnTbi2YUTSJg.text: This place is fantastic!!! Service was perfect, food was amazing, price was reasonable, and the atmosphere was terrific. Authentic and clean Mexican food. Definitely a new fav and on the list to visit again soon!

BikWagFe5N2TGkvqHTpXIg.text: Aunt Chilada's has it's charm. The front patio (on Dreamy Draw) is filled with mature trees, fountains & vegetation. It's really a perfect atmosphere to pretend you're in the Yucatan swilling Tequila in the jungle if  you like that sort of thing...  They have these fantastic flour chips & salsa that come with your drink- I can eat a whole basket of them before the main course arrives. I always get the taco's and they're consistently good, not great. They make strong margarita's. They have a chocolate fountain on Sundays too.  Oh yeah, this is another place you can bring your dog onto the patio.  BOTTOM LINE:  Great neighborhood Mexican, one of AZ's best patios!

6Qeyt6DQnY94hMcjxzPJMQ.text: Free buffet with drink purchase in the bar... spinach & chickn enchiladas were good.

NvpudL0-8HaIUPY7Wp5Lwg.text: Invited by friends to go here for dinner on a Sat night and read all the Yelp reviews beforehand to try to get an idea of what food to order (most of the reviews don't really talk about any good/bad particular dishes).  The place looks old and outdated, especially for a hotel type restaurant.  We were seated out on a back side patio which was fine until BIG winged bugs arrived after we ate.  Anyway, the frozen margaritas were good and I ordered the Street Tacos, which were okay but the beef in them could not have been cooked anymore as it was tough and not very tasty.  Chips and salsa are pretty good.  Our group of 7 all ordered different things and no one had had rave reviews or bad comments about their dishes. We ordered flan, fried ice cream and sopapias (sp?) for dessert, which were all polished off.  I live in the Valley and given the multitudes of very good to great Mexican places we have, I don't need to return to Aunt's.

HKFq0hvcTAEfSyWzCWFYKQ.text: Okay, you either hate the chips or you love them.  I love them!  We were pleased to see the new menu at Aunt Chilada's... finally some vegetarian options!  The patio is awesome, you can chill in the sun, enjoy cold beers, and play bocce.  Is it the best Mexican food?  No.  But it's tasty, and that combined with the patio makes Aunt Chilada's a great choice.

guwqKbzF3v3odZD2Or-Juw.text: This is a fun place, it's huge with multiple bars and games to play. There was a live band the night I went. They also had $5 Tigers Blood margarita specials that tasted really good. I don't know how often those will be around. Try Tweeting your arrival there, you might get a big surprise like I did. Manager tweeted me back and bought me a drink

vmw4wR90NjWva20tKS7iRQ.text: We have been going to Scottsdale in April for the last 20 years for the Scottsdale Culinary Festival. About 10 years ago the consierge at our hotel recommended Aunt Chilada's for great Mexican food. We have been going back for lunch ever since. We fly into Phoenix, have lunch at Aunt Chilada's, then drive to Scottsdale. We always look forward to their great salsa and chips, especially the flour chips. Last year I ordered my regular taco salad and was very disappointed when it no longer came in a flour tortilla shell. My new favorites are the fish tacos and chile rellenos off of the lunch menu. This place doesn't necessarily have the best mexican food in the country but the outdoor dining, pleasant atmosphere, and very cold beer on a hot day, always hits the spot.

25vora6BeW2q6xntlpXvDg.text: Food was average but I give it 2 stars because the service was terrible. I could not escape the smoke from other peoples cigarettes as we were seated outside...there are better Mexican places to eat in Phoenix. I guess that from reading all of the other reviews most come for the drinks so if that is your poison, maybe this place might work but I would not recommend eating here

dUMZtIj15st5lSmcgWoBFA.text: Not good. It took an hour and fifteen to get the food out after the order went in. Then only a partial delivery. My carnitas tacos came out cold and dry. The server did her best but she was fighting an uphill battle. The place is obviously very poorly managed. It made for an unpleasant dinner.

h3w2gyHdvgICjsSYlxdmDw.text: I was concerned that I wouldn't be able to eat anything here, since I am a vegan. I was pleasantly surprised to see 'vegan tacos' on the menu. The tacos don't have a description on the menu, but they are 2 crisp lettuce cups filled with sauteed vegetables. The tacos come with a bowl of black beans. It was very satisfying. I was told by our waiter that the tortilla chips are fried in oil, not lard, but other reviewers had mentioned they are fried in lard. Not sure who's right on that one. We were will a group of 8 and we had great service for our dinner.

7fHExhraWZF1qQy_xiBUTA.text: Aunt Chilada's combines festive decor and loud Mariachi music with pretty standard Mexican fare. The entrees were large and reasonably priced. I did enjoy my smoked pork chinalinga and the choice of salsas -- verde or roja in mild, medium or hot.. But still, the pluses aren't enough to drive out of your way for a visit.   Another note: it did seem like the place to go if you are into drinking a lot (which I am not), so keep that in mind if you're looking more for a place to bring the kiddies or your 80-year-old aunt Rose.

3oT--VvM1Y3oJN6Xn5IVow.text: I came for the BEST jalapeno marg in town and LAUREN brought her A-game! She's the best.

IMe-pWub7GkTuKx2a8qBGw.text: The Best Chips and Salsa!  When you go here you need to try the flour chips.  They also have a nice patio that you can have a nice meal under the stars.

vbN61FGFr7VQUIom9PVcQw.text: If you enjoy being sat down with a bottle of water and a basket of chips and wait 10 minutes without being greeted by the wait staff, I highly recommend this place.  Can't comment on the food, but the salsa was good.

9sHuOK7f52szgjRprXnPJA.text: Best tortilla chips I have had even if the salsa is half ass. The entrees are also above average and the ambiance really does give you that Mexican cantina feel.

bWV9VEoiZRIzbO6bUhvDqg.text: This place has a fun atmosphere. It has a live band on Friday night as an example. I ordered the Sea Food Enchiladas which was pretty good. It was stuff with cheese, shrimp and scallops wit sides of bean and rice. I cleaned the whole plate and I don't usually eat beans.  Tip - parking isn't always the best.

q6tn-Omqfz0YEILWVBRAjQ.text: Aunt Chilada's has a great happy hour. They have it all for happy hour.... Music, healthy drinks, cut veggies and trays of something melted with cheese... I rarely eat the appetizers. By the time i get to them, they have been mangled by the customers. I'm happy with the big trays of fresh cut veggies. The indoor is nice, patio is fantastic. I LOVE meeting a bunch of friends here for happy hour.   My dinner experiences have been OK, but not great. Service is usually slow. Food is adequate, but not exceptional. Still, ya gotta love a place where you can crowd 15 of your friends on the patio, mark off a bit of territory with a couple balloons, and have a great time for a couple hours.

_5JmQYQj0cQpYRYVmI2ZoA.text: Not really impressed. Food was below average, in my opinion. Chips were just extra greasy, salsa watered down, meals without much taste. Yes, the patio is pretty cool and I imagine that on a busy night this is the place to be, but really, not impressed.  Could be because I had a 13 hour workday, still had food poisoning, and just wanted to be home instead of off for business, but this didn't really make my mood change for the better. Guess that if I was boozing it up it'd be more fun, but then again, what place isn't more fun while boozing it up?

rFB0Omtw-yHuZ6wJuitA8A.text: Well, this place is certainly the answer to the hokey tourist trap with marginally edible food, innit?  I'll give em credit for the 'Pancho's on anabolic steroids' thematics, the patio is very comfortable, and as night falls on Spring, there is almost no better place to have a Dos XX or Pacifico.  Its lervely and shaded and filled with mostly professionals hitting on their secretaries, which is pretty amusing to casually observe.    As the US National Drinking Circuit Holiday, 'Cinco de Mayo' (eh, que?) approaches, I guess this would be a relevant time to inform of their festival, which consumes their parking lot and is actually less of a tool collection than most other forced holiday festivals.  Entry last year was about $10 with booths for drinks and food.  I didn't hate it, got fairly leathered, and left feeling it was money well spent.    If you must visit Aunt Chilada's North, I'd hold off on the food and stick to the cocktails.

uqwTK-RpjBJSNal5FRHpYA.text: The Food: Average Mexican Fare.  It's not the best you have ever had, but not the worst either.  Aunt Chilada's best point is the patio.  Go for happy hour, or a light dinner.  Sit on the patio, have a few beers, and some apps.  Take out of towners and locals.  Play some bocce and chill.

Ug3VtasRUtESTmaf_lddPA.text: What a cute place!! That is about the only positive thing about Aunt Chilada's, unfortunately.  The food is not even mediocre IT SUCKS!!  Started with the nearly inedible chips and the dressed-up-ketchup salsa all the way through dessert was downright misery!  And the service sucks too :(

ZMWUksbzBpTlsCKi9ZBA4w.text: Nasty. Terrible service, hotel food. Save your money or go to via de los Santos up the road!

Gr5woH1u6F3EW-tpOPfMYw.text: After searching for an affordable, excellent service and menu, Mexican restaurant, we found Aunt Chiliadas.  Our out of town guests will be going there with us!  Ask for Covy, he will not disappoint!

Ke8yKoJhC5ELHAgiSOQJaw.text: I was really in between a 3 and 4 stars for this place. We came for happy hour which is the bomb. Free chips and salsa, little cheesy tortilla things, and fruit. They had some good drink deals... but I was the lowly DD. Service was slow... and when I say slow I mean like a turtle walking in molasses. It took about 20 minutes just to get a soda. I could have driven to Frys and bought my own.   The atmosphere is ok, just bar-ish. The food on the normal menu is wayyy over priced for Mexican. I ended up ordering the fancy shmancy hot dog which you can personalize. I asked for guac on mine but didn't get any. It took about 45 minutes to even get my hot dog and I was so hungry I wasn't going to let that thing out of my sight.   If  you do happen to stumble upon this place ask for the flour tortilla chips-I could live my life happily only eating those things :)

gaxf9_Pv1rhePgscTKb_Rw.text: What the hell?  I have never experienced a restaurant go down the toilet so fast.  Its like a bad night in mexico.  Service sucked, but the food sucked more.  if by chance you want the blandest food this side of england, this place is for you, but if you want any form of mexican fare, you'd be better off going to taco smell, and I am no fan of fast food, whether it be from north of the border or farther north of the border.  I used to be a big fan of the Aunt, but I can confidently say I will never, ever give this place another try, it was really that bad.

8WTz0FtCh-EjhZ0ZyGFCyg.text: As an (inexplicably) popular Phoenix destination, I've dined here over the years and been reasonably satisfied.  Service is tolerable, speed is tolerable, ambiance is tolerable.  It's a little overpriced for the quality but I was able to swallow it.  Until tonight.  My group was seated out at a patio table which had the umbrella still on it so we were sitting in shadows.  We asked for a candle for some light- "We're out of candles, I guess we're not doing candles on the tables anymore."  The guy graciously removed the umbrella from the table which helped a bit.  It was downhill from there.  Slow service on drinks, constant creepy lurking interruptions from the waiter, condescending comments during 2/3rds of the tables orders.  Snooty oblivious help from the woman who brought out our orders.  (If the people you're sending out with food can't answer simple questions with anything better than a blank stare, *MAYBE THEY SHOULDN'T BE CARRYING OUT THE FOOD*)  Continually empty water glasses and slow service to the end, I left satisfied only in the knowledge that I will never patronize this restaurant again.

GQkGfhd9rfcwyMYp87N6pw.text: Chips were great, enchiladas were great, and the ladies loved the margaritas! It's got a fun atmosphere and excellent service, will definitely go again! It is a little hard to find tucked behind the hilton and some apartments.

01n8CMM1WNy9HFj0yLzMPw.text: Hidden off the 51 & Glendale. Big place & big patio. Meh food. Chips & salsa ok. Skip the queso. Vegetarians BEWARE everything is made w/ meat. Beans AND noodle stuff. Ugh. Safe w/ grilled veggies. :(

fJKdi8919hvMRELGIw-NgA.text: My buddy Mike took me here after we played golf recently. We wanted something with "chips and salsa" and a decent beer selection. Their chips and salsa are served community style, and the beer selection rocks. Winning! Oh, and the chips are corn AND flour. The place is really big, too, and has a classic vibe to it. I ordered the seafood enchiladas, and they were terrible. Told the server and she took them away and brought me something else. Just a really good experience. They have a Living Social right now, too, so we will be going back. Thanks, Mike!

CYK0Shwlkh2l_EYb7nCPZA.text: My husband decided to take us out for lunch and he picked Aunt Chiladas. The decor is so cute right when you walk in, very cheerful. We went for lunch so it was quieter. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. Now the best part....the chips! They were delicious, some of the best chips I've ever tasted. They weren't greasy or over-salted, but so good. I had the machaca taco salad which wasn't served in a taco shell so took away some of the guilt from eating all those chips. It had a scoop of their guacamole in it which was also delicious and creamy. My husband and son had the beef and cheese enchiladas which were served in a delicious red sauce. The regular side is a pasta called fideo, but they opted for the traditional rice and beans. I loved the food, the atmosphere and the service was good too. Definitely coming again.

AfGkHws5tSqFkGvJPVP-ig.text: What a great spot! Fun atmosphere outside ! I had some friends visiting from Seatlle & this was the perfect " welcome to Arizona spot !" they loved the kitchy name, friendly bartenders & the bar food was pretty tasty to boot!

NSI6HBOCiSdK_SjkmgOCBw.text: AZ icon at its best.   The place itself is amazing, the owners and staff are freakin cool. The food is always great even if you go for the happy hour only!  If you can check this place out and bring 1 or 17 of your buddies,.,,

wc2VdxW9qye4xka5rVZwwQ.text: My favorite part about this place is the chips they bring out for the chips and salsa. They make their own flour tortilla chips. Yes, flour. The texture is a fun and an interesting change from the typical tortilla chip. They do throw in a few regular chips, I think to fill out the bowl and satisfy those who like normal chips and salsa better.  Their salsa is good but I am not a fan of olives in my salsa. Seems like a odd addition, but easy enough to eat around.  If you go on the weekend they have a free chocolate fountain between 10am-2pm. The first time I saw it I thought it was an odd compliment to a Mexican food meal. But hey, it's chocolate... So do yourself a favor and have dessert first. You want to make sure you have room, right?  They do offer a free "buffet" during happy hour. It used to be better and more offerings years ago but it's still nice to have complimentary food to munch on during happy hour.   Good food. Standard Mexican fare. Not a huge fan of the enchilada sauce, which I keep forgetting since I typically get a burrito "enchilada style". But I keep coming back for those delicious chips and forget I should get something different from my usual.

5_qTgKUhpChpHDvc_hVE_A.text: Fell in love with their flour tortilla chips after a couple times visiting them- One night my boyfriendand I swung by to see if they sold them to go, and they DO! By the POUND! Absolutely love them!

RPQ4u5MDt-EPJmNBV_XOqg.text: We went to this restaurant for a group meetup.  The restaurant was very good when it came to reserving and setting up our large table.  We enjoyed being in the company of others.  That said, the food was sorely lacking.  Their chips and salsa are supposedly "award winning".  In all fairness, the mild salsa was unique.  It had a wide range of ingredients in it and was  tasty.  The spicy salsa was indeed spicy but there was nothing about it to make it stand out from other Mexican restaurant salsas.  The chips were unusual.  Some had the consistency of a deep fried pie crust.  In other words, they were very flaky.  Yet others were like chips found in other restaurants.  For my drink, I ordered a frozen mango margarita with salt.  The mango flavoring was faint and there was very little salt on the glass.  For dinner, I had a combo plate --- one chile relleno and one chicken enchilada.    The dish came with refried beans and "fideos" (noodles with a meat sauce).  The chile relleno was the worst one I've ever had.  It held together very poorly.  For example, when I was less than halfway through it, I cut off a piece with my fork and out came the entire remaining chile!  What was left was the batter and the jack cheese!  The chicken enchilada was generous with the chicken portion but pretty forgettable.  The fideos were certainly a unique touch and pleasantly flavored.  The restaurant was very good when it came to accomodating those in our group who were vegetarians.  They were willing to substitute sides that had meat in them for a vegetable side dish.  Service was friendly, prompt and helpful---no complaints there.  That said, I certainly won't go back when I'm in AZ.  Without going into too much information, the whole meal left me with a bad case of indigestion.  There is certainly much, much better Mexican food to be had in the Phoenix area!

81rs3ctjygNJVgPEurkzdg.text: Stayed at Hilton down the street....they reco'ed it.  Very busy at times.....expect a wait.  Good guac and chips....very good entrees.....while busy food came fairly fast.  Sat at the bar......good service and even better sights.

M7BWLE7BPukou4AqrGi45Q.text: The food and the service was amazing thanks to our server angel !! Will for sure be back !

FFY70EEwZ0jU55R-dUGvfg.text: Awesome enchiladas!  We had 20 people in our party and our server was great. We will definitely come back.

XmNY52Z7h6PH2lOugfbs0w.text: Food was excellent but the service is OUTSTANDING. After they sat us, we waited for a server for about fifteen minutes (I think because they were busy). So, I popped inside to enquire about the wait. Almost immediately, the manager and sever came to our table, and while apologizing profusely, offered to buy us an appetizer to make up for the wait. They were unbelievably kind and cheerful and we will absolutely be back. We got the stuffed pineapple app and the Jesus tacos - both of which were delicious. This place is a gem.

C_FGv6wQLkCjbsGcJaNB5w.text: Neighborhood joint that serves disgusting food.  Sit in the bar and smell the smoke from outside.  I asked for the door to be closed and told it was not possible.  Second hand smoke in the bar. Supposed to have live music , we left and it had not started at 7:30 The guacamole tasted worst than packaged.  The chips were mixed, some deep fried on top and the regular packaged ones on the next layer.  The chicken breast sandwich for $10.95 was a joke. The place was packed...volume is not a sign of anything but volume. The bar is heavy handed on price but NOT on pour.  Yuk..

722aAziQCpDqRa4JbxfVFQ.text: Extremely over priced. Beans taste like dirt. She asked everyone if they wanted their sour cream and guac on top of their burrito etc, everyone said yes, as it turns out nothing comes with either so we were charged add charges for both sc and guac on each plate. We had ordered guacamole and chips for 2 people, but she charged us for 5 people based on how many people were seated at our table. We probably had at least 4 cups of wasted guac left on the table. Our bill was $100 for five people drinking water. Our waitress definitely scammed us, the guac was decent, the rest of the food was tasteless.

FSzNax3ljK7n-gofDToaFw.text: Server was very nice and accommodating Food was excellent. Great vibe and great Margaritas!

Via5QQELeF0BUWFPlrsRzw.text: Well, got off to a bad start.  We were told that the wait would be 30 minutes, was closer to and hour and fifteen.  We were shuttled from the Arizona Grand so leaving wasn't a good option for us.  Finally we were seated, two of the staff recommend the spiced pork.  I did not think much of it, but everyone I was with seemed to enjoy their meals and the portions were ample.  I wish I would have ordered something else.

r7yZhxfmppMH_bDCPDLT7A.text: We went with family who go here on a regular basis and were underwhelmed. While I see the appeal of the all you can eat Happy Hour, the rest of the experience left a lot to be desired.  If all you want is a couple of drinks and a couple of small plates of free mediocre tacos - then by all means, knock yourself out.  We wanted an actual dinner so we went to the other side of the restaurant to get a real table away from the happy hour crowd. And there we sat, with nothing but chips and salsa, for at least 25 minutes. Two different servers took orders and attended to other tables within view and not one person even acknowledged our existence. When we attempted to get their attention, we were ignored. We finally got up and left and went elsewhere.  Based on the menu options and the quality of the food at Happy Hour, I'm willing to bet there are probably a dozen other Mexican restaurants in the area that offer better food and service.

p_yVAeGtOKLeVrFZlBWmCg.text: Very disappointing based on the 4 star reviews. I used to live in Phoenix and was looking forward to some excellent Mexican food...this was definitely not that. Mediocre at best.

UBjSaGD5nMaHcR20oqtzrg.text: Loved the tortilla chips!! Our bartender Lauren was absolutely amazing. So bright and bubbly and she made fantastic drinks. Highly recommend this place!

KWmYJac89qPTs6jiuAyNOA.text: My friend Katy and I walked into Aunt Chilada's restaurant At Squaw Peak on 6/28/2014 to have a awesome dinner. The place had a few parties going on, but as usual it seemed under staffed. So my friend and I sat down and we were given chips and salsa and a bottle of water. About 5-10 minutes later a family came in with small children and after about 5 more minutes or so all of sudden a waiter comes out and looked me right in the eye and went to the other table and took their order. Turned around and went back in to the kitchen. Of course this pissed me off. We got up and hostess saw me I explained what happen she said it was her fault. That did not make it OK. The waiter should have said something to us and didn't. So we left Aunt Chilada's in discuss and went down the road to Ajo Al's for a awesome meal and great service..

QjNStbsPOddQ8hWwstONog.text: awesome fish tacos for lunch.    Great atmosphere and several fireplace and fountains for your enjoyment

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fountain in the dining room

3D0MvcHXwDxSYHUf5kld-A.text: We decided to have Easter Brunch this year here after seeing a segment about the Restaurant on the News.. When we first arrived the place was rather empty, but they decided that our table was in the back, waaayyyy in the back in an empty dining room the farthest spot from the Buffet.  We asked to be seated closer, and were told numerous times that all the tables were reserved... Finally we were moved to a table closer to the action and was greeted by a very nice waitress.. The food was very good however we felt a bit over priced due to the Holiday... We will not be back for a Holiday Meal, but will visit again...

nttj-fBzfsuidV2qKV6G1w.text: The best Mexican food I've had since my stay in Arizona for Spring Training!   Fresh taco and salsa...flour and corn mixed.   Cheese crisp was so delicious and the strawberry daiquiri was delicious!    Service at this place was exceptional and the to go order was super quick.   The decor was cute, too!

gzMO-5T9vKmvm7ZGT5KYWw.text: Very average (if not below) average "Mexican" restaurant that I was invited to for an after work happy hour. The margarita was pretty good but the food was not. It's your typical American style Mexican food which I'm not really a fan of to be honest. I haven't been back and won't go back.

qDkz5sfDBn28CYpPzGAjkg.text: Came into this place & had their fish tacos, I was extremely satisfied ! Not a big fan of their chips though & a first on trying salsa that contains olives. Overall the food was great & I'll definitely come back if I have the opportunity to.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fvGEQvENE-7X4HOevKCJJQ.text: Got a few recommendations from the Hilton across the street.  The enchiladas were bland with unseasoned chunks of chicken.  Maybe I'm just used to the Mexican food we have in San Diego...  The food did come out quick and the staff was friendly.

EgHyNsOQcfT7tcqtZ6YX6w.text: We love getting together for dinner and margaritas here!!!  Aunt Chiladas is one of our go to spots!  Great food, good service, comfortable, relaxed atmosphere.  If you're in a rush on at dinner this is NOT the place to come but if you're out with friends and want to kick back and enjoy then this IS the place.  The food is always consistently good, the drinks are reliable.  Parking can be a challenge on weekends so plan accordingly and ride share or Uber.

DtPnCo1DSWjbdETyOjRhIw.text: This is always a good spot.   Very family friendly.   Food is delicous and the drinks are good.  My family likes to come here especially since there's so many of us.  Live music ...at least every time we've been here

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6-JqtE4UAJgAV3i9G30y8A.text: We went here for my 28th birthday. We had a reservation for 18. We eat out often so are aware of numerous different restaurants, type of food, prices etc. We decided to reserve a table here knowing the facility was large and could accommodate us. Unfortunately the food was TERRIBLE, my kids who eat just about anything didn't want to eat, I don't blame them... I ordered chipotle chicken which was far from chipotle it was a nacho cheese sauce, with almonds in it and man was it TERRIBLE, the corn tortillas I requested split the second you tried to put anything in them, the beans and rice were beyond bad... my son got chicken tenders and fries that we're cold, my husband who ordered nachos was told there was chicken on them, and requested no jalapenos and when they came out had beef and diced jalapenos. The prices are WAY over priced. I paid $50 for my daughter and I to share a meal, two kids meals and nachos. I am very disappointed I wasted my birthday dinner here and am embarrassed I even brought 17 people along with me. Didn't get a happy birthday or anything of that sort either. Everybody I asked in my party about their meals said the same thing, we left majority of the food there, it was that bad..... sucks I have to take the time to write a review like that but something has got to change we will continue going to our normal Mexican restaurant that actually deserves our business. Such a shame, learn from our mistake, don't waste your money.

NGr2VAoNHgWV4OpGqx8zEg.text: This is a good option for decent Mexican food. I really like the reference as to how the local park and street "Dreamy Draw" gets its name. It seems there used to be a mine nearby that contain mercury and the miners would return from their shift a little woozy and in a dream like state, thus the name. They have a nice outside patio to take advantage on warm days. I thought the food was ok, but others felt it was too bland.

cgqqE2RATJxRz0N25PPflg.text: My family has been going to Aunt Chiladas for about 30 years. My mom had her last meal here before my breach baby self broke her water about 8 hours after her dinner. I have probably had almost everything on the menu and have yet to find something I didn't like. Little did I know, this place would get even better once I turned 21. Their hand tossed margaritas where you pretty much build your own margarita are AMAZING. All greatness aside this is not necessarily your home cooked Mexican food but it tastes good and has an awesome atmosphere so if you are looking for "authentic" then I'll send you down the road to los taquitos or el bravo. Also I've noticed multiple people complain that they don't have rice. They do have rice, you just have to ask. Otherwise, you get served some yummy fideo which is almost like tiny noodles and mixed veggies. I personally love the fideo but if you aren't expecting it, it's weird. They also have a really good and fun happy hour on the back patio and have bags set up.

03Jga6jh7f4oTqc61piGpA.text: Great atmosphere! Wonderful strawberry margarita. Food was okay. We had the guacamole to start, it's spicy but so good. Not frozen tasting like most restaurants. The street tacos were low quality meat and kinda thrown on the plate but had an decent flavor. My husband had the fish tacos and said they were amazing!! Do not get the kids chicken fingers they are the worst but we should have known better. The picky 4 year old got the best of us!! Over all I would go back.

VHvMh3GncLUI36Ex8Se9Cw.text: Food was pretty decent, nothing too special. Salsa could have been way better. Did not appreciate the waiter trying to upsale us every chance he got. "No, we are sure we don't want any alcoholic beverages or guacamole" for the third time. Of course he still got me when he asked if I wanted sour cream on the side for my quesadilla. And of course the side of sour cream was way too big for one person and cost an extra $2. Pretty lame!

Dhu_zIKTC44uX9Rzmma_fw.text: This is the best Mexican restaurant I have ever been to in my life. The food is great, atmosphere is even better. I walk in and I'm immediately greeted with a smile. This restaurant knows how to take care of their customers. I always order the bean and cheese burrito enchilada style with their signature fideo on the side. You just can't beat it! Not to mention the flour chips and salsa are the best ever. I love this place!

LK0vXbyzvin247L5OXh3pg.text: We have been wanting to try this place for awhile so last night we did.  1. We stood at the door a while before someone said anything to us. Several employees walked by.  They sat us in the back building...you go out the side threw a outdoor seating area and into another building...it smelled horrendous. A cross between mold, dog and must.  We we asked to be moved and they were happy to oblige. But it took a while to get that smell out of my nose.  We worked fajitas and they were okay nothing I would really want to go back for. We also ended up waiting for quite awhile for a service to check in on us she wasn't bad she was just either too busy to keep up with everybody or I don't know.

rQSJ-Iej1EpOAghLjA5-rQ.text: Just finished lunch @ Aunt Chilada's.  Outstanding food, great drinks & we walked to it with the Sun on our backs.  If you are in Phoenix - I recommend it.  Prices are very fair.

w36ZOGDcbNN5HWT5VdIRWw.text: Fantastic place with fun staff and good food.  Go on March 10 and wish bartender Marie Happy Birthday!!

NIb9R_YdwcUyQshFvu2Fgw.text: Just went for dinner and had a good meal. But then some jerk named Steve kicked us off the boche ball to set up a pinata. He was extremely rude and even the staff when I asked for a manger knew exactly who I was talking about. Very amateur staff.

9-Uf-dHadQtpRlqwvgSxOA.text: If you want to stop for happy hour and experience a tiki hut sort of vibe this is the place. The weather mostly cooperates and their salsa and complimentary chips are great. However, their margaritas lacked one essential ingredient... Tequila!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Music and a lot of fun!

6vVdXBDkYYiB8AvlTsmBOA.text: Met several friends (group of 20) at this place. Haven't been here in 8 years and besides the patio, it looks like they haven't spent a dime to upgrade this place inside. Chairs were wobbling, tables look old, etc. No problems with the workers, the service was excellent, however, the food is average at best. I had street taco's and my wife had chicken encilada's. My meal was acceptable. My wife thought the chicken encilada's were the worst she's had ever. Big chunks of chicken and didn't care for the rice and beans. I tried hers and she was correct. Salsa is just ok and didn't get the room temperature water bottles on the table. Probably won't go back to eat. The outside and the area around is very nice. It's pretty sad when food on the west side gets a better rating than this place.

StigE2YKm9uFqoWDp3nrFQ.text: Best place to go. Tiffany is hilarious and amazing (will you please be my UNOFFICIAL SISTER- I am not kidding)! So is Michelle and the others!!! Love this place. Sit at the bar for best results. Ordered the spinach cheese enchilada and black beans - WOW, amazing flavas! Will be back to see you all. Thanks for making my visit special!! AttorneySteve.com

JubT-MsNk6agsqlrfJ973A.text: Aunt Chiladas was the place picked for June's International Supper Club UYE!  We were a party of 12, making a reservation was easy and Aunt Chiladas confirming system was through Yelp, so that was kind of cool.  Chips and salsa were provided, and the chips were mix of flour & corn tortilla chips, which we all liked. The salsa was mild and had good flavor. You can also ask for a hotter sauce if you like it spicy.  I ordered one of the house specialties, the El Pollo Fundido, it was a chicken chimi topped with cheese and jalapeno cream cheese and came with fideo and refried beans.  When the plate 1st came out, it looked like the cheese was over cooked, but when I started to cut into the chimi I noticed that everything was perfect.  This was good meal, and I liked that they serve fideo over rice.  Service was great, she was friendly and made sure our table was well taken care of, and didn't mind most of us were on separate checks.   This Aunt Chiladas is a great location, nice patio area and seating inside as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sJ0_RcoKQ0u46leWSYsXFQ.text: Not impresssed. This place use to be my FAVORITE restaurant in the valley, but in the last few years it's gone more and more downhill.  We came in around 11:45AM for lunch. We were seated quickly, but the service was extremely slow. It almost appeared that the waitress was the only one on staff inside, which is not fair to her considering how large the interior is.   The food also took 30-45 minutes to come out. Our drinks only get refilled once despite them being empty. The only thing that was prompt was the chips and salsa being refilled.  The prices are extremely on the high side for what the food is. $15.50 for three street tacos is ridiculous.   I would skip this place next time it rolls onto your mind. Unless you're only coming for the chips and the Sunday chocolate fountain-stay away!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-3ndjCrKi-rUEaSAihvvwg.text: Great: Great atmosphere, family friendly, and plenty of parking. Really enjoyed my meal - I had the Tacos de Jesus, would definitely recommend. Good: The wait was fairly standard for a Friday night. We were told a half hour and it was maybe a bit longer. Not so good: The server who brought out our beverages held the cups at the rim. I am a bit of a germaphobe and I understand this may not bother many customers, but this is a pet peeve of mine. Please keep your hands off the lip of the cups. Bottom line: I will definitely be going back. I would not have any reservations about recommending this restaurant to anyone.

jNJIYGu_vAk1GVIFpIJNWw.text: Go for the flour tortilla chips!  The servings here are huge.  I got a side order, the tamale, and it was a full meal. My husband's enchiladas were very tasty, too.  Cute decor and attentive staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enchiladas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Side order, tamale

dKuEFDQdx9lXsudOU1e4Gw.text: We came here for my husbands graduation lunch and although I enjoyed their chips, salsa and margharita, their Pollo Fondido wasnt as good as their other location in Tempe. Their chicken was dry and the jalapeno cream cheese sauce wasn't anything special. The location is nice and beautifully decorated on the inside. It was nice that they could also accommodate family of 7 at one table. The waitress herself seemed to disappear for long periods of time, we were left sitting for quite awhile, debating if we wanted to wait half an hour for dessert and then wait another to get the check. Finally after, what should've only been about an hour and a half lunch that turned into well over 2, we got to leave. Don't think I'll ever revisit this location again.

mvbnv-9K2fHtCzfIMWjcAA.text: Overpriced bland tex mex for gringos. Good service and the atmosphere is kind of like a party on the big patio, but on my many visits I have yet to eat something with a little kick to it. They just load things up with cheese or cream to make it palatable for their older crowd. Go for a drink and maybe an appetizer but go elsewhere for anything remotely authentic or flavorful.

ysVyFgtAwVnfVjogrR5WLw.text: Always a fun environment, great food, drinks and service. Live bands on the weekends. Beautiful patio. A Phoenix Classic!

l_KgTNMJ-oU415MYoCgG1g.text: Once again, I like many others wish you could give half stars since a 2.5 rating overall would be about right. I bumped it up to 3 stars just because of our long history of visiting this location. Unfortunately, it has lost a little mojo over these past few years. The service was slow, especially for being half empty at 5:30 on a Friday night. Chips were very good (we had a whole basket of flour ones) however, the salsa was super chunky (huge uneven cuts of tomato & onion). I even like it chunky but, they cuts were too big to fit into a bite, plus the flavor was a little bland and lacked any heat. Ingredients were fresh, just poorly put together. We probably waited almost 30 minutes for one app and one combo plate to arrive. The Chingalingas were luke warm at best and seemed to be just thrown on the plate haphazardly. The combo plate (tacos, chili relleno, spinch enchilada)  was a heaping pile of food, beans, & rice but, again lacked any bold flavors. We were very underwhelmed. Our server stopped by maybe 4 times total in over an hour (including dropping off check). That was kinda a bummer for a nearly empty room. We stayed for drinks at the bar and a good local band but, I have to say its a tough review to write since we are looooong time customers (my wife and I actually met here), unfortunately this location may be best for drinks and not so much for the food anymore. Bummer.

XK40fVLjuZgABDwp-Dhcog.text: Not authentic Mexican food at all! I will not be returning to this restaurant. We were a party of 11 and we all sampled each other's food. None of it was good. I tried the tacos, tostada, enchiladas, rice (super ewwww!), beans, and of course the chips and salsa. I wouldn't recommend.

76qwudF3cJRLhFgV44IAJg.text: Aunt Chiladas is a valley staple. It has been around for a very long time. As long as I have lived here I think. That is a mark to it's honor in this crazy revolving door restaurant city. If you like Tex-Mex it is not a bad place to go and hang out especially if you are at the Pointe resort next door. I love their chips.   What I think this place does well ( 5 stars) and keeps it around longer than other places in the valley is their party planning/events/catered fiestas. I have been to so many events over the years at Aunt Chiladas on the patio. They do it up right. Always a great time.

3fnWyT-lnIcFD7yRmzKbZA.text: Service was absolutely fantastic, the chips, especially the flour ones just delicious. Margaritas were surprisingly good and didn't taste premade. And the option for video inside of rice is fantastic!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flour tortillas are insanely good

WolvG7FmJ12Cu3_fymybuw.text: One of the handful of places in town that's been around 30+ years , always consistently good food, always has been a Friday night stop for me , but now I see the Woods sisters are trying to make it an every night destination. Great patio for music , wish that they had it out there more often .

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Food

6JwujL5dyK_XyS1_IPIGBg.text: Great atmosphere and good food. I really like the chicken and spinach enchiladas. They have good service and the staff is accommodating. Because the place is so old the tables wobble quite a bit but our waiter tried his best to fix it.

FIGMv5F0GcZEyAyY07eeGQ.text: I ate at this establishment last night and became extremely ill. Went to doctor and was told it was food poisoning. I called to inform the manager on duty Tiffany Allison and she was very rude and disrespectful. I will never dine here again. People please be careful of this place

pJS1sTbH_MzURA-4Vt9c7A.text: Aunt Chiladas is very close to my girlfriend's home.  They have live music on the weekends and it has a very rousing crowd!  The service that I received from Faith was very attentive and well, in a word, excellent.  We are watching the National League Championship Series game 6, so part of the crowd is very glued to the TV.  Busy place, but everyone seems to be very happy, bobbing heads, applause and many smiles.  Oh, and cheese pizza is free with a drink on Friday!  Thank you for the time Tiffany!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Historical picture!

apty1s-LN1pUSQ4QlCbqCg.text: The only reason I'm giving three stars is because the service was great for a table of about 20. Other then that you would be getting one star so good job on staff hiring. And also, your salsa was good and your hot sauce. But your food lacks flavor of any kind. Your chicken was over cooked bland and old (must have been 10 days old). And no, I'm not the only one who thought so four others tried the chicken at my table and agreed. Also, your steak cheese crisp had 3% cheese. Your food is really not worth $13-15. May try again to give another chance but with the prices I doubt it.

vuTzbjJY0pvT_gxzjL6oNQ.text: It's been some time since my last visit.. Until today.   Word to the wise, just order the chips and salsa to go.  They are great, but for some reason for the first time ever , I found my fresh chips mixed with thin non fresh..   I ordered the spinach and chicken enchiladas ... I do not recomend.  Chicken was aged and tough, there was barely any spinach. The sides were very luke warm.. There is just no culinaryism.   Sorry to lose you as a great mexican restuarant, but I do believe their glory days ended a while back when N'sync broke up. ..Nothing here screams order me and take the left overs.

i9j7Pj3kdMkfLP2I4k8WDg.text: Will just run down everything we had. At this restaurant that should not call itself a restaurant.   Napkins - They don't bring napkins. You'll need to ask your server.   Water - You'll also need to ask for water. These servers aren't so advanced.  Chips and salsa - They brag about their homemade chips . But they're only on the top covering a pile of Tostitos.  Queso- Too soupy. Not a traditional gooey queso you expect. Don't worry. They have spoons. But you'll need to ask your server.  Million Dollar Margarita - For a $25 margarita, THIS IS NOT WORTH IT. Way too sweet. They skimp on the booze. Just overpriced.   Booked a reservation here for dinner. But will be having our main course elsewhere  If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, this ain't it chief.

oCPZ6L2q6TO1oAnxojdIxg.text: So apparently this is one of the oldest restaurants in Phoenix. You will be struck immediately by the whimsy outdoor bar and colorful decor. The owner greeted us at the door and warmly welcomed our nine-top.   The chips and salsa were popular among my team just not with me. My chicken burrito on the other hand absolutely crushed my hunger. It is a wet burrito with tasty beans and cheese.   Service was on point. The atmosphere is pretty typical Mexican restaurant just larger, warmer, and slightly more upscale. I heard that the seating was up to 700 people. It was hard to believe but maybe it is True. The next time I am in Phoenix, I would love to come back. It seems like a killer spot for a night out with friends and cold margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zZM6RJqk4ZnVzUqeuFM-LA.text: Our first visit. A nice place with a charming al fresco patio - a good place to take out-of-town visitors for a Southwestern experience. Since it's on the Dreamy Draw cycling route and very close to the Arizona Canal cycling path, a fine place to stop and lunch if one's on a ride in the area. The flour chips and salsa were delicious, the fish tacos and the pollo fundido were yum, and ice cold Modelo amber is on tap! Service was fast and attentive - my one complaint is that while a bottle of cold water hit the table immediately, water glasses never did appear.  I suspect that milady wife and I will become regular clients. Food - three and a half stars, service four, and ambience a solid five.

L5r7ZAKdTo6Z4_09EuVgig.text: The worst service they attended the Anglo first I was there with the family and the customers that were eating were starring at us and talking shit behind our backs so uncomfortable never going to this place again first and last

8w7CWP6Fh9UhS51HTa2jTQ.text: Look elsewhere, would be my advice.  First of all, the much heralded chips and salsa were half-chips and half-tortilla bowls. Not a fan of that. And though it was nice to have a bowl of hot salsa and another one of milder, the mild one had olives in it instead of just being a good salsa fresca.  The combination platter was good, but I forgot to tell them I wanted black beans and rice instead of refried beans and those noodle things (fideo?). My fault for not telling them, but it would be nice to be asked, when it is an option on the menu.  Which brings me to my third point, the service was pretty bad. Guy at my table asked for a second beer, never got it. Salt was delivered on the glass of a margharita even when it was requested not to be. It took forever for them to even take our order.  The best thing is that their outdoor patio is really nice, when the weather is good, especially.

dhjH2-OKx9S4m85NKa68Vg.text: I've been here a few times and really enjoyed the atmosphere. I've seen them have live music on a Friday night and it's really fun to sit at the outside bar with some friends. The restaurant is pretty big so it's great for bringing big groups! If you go to the outside bar ask for Lauren! She is great behind the bar and always so positive!

BAUu9vaHUMpk30Ny3xv8aQ.text: Great atmosphere for the plus 30 crowd. Indoor and outdoor bar areas. Live music is usually very good.  I've been there about half dozen times or so and every meal was good. Lively and fun, good vibe.

-hcbwy9BD_Yl4ZVdOQ7viw.text: This place....Oh My..... Well if you're a vegetarian...RUN.  I got stuck at this place due to a corporate event my company hosted there.  Let me say, how excited I was at the idea of Mexican food at the Christmas party. Then my vegetarian instinct kicked in when I got there....hmm....lets check for lard. I asked the waitress who was going around...slowly I add but it was a busy night so maybe the service is faster when there isn't a huge event going on. (I'm thinking understaffed?....hoping?) Anyway, I was then informed that they cook their beans with bacon. What? Yes. Bacon. So there went the idea of a burrito, a tostada. Depressing. I ended up eating the very "ehh" chips (deep fried tasting and thicker than the typical chip. I'd venture to guess possibly flour chips?)  I'm not a big drinker so the allure isn't there for the bar aspect.  I will honestly never be back and from what the people who actually did eat there said I didn't miss anything.

MrHntJ1idS1ALyLKoL9x5Q.text: Chips and salsa are delicious! Had a great time on the patio! Split a pitcher of margaritas and fish taco plate. So good!

a9QJe_GuvJt5n8yBg5aMhg.text: There are no words to describe how amazing Aunties is. It's hidden away like an oasis in a paradise. It has beauty, style, class and dreamy like atmosphere. A dream you never want to wake up from. The place is huge there are two outside patio and inside room where live music happens on Fridays. Beside it's natural beauty on the outside it wouldn't mean anything if it had no substance. The people are what makes this place gold.
