They are unique, laid back, classy (most of them) and bring a positive upbeat, mature vibe to the table. From bar tenders to guests it's a lovely way to spend my Fridays after a long week at work. I recommend this to individuals who want to get away into a paradise but stay here on earth. To people who want to eat best nachos ever and wash it down with a ice cold beer. For a great night out look no further then Auntcheladas!

18iHCLGce73hKR4rW05Q9Q.text: Aunt Chilada's, you are like an old best friend.. I may lose touch with you from time to time, but when we meet again, things are the same and you are there to make me happy.  Not a flour chip kinda girl...I dig for the old school chips.  Your patio is cozy and where I want to be on a beautiful AZ day. Don't ever change your fun Sunday brunch.   see you soon!

UdXdNOKteinuIbG2OjQAmw.text: Hate to do this to you Aunt Chilada, but my one and only visit to your establishment kinda sucked!  The long story short goes like this:  - Dinner was  maybe 2.5 stars. The Taco De Jeebus just wasn't amazing. Have had much better pork tacos in Phoenix.  - Service at dinner was 1. The guy actually said to our friend "wow, you're a clean plate club member!" C'mon Spiffy, you don't say that to a lady, regardless.   - Beer was a 4. But it was over priced.  - Too many damn families with babies with what appeared to be "baby SARS." If a kid is yacking up straight clear goo, ask the family to take them out of the dining room. By the time we got done eating we were surrounded in Mormon family hell. Maybe they think that Chilada's is Kolab, but sweet little baby jeebus, keep on your patrons so they're not spreading disease.  Where it really went to hell in a hand basket was when we went into the bar...  Maybe it was because we were with our bald Mexican friend Mario. Maybe it was me with my tattoos hanging out of my Brooks Brothers shirt. Maybe it was my pretty girlfriend. Maybe it was Mario's wonderful wife.  But they never came to serve us at our table. Everyone else got table service, but it ended up with Mario and I having to sherpa back and forth from the bar with our drinks. The service really, really sucks in the bar. They weren't busy, the bar wasn't slammed, the 12 pieces of jail bait bar maids were just too lazy to attend to everything.  Won't be going back.

6IUStj5d17ANBpxTKHzyug.text: I had a great experience at Aunt Chilada's! The food and drinks were amazing and our bartender Lauren was very friendly and helpful. She makes a mean vodka tonic as well.

mbzxdcE6lkO4xy6s4zOMsg.text: Best. Chips. Ever.  It makes me sad when I reach the bottom of the bowl and get the boring tortilla chips.  Fabulous margaritas.  You never feel like they make them properly until you've had 3.  Outdoor dining is awesome.  I really enjoy the outdoor bar.  Comfy and fun.  Shrimp tacos are to DIE for.  Perfect amount of food (seriously...you need more than two?  Chew your food.  Your pants will fit better.), well-seasoned, and presented with great sides (big fan of the rice).  Seating has never been a problem any time I've gone.  The place is HUGE.  It gets a bit loud on live music nights, but that's really to be expected.  You shouldn't eat here if you want a cozy, quiet, dimly lit corner booth with privacy.  It's a family restaurant.    Big fun to be had!

JK6N8Wfoiv0lzAPhifJ_AQ.text: I really liked this place. The frozen margs are probably the best I have ever had (strong and not sugary). A little pricy (my taco salad was $13). Con queso was a joke though (melted cheddar that got grainy). I love the old/eclectic lool of the place though. Old railroad ties, neat looking outside patio.

pzOT2jQEkkWuPlzLqCIj4g.text: Fun outdoor bar with food service. 2nd time here; very enjoyable. Food decent; atmosphere lively. Boce ball court nearby for those looking for added fun. Bar tender pleasent on the eyes.

T81XsjH4EVcOBizQEX3Z_A.text: I went to Aunt Chilada's on a gorgeous 80 degree day in December, so we were able to sit outside. The patio is pleasant and plush with lots of plants, flowers, birds running around, and a fountain. As many of the other reviews said, the chips and salsa are great! Since my date and I ate so many chips, we decided to share a fajita, which was good but nothing special. The service was respectable and our water glasses were always filled. I did not drink, but I saw a few margaritas go by that looked quite tempting!! I also heard they have bands on the weekends, which I want to check out sometime. It was a great dining experience and the atmosphere on the patio was wonderful! I would definitely recommend going here on a nice day so you can sit outside.

DnTbQFDRk8SOvIqkwRL_AA.text: This place gets 3 stars and mainly for the atmosphere and homemade chips. I give them 5 stars for the atmosphere, but other than the chips the food just isn't that great. This place has the potential to be amazing, but it falls a little short.  If you want a fun experience, good drinks, and a cute atmosphere but can leave your food expectations behind then this is the place for you. I will be back, but just to sip cocktails on their patio.

6f7_FBz6mxZyVendOLJbbg.text: This place has gone so downhill. If I hadnt gotten my chips, salsa & water immediately, I wouldve walked out. Margaritas are always awesome. But the service and food is straight up AWFUL. Microwaved enchiladas, no rice, rude, cold, unfriendly, uninviting service...If you're looking for a fabulous, neighborhood mexican restaurant, try Las Glorias Grill. The location isnt as great, but the food, service and drinks, blows this place outta the water. After years of going to aunt chiladas, Im NEVER going back again. They dont deserve your money either....

1SvSRuC0muvXeiLdb39uzw.text: Every time I'm in Phoenix, I go to Aunt Chiladas, it's the best!!  I love, love, love their flour tortilla chips & salsa. Chicken pechugas & pollo fundido are amazing!  The atmosphere is great, it feels like you are on vacation!  I love it!

l7_eAn2_NFA0fKGG2FT3xA.text: Great atmosphere and outdoor area.    Bocci ball court is awesome. If you don't know how to play somebody will help you. When we were there one of the refs was giving us lessons. I was able to find to my skills and become a world champion bocci ball player in just one hour and five margaritas. It was simply amazing.  If only the sport was in the Olympics.  However this does not offset the fact that (in my opinion) the food is not great. Even the chips are bad. How can you have a Mexican restaurant with bad chips?

fPDYrjAcCsB_hRdiY6aVYw.text: After a strong recommendation from my foodie co-worker, my husband and I tried Aunt Chilada's. I had to talk him into going, as the Yelp reviews were so mixed. This one time, I will admit that my husband was right (ha!). We were seated quickly and given shot glass-sized glasses for water(really?) and chips and salsa. The flour chips were tasty but the salsa was standard, with the exception of black olives. Yuck. We proceeded to wait for 15 minutes to have a server even approach us for drinks, with many tables being seated and served well after our arrival and before we even got a "hello". NOT a good first impression. Our waiter finally arrived and my husband ordered a house margarita which I was so jealous of as I rubbed my pregnant belly. He said it was "just okay," and was seemingly quite watered down. He ordered ground beef nachos and I got a combination plate with a cheese enchilada and a chicken taco.   My husband received the wrong order and had every meat imaginable on his nachos (and was later charged too much, as well). He said that the nachos were average tasting, with the chicken and ground beef being tasteless. The shredded beef that was also on there supposedly had the most flavor. My enchilada was pretty good with good taste and flavorful sauce, but the taco was horrible. The chicken was not seasoned and extremely overdone, and didn't seem to be fresh. It had a horribly unappetizing texture, as though it had been recooked in the microwave and dried out the pieces so that it was hard and stale. The refried beans were fine but the fideo was flavorless, cold, and didn't go with the meal at all. When I think of Mexican cuisine, I want some delicious rice, not noodles. Too bad they don't offer a side option.   Although the food was not good, I would typically give any place a second chance. However, the poor service has cemented the fact that we will never go here again. Drinks were never re-filled, we weren't checked in upon, and after asking for our check and a to-go box for my husband's nachos, we had to wait another 10-15 minutes. Sadly, we had a view of the kitchen door, where we watched our server stand and joke around with co-workers during that wait. He then brought the check (which was incorrect) and a box for the table next to us but not one for us. We said forget it and left with a bad taste in our mouths (literally).

9C7Ga9n7ATYGkcpJnHWhhw.text: We had a 50th Anniversary party here... It was perfect! They went above and beyond in helping to make sure everything was taken care. The food was great... We had left overs and everyone wanted to know where the chicken/spinach enchiladas were. We didn't have any of those left, and i was worried, that people wouldn't eat much of them because of the spinach. They were delicious! Everyone one loved the food. The fideo was just as good. I was a little worried that the kids that attended the event would be bored, but this place is perfect for ALL ages... if you have it out on their beautiful patio, there is so much to do for everyone! I can't wait to find another event to have to come back! All 55 people in our party raved about how nice a place it was. Thank you Aunt Chiladas, everyone did an awesome job! You made our event perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. It looked great!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect patio seating area
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor ping pong tables

ZzhYDELsGGi4Z8gj00zDdQ.text: A short walk from the Hilton Pointe brings you here. Fresh salsa and chips were served right away. Friendly staff and plenty to choose from on the menu. The Street Tacos were tasty as was the guacamole appetizer. One in our party order a vodka tonic and the tonic was flat, same for the replacement drink but that can happen to anyone. The food was tasty and serving time was about 10 minutes. Grab a seat in the outdoor courtyard and watch a Bocci game while you dine. Tina Ann took good care of us and was friendly and engaging. Good prices and a pleasant dinner.

NBvxn2rEKcXFv5X8xLlOww.text: Love love love Madison the bartender!!! She is so sweet, super fast, and just over all lovely! We saw a customer get cranky with her and she handled it so well with a smile on her face. I am impressed! She knew the customers by name - made me want to come back more often! Seriously, highly recommend- and sit at the bar so you meet the amazing Madison!

s919-P--j0mg4X-aJbKuow.text: Located at the resort at South Mountain the small Mexican gem has been around for a long time.  Quick delicious flavorful food.  I ordered the tostada with a couple sides.  I loved it!  Great chips and salsa.  Excellent margaritas.  We ate inside and it was a little loud.  Next time we will eat On Their patio.

UVRS2wQRdZWi_D4jvbOREA.text: Great pace for Mexican food. Homemade flour tortilla chips, with good salsa. President margaritas were so good. And my recommendation are the shrimp tacos. This place has a large outdoor seating area, and a fun atmosphere.
