eQnNwDTpOOpTjcCAnjVy_A.text: Came for Happy about and Emily was so attentive! She gets 5 stars and the happy hour tacos and drinks get 5 stars!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

txOB1n6ijGEN4v7Q0eQG9A.text: This place was awful! If you want better Mexican go to Taco Bell..... my whole meal was $35 and was not worth it. The customer service was sub par they said my table would be ready in 30 minuets and I had no problem with the wait. Although, 40 minuets have now passed and I started to get fed up. When I got to the table it was disgusting, there were crumbled chips everywhere what seemed to be sticky residue was covered all along the edges of the table. To top it off the waitress was rude, never coming back here! Catch me over at the Taco Bell

-8wUZVH-g9LCqB3yvqy4ag.text: I've ridden by this place countless times on my way to and from the trails in Dreamy Draw. Always seemed pretty packed, so we stopped in for lunch to see what it was all about.  The building itself is great, old school and huge. The only other restaurants I've seen with seating areas this big are the buffets at the larger properties in Vegas. Love the padded bar and fixed stools. Good amount of TVs for sports.   Service is awesome. Bartender was super friendly, attentive and helpful.  Drinks are great. Had a few really good margaritas, and I'm a sucker for easy to drink Mexican beers on tap. A bit pricey, but this is a tourist haven. It's expected.   However, the food is what kills this place. I knew this was a by-the-book TexMex place going in (large boat-like plates of different combos of the same 8 ingredients smothered in sauces, cheeses and beans), but even with those low expectations, I was very unimpressed. Menu is giant, like a chain restaurant trying too hard; think Chili's meets On The Border, only executed more poorly than that. While the portions were large, what we had was bland, uninspired and unidentifiable.It truly is a feat that someone in the kitchen was able to cook every bit of taste out of our food. Flavorless beans, chicken, cheese, veg and sauces. I guess they anticipate that the resort tourists would be scared off by food with flavor, and maybe even some spiciness...   Also, pass on the chips and salsa. The chips aren't normal chips, and have the texture of drywall, and probably taste about the same, too. The salsa is utterly flavorless and has black olives floating around in it for some reason. Ick.   Overall, a great space with great service that is sadly producing bland, shitty food for those that apparently lack taste buds. Shame. We won't be back.

qm2oAF7olEmoY6s0DdUrCA.text: This place not only met, but way exceeded my expectations. The location was beautifully decorated, everything was exceptionally clean, the food was clean, fresh, and delicious. There was enough that I had a whole meal to take home. Also, the staff was very friendly! I stopped in with my family while on a staycation and we all had a wonderful time. As a Phoenix area resident, I know I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sour cream and chicken enchiladas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taco salad

liWTcubXnTuPTqdsy5ZYqA.text: Went here tonight and loved the chips and salsa. The flour tortilla chips were pretty bomb.  Waiter was nice, a little nervous though.  Ordered the vegan fajitas and they brought out a stir fry of vegetables with lettuce cups ( I didn't know I would have to make my own food )   Good local/ family owned place. It was also my birthday and they gave me a free ice cream

WLjxUO8kj1GWI7tzUsSPgA.text: Came in to unwind after work and have a drink. Madison was great and very attentive to me despite being very busy and having a full house on her hands. I'll definitely be back and would recommend the food and service to anyone. Thanks Madison!

aJ77FmOhl7ZThpktnLG80g.text: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. Food is good, service is good, prices are very reasonable, and its a really nice place to hang out. Great Bar area, nice traditional mexican decor inside and a terrific patio area with an outside bar. The free fried chips are awesome.  I`ve tried quite a few things on the menu. Pollo Fundido is excellent. Seafood Enchilladas are very good. Fajitas are a bit disappointing. Good frozen Margaritas. Highly recommended.

vT4T89n2GPVESImdRxIq1A.text: Great food!  The wait staff was awesome.  Tiffany was very helpful and so friendly.   The pineapple and shrimp stuffed pineapple was out of this world the flavors were spot on.   The seafood enchiladas were also amazing.  The fresh chips and salsa were outstanding.   The atmosphere was great with outdoor seating   Not to loud was comfortable atmosphere.

a5WQ3rPWYj_B7cR0jL-niA.text: Great fajitas & tacos-very fresh and flavorful. Tortillas are excellent. Chips and salsa are ok. Great location & cute ambiance. Service was average

FjLqCkXbFbdkT7QIaCX9Eg.text: Wowzer, this is quite overwhelming. It is very easy to get lost here. Multiple rooms and nooks and crannies for dining everywhere. I think there was a wedding and a quinceanera going on along with at least 3 birthday parties. This place is definitely festive and we had a table next to the bocce court. The cocktails are ok. Margaritas are made with mixer instead of fresh squeezed lime. The food is solid mexican. I had the fajitas which were ok. It was kind of a mash up of chicken, peppers and onions. I am used to fresh al dente veggies(broccoli, carrot, squash, peppers and onions) and this was not that. Great for kids - after dinner they can root around the treasure chest for a treat.  Solid festive restaurant.

u3b4KYUuc1BvuTl-7YRZ5g.text: Chips and salsa alone made this 5 star worthy. It's my second time here and, once again, I was not disappointed. My margarita was pretty good. And my chimichanga dish was delightful! Service was carried out pretty quickly and my server was very friendly and attentive. She took very good care of us. I will return.

flacujCSh50e67OoRhTo9A.text: Suggested by a dear friend...it did not disappoint. We were seated right at our reservation time. Great menu. Excellent drinks. Food was really good, served hot and huge portions! Shrimp tacos were soooo good!  Live band..."Hillbilly Deluxe" (I think?) was playing a great mix of music that we hung around and listened to after dinner.  Fun place.

Ig4yrPMCS9omvr-_d0SgXw.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing.   Especially when chauffeured I'm a golf cart to and from the resort unit!

fdT_yQqy-8eReLbX1mjO_g.text: Use to come here quite often but moved farther away so haven't been here for quite awhile... had family in town and thought it would be nice to have dinner out in the patio..: the place is in a really nice setting... service was super slow, never got water, the tamale was covered in red sauce and when I mentioned it to the waitress... she just said that's how the come?! I've never had a tamale covered in sauce! Asked for an extra napkin... never got it... it just was a very poor visit! Dissapointed!

bI5x6DnXqPxaAuI5SW2XRQ.text: Great patio. Food average. Pricey. Many better options for Mexican food in the area. Tortilla soup not good. Salsa not great. Overall unforgettable food and experience.

DxReClRr-ngJlw8Yu2pPbA.text: I love love love this place!     Love the margaritas!  The chips and dip are to die for as is the rest of the food.   The drinks are a good pour and not watered down like many restaurants.  Happy Hour prices are amazing!!  The family who own this will treat you like family.  And although I have yet to get there when they have a band I plan to do that as soon as I am back in Arizona.    Our flight attendant crew of 30 or more are having a gathering there tonight.  I wish I was there however I know they will love it as well.   So if you have a business meeting, birthday, girls night out or whatever I would say you can't go wrong booking it here!  Thank you, Aunt Chiladas.  You are my first stop when I get home to Arizona after my many trips each month!! I  YOU!

A2cCuhXURYPj0WeQrY1u-w.text: We tried to order from there again for work and they cancelled on us, no notice. The excuse was they were too busy for us.  So a separate order had to be placed late and several people didn't get at all what they wanted. I guess that explains the food... They don't need to care about making it good.

xNMqQyctxHYbvEebC9v1VA.text: My family and I were staying at the nearby Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak Resort and after a day of pool-hopping, we were really craving some Mexican food and an ice cold margarita. We Googled and found Aunt Chilada's. The name made us laugh and the food looked great in the photos so it was a go.   What a great place! It was just what we wanted: Good food and cold drinks. They were quite busy but we were seated right away. Service was prompt, friendly, and accurate. The food was great! The enchilada sauce was our favorite and we ended up ordering side orders of it to dip our chips (the flour ones are insanely good) in instead of the salsa. My mom even had a few spoonfuls sans chip right out of the little cup -- it was that good. I ordered a combo plate of enchiladas, beef tamale, and beef crunchy taco. My enchiladas (I had a cheese one and a chicken one) were delicious. The cheese was melty and gooey and the chicken, although a little dry, was still a good portion and flavorful. The tamale was good, but if I had to choose, I'd go for the taco every time. It was a good portion, juicy, crunchy, and fresh due to the fresh tomatoes and lettuce. Dip the taco in the enchilada sauce and OHMAHGAWD...   The margaritas were a little too sweet (the tequila was oh so right) but I mentioned this to the waiter and the second one be brought me was less sweet, so it's obvious they want to please their guests and are willing to make whatever changes are necessary to do so, which I appreciate.  This place was exactly what we wanted. No, this is not fine dining, but it's better than Chili's or Applebee's could ever hope to be and we felt good supporting a local establishment.

1KHdEHiYm-4CnfvLMxYY6Q.text: I took a friend here to celebrate her birthday. We ordered their lunch steak/vegetable fajitas. It came out on a sizzling plate. It had nice assortment of veggies which I loved. With all the fix-ins it came with, there were plenty of leftovers. My friend had their shrimp tacos and she really enjoyed hers. We also never tried the Spanish pasta before which was served instead of the usual rice. It was softer and more delicate than the rice but just as tasty.  We also ordered their sundae as dessert and our waiter added a candle for my friend as he overheard us talking. Service and atmosphere was excellent. Highly recommend. They also have pet friendly patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and vegetables fajitas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fajitas fixins
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Tacos

o4NLHuNFEXvP1db2X-o-Rw.text: Awesome family owned Mexican restaurant. It's the perfect mix of good food, good ambiance, indoor and outdoor seating, and 4 bars!!! The frozen margaritas are amazing, mostly tequila. I had two and was basically drunk, I had the blueberry and prickly pear, amazing. My husband has the chicken burrito and I had the seafood burrito with shrimp AND scallops, the sauce was very savory. Instead of rice they have noodles, which were really good, they mix well with the burrito/enchilada sauce. Plain they're kinda bland but still an interesting twist!   Amy was our waitress and she was very attentive and nice. The bartender also complimented my husband and I on how cute we were and told us we should be bartenders. I loved it

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood burrito
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry margarita
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prickly pear margarita

VUxrKveLqp7VqUNMGFb7fw.text: This is for tourists, not for people who want genuine Mexican food.  The enchiladas came with CUBED chicken. Like, what? Chicken enchiladas should have shredded chicken, not perfectly sized large cubes. Also, instead of providing rice, they provided chopped up angel hair pasta with some weak spices to it.  If you're in town looking for REAL Mexican food, please do not go here. It's cute inside and on the patio, and you may spot some parrots, but your tastebuds will be disappointed in you.

DxSFfJEAxisnmkrhIdOWHQ.text: Ooohhh Boooyyy!  When the star align, they really do align in our favor.  We had no reservation on a Friday night, and they had parties galore going on. The private parking lot was full. Parking on the street was also full for at least a mile. There was NO chance we were getting a table any time soon.  Wrong!   After navigating the throngs of people waiting to get a table, we made it to the reservation desk. We asked for a table for 2, and she took down my name. She summarily informed me that it would be over an hour's wait.   No biggie! I was with my Beloved. Waiting was not an issue. We weren't that famished, so we could easily keep ourselves entertained playing games on our phones.  We happen to find an open spot right by the reservation desk. Five minutes later, the Manager comes over to the desk. She looked at us, we smiled back. She then asks if we wanted to be seated now!  We were in shock! What? Ummm...you know that we've only been here for 5 minutes right. The rest of these folks around us have been here for I don't know how long.  But, who are we to argue? We followed the waitress, as she led us past the other patrons with the puzzled looks on their faces.   They seated us at a table right in the middle of all the revelry, and we quickly got acclimated to the "fun" crowd.  My wife had the Burrito and Relleno, and I had the fish taco and the machaca enchilada. Both dishes were excellent. I think the only thing we didn't really like were the chips. They were an odd mix of flour and corn tortilla chips. We pretty much only like really thin, warm and crispy, corn tortilla chips. Other than that, everything was excellent. There was just too much food.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Machaca Enchilada
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Taco
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Relleno and Burrito Combo

WJUobqf0ju4wXbDR37oT2w.text: This place is absolutely amazing! The food is wonderful and the service is even better. Our waiter, Patrick, was attentive, friendly, charming and you were never without drink or an umbrella (if needed!)  We drive 20min just to eat here and we will continue to make the journey just for Aunt Chiladas amazing experience!

gpHBzn5UD1UoWn4lhqOoJw.text: I love enchiladas and eat there every time I go to Phoenix and stay at the Hilton Squaw Peak. Are tortilla chips or handmade in baked and have little puff bubbles in them. They're addictive! Both salsas are to-die-for and the fideo is out of this world. If I didn't live in Seattle I would have dinner there more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iOdIOxwmEbHUb9SvaVo_iw.text: Great restaurant close to the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. The cheese dip is outstanding. The chips are real tortilla chips that they have made there. The only thing I didn't care for was my entree. I got the creamy chipotle chicken & it was just ok. I would recommend it though if you are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Bk9a7mJDnZcMGIrCA14dBg.text: My enchilada urge took over, so here I landed.  The venue is an AZ dream for fall, winter and spring. Friday night during the "outdoor " AZ season they offer free wood grilled pizza with beverage purchase, what deal!! They have a very large, green and accessible outdoor area and bar.  The bar inside is very spacious, the bar itself seats about 12-15 but they have several tables and TVs in the bar area. Ordered.... you guessed it Enchiladas! Seafood to be exact. They where excellent. Shrimp was large/fresh.  Only thing missing was crab, but they do state shrimp and scallops in the description. Wifey ordered fajitas, excellent flavor and portion size.  Only one reason for 4 stars and not 5, my personal preference on salsa and chips. They add olives to there salsa. To each there own, but no bueno for me. Overall this is a must stop and eat place. Excellent food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood Enchiladas

YzX0fbgFIib3Ng5mEUAeGQ.text: Lovely patio garden with real plants providing shade and ambiance. Despite this, we sat inside in. datk corner where the light coming in from the window made it hard to see the menu and the food because of the strong, uneven glare.   We waited for our waitress for so long to take our drink order and later our food order, that I had to look at the menu again to remember what I wanted to get. She was pleasant and good about refilling our drinks though. She also handled my friend's special request of no peppers with her fajitas. In fact she asked to have them on the side so my mom could have them. They were delivered as promised.   My friend ordered fajitas, but her flour tortillas were never delivered to the table. A server from another area stopped by to say that he would bring them out after he helped our waitress deliver food to our table, but he never did.   The salsa was chunky, mild and hearty. We asked for hot sauce which we added to the salsa to give it a bit more of a kick. It was still very mild, but an improvement.  My chicken and spinach enchilada was standard affair. The most unique thing was the side of FIDEO instead of Spanish rice. Fideo is a Mexican pasta dish. The noodles are small and thin which makes it easier to scoop up with a fork. No need to twirl your fork. They are light and the sauce coats each bite without overwhelming the main focus of the dish.   This would not be my first pick for a Mexican restaurant, but my friend suggested it and paid for our meal. I might return under the same circumstances, but more than likely I would suggest an alternative the next time, especially since it will be my turn to pick up the tab.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Follow the painted peppers on the sidewalk from the parking lot to the front entrance
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fajitas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chili rellano

tsguzvD6dCxL4lkCS8LGaQ.text: My best friend was visiting from Seattle and we wanted "authentic" Mexican food. I had a work lunch here once but dinner is much more fun with margaritas. And let me tell you, we had a few different flavors and they were all quality. The Uber driver home thought we were hilarious. Everything was delicious and the service was great.  Will definitely go back when the weather cools down because the patio looks fun.

AXPfkbgabVt4fpHLIcN_vw.text: Reservations for 8. 7 showed up.  Split checks. Service was excellent.  Never left wanting for beverage or chip/salsa refills. Absolutely no complaints with  the servers. Side note: Learned 3/4 way through the meal they have other sauces for table. Salsa, green,  and the hot red sauce.... The standard trio. Apparently the salsa is the default and you have to know to ask for green or hot. Just saying. Service= 5 stars.   My food, not so much. Ordered fajitas. Very oily  Not much flavor.  Ate all the charred bovine flesh and left most of the soggy/oily veggies. Everyone else said they were happy with their meals. So a star back for that.

uZQefM7EhFteJkIEgs6VMQ.text: Delicious food. Chips were very good. Warm and soft that hardened as they got cool. Salsa was a bit bland. Bailey our server was very attentive. Hubby had the quesadilla sampler which was delicious. I had the spinach and chicken enchiladas which was equally delicious. The chicken in it was very tender. All in all a great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spinach and chicken enchiladas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quesadilla sampler

7fQ8EkNEyUa8Etg_xLWMuQ.text: The food here was terrible. Tasteless and bland, and no spice or flavor whatsoever. This place is for people who have never had authentic Mexican food or have a sensitive stomach. The staff was friendly and the agua fresca was refreshing.

x7Pbyt9wPmWas4VcuSRHDQ.text: Awesome lunch at this darling restaurant with so much history! Jenny, one of the daughters hi is the manager today is awesome! Staff is friendly and oh so attentive. Best flour tortilla chips in AZ! My husband had thread different street tacos and loved them! I could barely make a dent in this delicious pineapple shrimp salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8xP_Sa3hdIn3Ew5AA9y0RQ.text: The property itself is fun and unique. But the food was not good. I'm someone who always either finishes my food or brings leftovers home, and had to desire to do either. I tried bites of my companions food, and it was all the same quality. None of us really liked it. Plus, the margaritas were very meh. I could make better ones at home. Service was decent. But the only way I would ever come back is if I lived right down the road and could walk. With hundreds of choices in the Valley for Mexican food - don't bother with this one.

zSw1_wCQi0o8BhL8EoDpaw.text: Aunt Jemima....  Uncle Ben...  I don't think I'll be back again! __________  I reckon it befitting for this Mexican brasserie, no matter how chintzy their comestibles - to derive a "corn earworm/catchphrase" all their own, with attempt at keeping it aLLLLLL within the family.  Aunt Chilada's, ladies and Tex Mex loving gents is your local Phoenix inspired hash house serving up run of the mill grub to any and all that simply don't know any dayum better or are too famished to complain!  #fix-it-Jesus  Located this joint whilst pitching a tent at the nearby Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak.   Their ^ rooms are TRULY enough to leave anyone "squawking" and my quest for booze and tacos somehow led a duly hungry colleague visiting from out of state and I both here.   ........................ REGRET ---  --- is what I'm experiencing upon ordering a simple burrito and margarita while thinking some place bearing more tourists than locals would magically get it right.                   NEVERRRR a good sign!  The chips, consistent of both flour aNNNNd corn tortillas - were an unexpected surprise; just not a good one.  ***** Think, that one hot guy/girl you take home after a sweaty, lust filled night out at the club.   Sure, they were cute beneath the strobe light after a handful of Patron and Jager shots but BAY-BEHHHH, .....waking up next to a pillowcase full of Revlon and previously glued on eyelashes (or melted "Just For Men" beard coloring, provided it's a guy) is the numero uno indication that you've been catfished by a plate full of Arizona tilapia!  Why, Lord? WHYYYYYYY????  I'm SERIOUSLY going to need for this place to perfect one craft prior to switching things up.   The salsa was Pace Picante' at its finest and the burrito tasted microwaved; a total "No No", if you ask me.   Thereon nothing ....... and I do mean NOTHING says, "Home of the Phoenix Suns" like mooning your boss as you bolt to the nearest bathroom stall for an unforeseen caucus of jungle squirts!   Ohhhhh. Mylanta!  Customer service was fair ......well, it was when our server wasn't perfecting Houdini's "disappearing act". The fastest part of our meal was actually when she magically made our check appear!   Abracadabra and this brings me directly to my verdict.  As it appears.....  ***** Another disillusioned reviewer alleged this place to be the "quintessential Phoenix experience".   HUNNIE' .....if this is your perception of quintessential Phoenix, then you and this town both need to rest your swamp cooling shart shooters as you have, NOT ONE but SEVVVVERAL SEATS and locate some SERIOUS air conditioning - STAT!   I'm starting to suspect heatstroke!  Aunt Chilada's, .......consider yourself nixed from my Will and Last Testament. Right about now, you're lucky if you still get a darned Christmas card!  I might have to regift last year's fruitcake.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Who needs Dulcolax with this place around?
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve got the biggest appreciation for authentic chips and salsa (too bad it can&#39;t be located here)!

vdxnluVf9IP5j-dTYrXJvw.text: Pros: - The provided salsa & chips are nice. The chips have a nice texture. - Food was filling, but not that tasty. - The restaurant/patio looks cool.  Cons: - Did not taste authentic (also lacking some common authentic foods/drinks from the menu). Seems like they are trying to figure out where they should land on this. - Overall the food was kind of bland for me. My group had a lot of left overs, but in a way that they didn't seem to like the food much. - Food took quite a while to come out - not a big deal since we were chatting anyway, but I could see this irritating others. - Pretty overpriced for Mexican food in AZ. Most items are $15+ on the menu. Cheaper & better quality options around. - Felt sick a few hours after eating here...granted this could be from anything.  Would be cool if they refreshed the menu/cooking. I really want to like this place!

PwerD_dCE7D9G2WtxQ-zVw.text: Staying down the road at the Pointe, some girlfriends and I decided to venture down for Dinner Friday night around 7 pm. A wait at the hostess stand, while having several employees/servers etc. walk past us without acknowledging us or anything got annoying after several minutes..Was ready to go find a table ourselves when finally a server came and took us to a table in the dining room.   I had the Avacado Salad after my server recommended it..which was interesting! It was dressed with a pinapple sauce which had a little kick to it, however it would have been better if the salad wasn't swimming in the sauce!    It was ok, but not as impressive as I expected it to be..

0BzLj1yWIq607FqllI4STQ.text: We ate here last night. The scenery is authentic food was great. Service was exceptional. Had pan lank pepper which was fantastic and so were the seafood enchiladas. Would highly recommend.

NTsGzDaDO8yp0WUFx4n4Fg.text: The food was good but not spectacular. The atmosphere and service was great. I love the bocce ball court is great. Fun to play while enjoying a cervesa. I'm very willing to give this place a 2nd chance.

dXLavbPFPVfcvNSmXyM3GA.text: I wanted to dislike this place. Hokey decor and ubiquitous gringos that come with any american-mexican joint; but maybe it was that I had come in with a huge (15+) group of people and was in generally a good mood from straight chilling on the next-door Hilton's lazy river that framed it positively.  Big restaurant is big: no problem seating everyone, huge outdoor patio, chips and salsa constantly flowing.  Had a Corona light and said to hell with counting calories tonight - it's time for Pollo Fundido, something filled with chicken and jalapeno cream cheese that there is no way you can finish in one sitting.  Came away sated and generally happy with our servers and the copious amounts of beef/chicken/cheese/tortillas/more cheese that everyone at our tables got quickly and pretty tastily. Just get rice instead of fideo with your entree.  Good for what it presents itself to be.

rvKU6okch9MhbCqW7aAf_A.text: The chips and salsa are worth the trip to aunt chilada's alone. I love the flour tortillas that have neem fried instead of the harder corn tortillas you normally see. I also love how they will grill you jalapenos on the side if you request it instead of just regular pickled jalapenos from a jar like most places. Fantastic place for happy hour or dinner or Sunday brunch. Love this place.

79QQI186EHP7yyQaE2whAg.text: I love this place! The atmosphere is really great, especially the patio when its not too hot outside. The bocce court is a plus as well. I've been here to watch sports events as well as to hang out with friends on the patio; Aunt Chiladas is good for both! They have a wide variety of beers as well as really great margaritas. I've never been disappointed with the food, although the service has been a little slow at times. I'm not sure of the exact schedule, but they also sometimes have a free food buffet outside!

VjHsQoDekoVCmDwwrTMtSg.text: Did someone actually refer to the salsa as Ketchup?! Oh hell no!! The salsa and chips are by far the best I have had in the valley. I was surprised this place got such mediocre ratings. I have been going here since I moved to the valley and it's always reliable.  The location is great because it is so different from anyplace else; Mexican or not. Tucked back of 16th st in a more residential area, the patio is great and there is always room even when it's busy.  The service is always good and then there is the chips and salsa. I don't see how anyone can knock it, it's always fresh. The more pico inspired salsa is chunky and has a good amount of cilantro. The hot red salsa is more of a paste but more authentic and delicious with some heat. The flour tortillas chips are always warm and delicious. Most of the time I load up on chips so much I just get a Tostada and a beer or house margarita.   When I used to eat chicken and dairy the chicken chimi fundido was something I always went for. I get the veggie burrito on occasion now but that isn't anything great, it's got plenty of veggies but nothing to write home about(if my home was in Mexico). The veggies in it aren't what I think of when I think Mexican, it has carrots, cauliflower, etc in it. No peppers, onions, etc.....oh well.  I would just give it 3 stars if I didn't love the chips/salsa and location/ atmosphere so much. That bumps it up a star in my book.   Salsa is like ketchup? Seriously? Sorry...I can't let it go.  Oh yeah, for awhile in 2008 every time my girlfriend and I went here it seemed there was always a wedding party, high school reunion, or other annoying large group gathering. In 2009 we haven't seen as much of it but be warned, you can usually still dine, but half the place is reserved and you have to deal with horrible band or MC music and exhaustingly obnoxious people.

k1ZEeXpozMUwlj_SDuj2vQ.text: Wow, what a relief.  I am so glad to see an average Yelp rating of 3 stars.  I was worried that I was crazy because when I arrived, I read multiple "Best of..." awards (you know the ones), but by the time the meal was over, I was thinking, "Best of what!?"  I am so glad my fellow Yelpers agreed with me: this place has great atmosphere, but the food is average at best.  To their credit, I walked through an incredibly great patio, perfect for Arizona winters, on my way to the main entrance.  But it reminds me of Tortilla Factory in Scottsdale.  You don't go for the food.  You go for the patio.

89STANrs-4VDuknEABcooA.text: This is the single worst restaurant I've ever been to, anywhere. From the looks of the other reviews, I must have caught them on a bad night, but I swear to God, the tacos I had there tasted like spoiled meat. My friend and I couldn't stomach more than one bite each and were not satisfied by the restaurants lack of concern over our complaints.   We were made to pay for inedible food and no attempt was made to make things right... And for the record, I've got no problems with 'real' Mexican food-- street vendors and the worst Mexican joints I've been to from LA to Ensenada to Cozumel, are all better than this place.

QeN96mrRzfc322Q_p6-_XQ.text: I've been here 3 times on the company tab because it's a fun atmosphere for out-of-town guests. The drinks are good, but the food is meh. Out of the 3 visits, the only thing I remember liking is the soup. Oh, and the flour chips are unique and pretty good. I guess I'll go back for a free meal, but wouldn't consider seeking it out on my own.

DC0A26O4ATiPBJp_PcV72w.text: I'm giving Aunt Chilada's a 3. Its ok. The service is ok.   We went here this past weekend with a group of about 25 people. They sat us at 3 different tables. We asked our server if each table could have its own tab, so it would be easier for us and them to figure out at the end....they said no. Lovely. Luckily there was an atm in the bar area so we were able to pull out cash.   The food came out faster then expected with such a large group. Mine was decent, though I ordered a cheese enchilada and they gave me chicken and never came back to ask how our food was :( BUT I also ordered a green corn tamale AND a beef taco (Leave me alone, I worked all day and was hungry as all hell) Those were both way super tasty.   I do have big beef with their chips. They suck. Who wants flaky not so crispy chips for dipping in salsa...not me. I want my chips crispy, thin and crunchy thank you very much.   The margaritas were good, they got me sauced.   I wouldn't ask to go back, but if someone suggested going, I wouldn't put up a stink. Its ok.

scSIJqj1L0hc5lp2ABsXiQ.text: Great service, great atmosphere, great vibe, and great food. Try the avocado chicken salad or Pollo fundido

-mdF-Rn2Vx0nicBz2p3R8g.text: I probably wouldn't come here nearly as much if I didn't live right down the street. In all honesty, the food is pretty mediocre.  However, I've found a solution that works pretty well for me: get really drunk, then eat. Four stars for Prickly Pear margaritas and being able to stumble home.  The flour tortilla chips are pretty damn good and addicting. However I've noticed a suspicious discrepancy in torilla chip ratio lately, they seem to be hiding more flimsy corn chips in with the flour. Very sneaky and lame.  And Fideo? Yuck. Uh no pasta with my mexican food please, I'll stick with the rice.  If anything, get drunk and enjoy the wonderful patio on a nice day. I still haven't tried their brunch yet but they had me at Chocolate Fountain.

JVfjZzSvOB5jFWj6dlZNLA.text: We went here on Sunday around 6pm.Its was practically empty we got our seats out on the patio and waited and waited for service.............finally she comes out from inside takes out drink order ok done brings it back and takes our food order we asked to start with dinner salads then proceeded to order our meals.Less then FIVE minutes later out comes our meals no salad we ask the girl where our salads were and she says I work in the kitchen I don't know where your salads are.OK excuse me...MMMMmm Forget the salad now we wanted it first not after.I bite into my Flautas YUK!!! They had to have been microwaved the meat was rock hard and the tortillas were like rubber! We complained but all we got was you don't have to pay for the salads well I guess not we never had salad! WE have been going here for years and this our  first bad experiance and very bad it was.

iag9YgHR9F4TBYw3FBhK2g.text: I am a huge fan of this restaurant but they have poor organization and communication skills. I went in on Tuesday at 2pm and it was very slow. We were moved three times before ordering because the staff said the areas we had been seated in were closed and waiters weren't zoned in that area. It took about 20 minutes to get our drinks and mine came out incorrectly. For a slow period, communication should be on point. It was rare that we were checked on and the fish tacos were very bland and slightly cold by the time I received them. I am willing to give it another shot because I remember a time where the service and food was incredible, but this put me off.

MENXEmHugSaU4i31syoqng.text: The food is okay, but the margaritas, and chips and salsa are awesome. Besides this, I really love atmosphere. The outdoor bar and bocce ball court create a cool and inviting feeling.

Kwe6PpiUYSBj_zkfrubX-g.text: Love the beautiful outdoor patio and so does my dog! The service is friendly and attentive and the fish tacos are amazing!

kftVDxpHXJZjVk1mfF9Jyw.text: Aunt Chilada's is a great place to rack up a huge liquor bill. If you work in the area, or are like me and always attend wine tastings in the area, then this is the place to go afterwards.   I've been quite a few times with a big group of people and we always have a great time.  Our server is always fast, the drinks flow freely and the food is pretty good. It's just a fun little place to hang out, chat with friends, sip some cocktails and eat pretty decent Mexican food. I don't know if I would travel all the way to Aunt Chilada's if I wasn't already in the area- that is unless it's for Cinco de Mayo. There's no better place to celebrate than Aunt Chilada's. But if you plan on joining the festivities, get there suuuuuper early to secure a spot or it will be standing room only!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sHcjsw64RL9bRl6eCg3JlQ.text: My aunt had a birthday there awhile back. They had a separate side for us to enjoy with a room for a DJ with was wonderful. The food was not good, we had appetizers and I also ordered  a chili burrito. It tasted like it was frozen food. There was also a singer on the other side in the bar and it was competing for sound..poor guy. The owner/bar tender was great!

od9ngCsqd3c1tSYKWOELlg.text: On a Sunday night in July, we met up with some out of town friends who were staying at a local hotel.  The location was perfect for them - so, I called and made a reservation for our group.  When we first arrived, the bar area was vacant - with the exception of one other table of 2 customers.  Since we had called ahead and let them know that our group would be there at 7, I was hoping for, at least, good service.  Unfortunately, the service was really slow. More than once, someone from our group had to go find our server and request service.  Ugh!  While the conversation from our friends really kept us entertained, it's kind of sad when the server can't seem to remember why she came to work (make money?)  While I didin't personally try one, the consensus was the margaritas were more like tequila shooters with fozen ice thrown in - which is fine if that's what you're ordering.  Would we come back?  Maybe - if we have other friends staying locally.    Would I recommend it?  Not sure.    Plus Side:  Great patio with sand bowling.  Would be a great during the winter months.

HMvwmJ6_LKUgSgjGqD4gdg.text: This place is a little tucked away hidden treasure! The venue is awesome with so many areas to sit and enjoy. The Yelp event I went to had the exclusive use of the large outdoor patio - totally cool, right? It is so open and had great space for the stage, the buffet set up and other little fun attractions set up around the place....hello beer burro! It immediately had me thinking about what kind of party or celebration I could have on this patio...guess that means I'm sold on the venue, huh? The food was great and offered a lot of variety. My favorites were the tamale and the desserts. The service was excellent and the staff was super friendly. Definitely a fun place to stop by for a good meal, a good drink or if you want to have a full on fiesta with you and 50 of your closest friends! Ole!

j-a0SZwYQicLT6MO9GYlsg.text: Amazing Mexican food at a great price. The flour chips are to die for and no one else has them. Family friendly place. Our service was excellent our server Dan Boise was very attentive, polite and an absolute pleasure.

SrHRp0jOdOvqeG3fMrdVMg.text: I had a business lunch here recently and we had a wonderful time. The portions here are pretty big so we were both fine with ordering one item each a la carte. She had a tostada; I had a bean burrito. It was just the right amount. And their chips are delicious. It was quiet enough that we could have a conversation at normal volume and the staff was friendly and attentive without being over bearing.

278KheFtVA2y2MsRjFEGYQ.text: So dissatisfied we went to Denny's afterwards.  Sour cream and lime extra charge for your tacos?  Not going to eat here again.

RqyjY3vRTof-IPHmmpJoOA.text: Ate dinner here a week ago.  They advertised a free buffet for happy hour but turns out it is nothing more than chips and salsa.   They also have a fruit platter but who is going to eat that with the cantaloupe killing so many people. When we saw the "Buffet" we decided to try dinner.  Did not like the food. Just a tiny step above fast food.  The side dish was sone kind of noodles but they were cut up in about 1 inch pieces.  The beans were mashed and I almost gagged on them.  The chile relleno was the best part of the meal but still not up to par with the Barrio Cafe,  I do not plan on going back here again.  Can't believe their quality of food since they are located in a high class neighborhood. Their adsvertising photos below are terrible.  Photgrapher used very bad lighting and it shows.

FYl1N6bhr2z91uUESGjfdQ.text: Where else can you celebrate Cinco de Mayo with bands, an ice louge and a bocce tournament? ...no, seriously, where else? Their patio is amazing.   They have a lighter, more fish-eatin' friendly menu than most of the other Mexican joints in the area. If you've never had it, the fideo is a little like a noodles-from-a-bag dish and I recommend skipping it.  Their salsa is full of flavorful ingredients like black olives, but don't go here looking for fire. You'll have to head elsewhere to bring on the heat.

XXLEI5wOvOOS5P2osCfrqw.text: I love this place.  Frozen Margarita's are the best and they do not short you on alcohol at all.  Love the chips and salsa and the best item I think is the fish tacos.

coI1TZcgPMLwlrcB8vtTnw.text: Good food, good atmosphere, friendly staff.  Patio is dog friendly, they even brought out water for our 130 pound rottie, he loved it! Great place to take the kids, they love the free chocolate fountain.  Chips and salsa are fabulous!

96TDoykYwAnF1bMOE2Z7qg.text: We had the nachos which were good, they were suppose to have chicken but I think we got one piece of chicken.  The beans were bad, they tasted as though they had just opened the can and poured them on the nachos.  I asked the waitress for some flour tortillas because I believe that flour tortillas tell you a lot about a Mexican restaurant especially those who claim they are authentic, homemade.  Their flour tortillas were AWFUL!!! She gave me like 3 or 4, they were all stuck to each other and these flour tortillas were not homemade.  I have bought some from the store that were way better. Don't bother with this place.

I6_-MSa9p9_pmukx8n6CPw.text: Lets just say it kind of sucked. Stayed at the Pointe across the street and heard good things.  The beer was the best part.. which was bottled.. not here. I do not even remember what I had it was so good. Puffy chips? Who the hell wants wierd puffy chips!? Go somewhere else. On The Border is almost better Mexican food... and that place is terrible!

PLD18t-NkjKCBuxOUvxgDQ.text: Enjoy it here and regularly get good service. Have enjoyed a large variety of menu items over the years. Great meal for after a long day at the pool.

l6yU6_DuEgGSq_wX2Wn7kw.text: I love Aunt Chilada's!! Ive been going here for years with my family! the chingalingas are my FAVORITE meal!

3EppSDhrRIh8b2LIRClz8Q.text: Met another couple here for lunch on Friday. I had called for reservations earlier and requested dog friendly patio seating. On arrival were greeted warmly by hostess, a long time employee. Addressed me by name and 'you have a doggie?'. Great service, good food. The 2 sisters met us during lunch and the mom owner family thanked us for coming. We recommend this restaurant based on great service, good food and great hospitality. All Good!

tTTAwHypQIMFJNsI7hXJlA.text: We were very disappointed in the lack of service tonight.  After a long visit we finally saw our waitress for the second time when she brought the check.  Will think twice about coming back.

omkTpxIYN20zyZxUWCNfcw.text: Stopped in for lunch with my two sons.  The last time i visited was over 18 years ago (I don't get to Phoenix all that often).  The outside patio was great, especially for a group from the frozen north who don't sit outside to eat in December.  The menu was adequate, with a good selection for lunch.  Chips and salsa were interesting, mild.  Food was well prepared and portions generous for the price paid.  Service was good.  Overall, a good, but not outstanding experience.

zVauw0LFO_8pTpaEvusytg.text: We took the family out for dinner on a Thursday night.  The kids wanted chips & salsa, gotta love'm!  It is a bit hidden of the beaten path but Yelp & iPhone map took us right to the front door.   The patio is really interesting. It was a bit chilly for our taste, but others were bundled up and enjoying the patio. We sat inside near the fireplace.   The chips & salsa were good, not the best, but not the worst by far.  Three of us shared fajitas and our son had a cheeseburger & fries, very authentic "Mexican", only my son!! The burger didn't last long, it must have been awesome because he had already had a basket of chips on his own. We enjoyed our fajitas, our daughter has been on a fajita kick for about three months now. Guess its less expensive than the Prime Rib kick she was on the eight months prior.   We had a nice evening, but Aunt Chilada's is a bit far for us to drive for Mexican food.

DLiFRvdqryNWgMpEGUlrXQ.text: Their new menu is AMAZING!! The grilled Basa fish is to die for!!!   And they have Foursquare AND Facebook specials! So i got a FREE messy sundae and a FREE pint of their famous salsa all just for "Checking-in" AWESOME!!

WHEihIh5fpOUz14HsJZaeg.text: The food is good but not great and the service can be questionable at times (especially in the bar), but it's such a great spot that I can overlook most of that.  Dog friendly patio, lots of outdoor space for nice weather days and the owners are wonderful people.  Bocce ball to pass the time while sipping on a nice Margarita.  The chips and salsa are a standout (not many places have flour tortilla chips) and the street tacos are a winner.

ngac5AOabZlP_4tHA7gzrg.text: We went to the restraunt day before and we closed to a private party. Came here after the nascar race and the decoration we cool very welcoming and the food was amazing.

kA5TQDuMlGegXOyR7ROboA.text: First time here was lunch yesterday. Very few people present, but it took our server more than 10 minutes to make first contact. "I didn't know you guys were here", I believe were her exact words. Sat outside, and it was nice but a little on the warm side for me. Scavenger birds were everywhere, landing on the tables and even plates (used & unused) looking for food. When diners left, birds immediately converged on their table and started eating. There is something very disconcerting about a blackbird eating sour cream off of a half-eaten burrito... I digress. I had the seafood burrito which was very good. Rice & beans were no better or worse than other restaurants in this class. My friend had the chicken sour cream burrito and also said it was good. Our table was very unstable, and it took more than one request to get something to shove under the "short" leg to stabilize it. Overall, not bad, but I probably will not be back.

2TGQCXIPJ0wF-hPkfQAnTw.text: Happy Hour time!!!    This review is purely based on HH.  We met up with friends on a celebratory boozing.  It was jam packed on a freakingly hot afternoon.  I order me some cold margarita.  It must be their HH itty bitty version of the drink which was decent.  Hey, my friend bought us the first round, so can't complain!  Then, I had some White Russian...nasty stuff.  Hubby was smart to chug beer instead.  The freebee food bar consisted of chips, beans, salsa, hot wings, tamales and cheese enchiladas (chafing dish of the last two was empty).  Should've ordered food instead.   I decided to forgo the fruit and veggie platter with flies feasting and buzzing around.  My son asked me to Google "What do flies do to food?", I decided that I don't care much for fly vomit.  Aunt Chilada's should invest in acrylic food covers!  Several round of shots came out.  The extra star is for our server's awesomeness.  I had to have some ginger ale after that and guzzled some water.  After all that I had to go to the outhouse...it was like a sauna in there!!!    It's not a place I would go back to, if I had  the choice.

-wfGShkJk44XohUTcJIOPg.text: I give solid 3 stars. Thursday night group of 6.slow in the beginning from host to food. We had to put together our own table open mic area.waoted about 5-10 min on drinks another on menus.SErver was very friendly just think it tough on 1 server to work a bunch of people. There was a 10 top, 3, 4 and few others.the salsa was really good.the chips where mix flour and corn witch I like.i had shrimp taco thinking it would be breaded however no breading witch didn't set well with a flour tortilla as taco. Rice and beans really good everyone else food looked good but mine was avg. I recommend breading the shrimp and maybe a Chipotle mayo sauce

2AKotJmdzyHvMRqaamIMwg.text: Pathetic translation for a restaurant.  People heed to the Yelp stars! Waited 35 min for food, we walked out. The service was so so bad.  The salsa was horrible, tasted like a can of El Pato chile.  The waiter was perspiring and kept wiping his face with hands & touching everything! Disgusting! Hostess were high school rejects lacking customer service.  The restaurant is dark the ceilings are filthy.  We never got  passed the chips & salsa.  Thank God we walked out when we did! Will never return.  I give it 1 star for diet Pepsi. There is an abundance of excellent restaurants in area.

nDpRb7AjlF0TDVXpAQl84w.text: Tuyen... There's no words for this bartender, you need to experience it for yourself. All I can say is that she will be amazing, beautiful friendly and accommodating!!

NszcFK0T_L1FeTq4X4u6hA.text: Omg the chips. amazing. and now they serve AJs iced tea which is the best.  I usually go in just to hang out with one of the bartenders Lauren!! She always puts extra salt on my margaritas for me.  Overall, great place, fun atmosphere, really great and authentic mexican cuisine.

KRG5g9PzslxJETGwkVXh7Q.text: Great local place. I was staying with a friend right down the street so Aunt Chiladas became the "go to" place when we didn't want to drive anywhere.    I tried the chicken and spinach enchiladas as well as the seafood enchiladas on different visits.  The chicken and spinach enchiladas were bland but the seafood enchiladas were very good, containing shrimp and bay scallops. Each was accompanied by rice and beans, traditional although I thought that the beans had an overwhelming lard flavor.  The complimentary chips were good - including both flour and corn chips. The mild salsa was flavorful, with black olives in it...interesting.

lZ4E1SINpF9f96EzUNCq6g.text: I've had waaaay better Mexican. I grew up across the way from the barrios in Santa Ana so I know me some good Mexican.  Pros:  -Cute outdoor decor. That was it. -the cheese crisp was ok. -they had flour tortilla chips that were pretty tasty and a nice change from corn.  Cons:  -Food was not good. I can make better Mexican, and I'm Asian. -ceviche tasted like frozen shrimp mixed with salsa.  -drinks were watered down. I ordered a margarita and it came with a side tumbler so I was excited until I tasted it...watery.   Verdict:  Would not go again although it was fun following the chilies on the path back to my hotel.

gJ1KnxzpDi1V7c78fFiWBw.text: Stayed across the street and went for a quick dinner. I was with a large group and I tried to change their minds about going here based on the Yelp reviews. Service was very fast and the food was solid. When my travel takes me back to AZ (Next summer) I will most likely stop by again ...

a_tXjP5ihb_KARjeMULNNg.text: Myself & family had horrible experience at this establishment. Bad service's not enough waiter/waitress. The food is no where nearly as good as Tempe location. This place is mostly enjoyed by non-locals that don't know Mexican Food. The employees pay better attention to non-locals (folks that are staying at The Point). I rather go to Tempe location which is much better. Never coming back to this establishment. Not recommended.

9g4JVL8ymnYi8yZeE_gBrg.text: Eh. The food isn't so great here. I like the combo of corn and flour tortilla chips, but that's about it. It's a fun place, but I wouldn't ever choose to go here.

PhN1hMqMvpRvLIZfucaC2Q.text: I hadn't been here since the yelp event last year. The chips and salsa are to die for and it it took everything in me not to eat all of the, since I call myself being "good". I did order the shrimp tacos (sans the tortilla) which were delicious and the service was great. I will definitely come back again to see how things are during happy hour and heck just for the chips and salsa.

9FHqWNP78Em5lSr_Nl6w2A.text: I really want to like this place and continue to return time and time again year after year. The food is pretty bad- there I said it. The chips are great, the salsa is hit or miss.   Love their margaritas and the place has a great feel to it, but the staff is not trained too well. The exception to this are the owners and management. For some reason, they are great, yet the help doesn't seem to follow their lead.   I will continue to go back, because it is close to home, but this is far from a favorite of mine.

MNoUsYfS8m4ccJ58-fZSLA.text: The food here was very good. Something that myself and our entire group enjoyed were the complementary flour chips and salsa. We all agreed that it was some of the best we've ever had. The service was okay but we didn't see her very much and we felt pretty rushed to order. Overall we enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.

WGASxLmva_bNs9dQ9CXHIw.text: We came in to eat on a slower evening during the week.  Everything was great including the margaritas.  Looks like they have a really cool outside patio and told us that they have live music on the weekends.  Can't wait to visit then.

sFFGV8t7qmKyOtxbGrjjTQ.text: This place has the best patio. I love sitting outside at the bar having a drink. Definitely a good place to sit back and unwind after hiking.

KTOrcTcSMwmU-c3IrqeY3w.text: my friend and I went to dinner tonight and it was great; they had a live band in the bar, "The Real Thing", who were amazing; the reason for the one star was because of a waitress who ruined our night!  We were in the bar at least 20 minutes when we finally waived the waitress down (who passed by us at least six or seven times ignoring that we were even there), and ordered drinks. The waitress, Jessica, was totally rude and seemed to be irritated with us before we even ordered. She was obviously having a bad night and took it out on us.  What's happening to common courtesy and customer service?? Jessica shouldn't be in this position if she is going to have such a disrespectful attitude toward the general public, leave it at home...

CggcauyyJVifQh7U0szkGg.text: The food at Aunt Chilada's is always fresh and of good quality. The street tacos were delicious, and the guacamole is fantastic!   Our host, Mario Hernandez, was friendly, courteous, and professional. He seems to enjoy his job.  I hadn't been here in years, but I think I will be going back soon to try their weekend breakfast.

0TWMzuQimHjIl1rd7rzPSA.text: I went here for the Breakfast Club on Saturday morning and will have to say that the company was 5 stars, but the food and experience was more like a 3 star. We all sat out on the patio, which was nice. They gave us chips and salsa...the salsa was a little odd (had olives in it) and the hot salsa was not hot, tasted like slightly spiced tomato sauce or something. The chips were really good though, they were fried flour tortilla chips, not the typical corn. They also give you a free trip to the chocolate fountain, which was pretty good. The fruit was fresh and the chocolate was....chocolate...seriously, can't go wrong there. With breakfast, I got a mimosa which was only 3$, so that was pretty good. It was nothing special tasting, but it was cheap and alcohol. For breakfast I got the benedict with chicken. This is where they kind of went wrong. The chicken was dry and did not seem to be cooked fresh, or if it was, it was overcooked. The eggs were messy, the person poaching them let the whites go all over so it wasn't one cohesive egg and the eggs had slid off of the chicken by the time it got to me. The hollandaise was ok, but nothing special...it is supposed to be jalapeno hollandaise and just had maybe a slight spicy taste. The plate came with some dry looking beans that I did not eat and some potatoes that were nothing special. The BF got the pancakes, which were dry and tasted like they came from a package. I wouldn't say 'no' if I were invited back here, but I wouldn't come back here for breakfast on my own. I would like to come here for drinks one night as their patio is nice and they have a bocce ball court (which is awesome!), but I probably would pass on the food.

00tCncpy3Bw16t8VW2n7MA.text: The wait staff was very nice and the outdoor atmosphere was great but as for the food, I've had better Mexican in Indiana and North Carolina......and this is Phoenix,  for Christ's sake! I know, i live here. sizzle in the fajita. They served refried beans and rice a roni. Never had pasta in a Mexican restaurant. Did the run out of arroz.....real rice. Better Mexican at the Bell.

4-tv3T-C7D6Z8KltY563Xg.text: Loved this place! Flour tortilla chips to die for. Had shrimp tacos cooked to perfection.  My husband had sour cream enchiladas. Every thing was perfect!

fn22JgABybEMw7Zsmxs8kQ.text: My Hubby found this place doing a drive by for one of his work's properties (he works for Century 21) & thought we should try it out. We met there today for lunch & it was gorgeous out so we sat on the patio.    Our waitress was Chelsie & she was really sweet! We started off with the chips & salsa. So damn good, the best we've ever had for sure! We decided to get an appetizer, although I regret it now because the chips & salsa were an appetizer in itself! Any way, we got the standard cheese quesadilla with sour cream. It was ok, too greasy for us. For our meals, my Hubs ordered the chicken fajitas & I ordered the shrimp tacos. They offer fideo & beans for sides but it didn't sound appealing to us so we got rice instead. We were already stuffed from the chips & appetizer so we hardly ate our meals but the few bites we did have were yummy!  Overall we liked it here & will definitely be coming back! Maybe even for Cinco de Mayo which our waitress told us all about, sounds like a lot of fun. Either way, next time I come I am getting a margarita & dessert ;)

xrGjFi27b02Ekze1bKAAiA.text: I went to this place several times for drinks, lunch and happy hours and I think it is more for the atmosphere.  Their decor is fun and their Happy Hour is nice because they have a free chips / salsa bar available.    Last night, I ordered a Blue Moon I think it was 22oz for 6.50 and a Sour Cream Chicken Enchilada for about 6.95 (off of the a la carte menu)  and sat watching 2 baseball games with my hubby.  There were a few people at first around 5pm and the service was pretty fast, but as more and more groups started showing up the service was slower because it was just the two of us and the waitress had to deal with about 2 / 3 groups of 4 - 8.  I totally understand being busy, especially when our food came out fairly quick in the beginning, but the meal itself was ok.  I think it is a fun place to be and their chips and salsa are good, but for food I think you will just be stuck with an ok.

ljmD3Dt8jGbDnQmYDFavxg.text: I have been here twice before and enjoyed it and have even recommended it to friends.   I'm not sure what was going on today, but the food was bland and the service was so slow. I didn't pick up on this before, but the menu is way overpriced for the food you get. A boring bean burrito is 9 dollars! I have had better off the dollar menu at Taco Bell - I don't even like Taco Bell!  I won't be visiting this location again.

YpMrarOhK2e_OMSeXjc8ug.text: My favorite Mexican food. Love the chips--they make both flour and corn tortillas chips. I know the locals like margaritas on the rocks but this place has the worlds best frozen margaritas. My favorite entrees is the chicken chalupas, but the spinach enchiladas are also excellent. This is a family business and the food is the best. Also has a huge bar business, so the place gets super busy, but great food and great fun.

ra9yCzv1s6ntWfX-V_vHRg.text: Used to be a regular here. The past few visits I've noticed a decline in the service. Also noticed a change in the menu along with a price increase, however the quality hasn't improved. We waited over 15 mins for drinks then even longer for food and to receive bill. Overall wasted an hour just on wait time. Waiter wasn't tentative. Won't be returning. Love the owners is the only reason I gave them another chance.

HTOazUm9jY2vSLrUX3NQmA.text: We came here during spring break, so it was crowded and we waited about 1/2 an hour. We got seated and our orders were promptly taken. The staff is super nice! They were smiley and friendly. But our food was just okay.  My dad ordered a dish that was supposed to come with peppers and onions and a bunch of stuff (maybe a burrito or something, I can't remember). What he got was fine, but later that night he realized it definitely didn't include all that the menu had described.   I had a "special order", I asked for just tortillas on the side, and chicken and onions. When I got my food I had tomatoes mixed in with my chicken and onions... it wasn't a big deal, they were small pieces, but still... I thought it would be easy since I'd specified. Besides that though, my food was lukewarm and the foil-wrapped tortillas weren't even hot.   My mom's food just didn't show up at first. Apparently they had some issue in the kitchen or something... the waitress acted quickly and the food came a few minutes later, so the issue was resolved.   The best part of the meal, in my opinion, was the warm tortilla chips they serve. Chips and salsa, yum yum!   Overall though, the food was okay, some of it was warm, some of it wasn't... nothing special about it though. Just a good dinner. Average.

5OwPRAazC4REYMYzNzQyyg.text: We frequent the Phoenix area once or twice a year, and Aunt Chilada's is usually a stop for us.  We love sitting outside in the patio area. It used to be nicer, now they have a bocci ball court and the tables and chairs seem a bit worn. They immediately try to upsell you their premium margarita because it's a better deal, but in the end, it's expensive. I'm a $2.99 rita fan @ Via Delosantos or Mi Patio.  The food is quite good and of course, portions are huge. The only thing is they serve this weird pasta side dish instead of rice. Bizarre.  Always have good servers and everyone is friendly.

jP5k_0J6MfslgRx5y2fFiA.text: I went here for the yelp event and it was great! The venue was great and huge only problem was the parking. I love the name of this place! there was even the bar outside. I ate buffet style but there was so many chips. I would hold a big party group here and the name of this place is funny/amazing.

mDTxrmUHWQ4xb5LMvZu71w.text: The margaritas are wonderful as are the chips and salsa.  The rest of the food was okay, not great.  The service was wonderful.

20D9JvXpxM-NLOyPyD7Dvw.text: We have been here a few times and it's great food and lots of it! The atmosphere is funky and fun. Some of these reviews are negative regarding the food. I can't imagine what they had that they didn't like but I haven't had everything on the menu! Everything me and my friends have had has always been perfect.

8WT_HK4dGnH6YVQWHe1SDw.text: I am giving Aunt Chilada's a four because the service was outstanding and the chips and salsa were good.  Not sure of our server's name (table 35 or 36 last night) she was funny and excellent.   Even sang a little song about the food for us.  The food is average at best.  Nothing noteworthy, just standard food.  The drinks were good and they had live music playing which was nice.  It is a good place to drink but I would think twice about eating there again, unless I wanted an average tasting meal.

P1ZPqZpAqtY7P9ruwxWyMQ.text: Four stars for the service. But I did not like this place. The chips and salsa were awful I had the  steak burrito and everything on the plate was just blah. I would not go back. I do want to say tho my wife liked everything about this place ( but she is weird )

zwduOeNzP0holvBvEVf8rA.text: Friendly service but food was just ok. Maybe an off night.

V-IdYM9zFd3z04MXVryX2w.text: GREAT food... Everything we got was fresh and delicious. The patio area is really cute too! Outdoor bocce court in the front

dLBQe7g4qqGsAbLrEqr_8Q.text: The food was good. The chips and salsa were fantastic. The fountain out back was functioning but green with algae. The service was great. I will definitely be back when I can enjoy the patio bar.

lmrRzf5IjTDWdjKWiFpUwg.text: They've added a gluten free menu. I highly recommend the chicken avocado salad. The burritos are good, servings are huge. Great salsa too. Really nice servers. I've never had the brunch but it looks good on the menu.

M9oPgGuPglX_BaAoqFf_4g.text: Don't count on the bartenders acknowledging you unless you are sitting at the bar. I watched two seats at their bar remain dirty and empty for 20 minutes.  Like they are too good to clean it. They weren't even that busy.

R7bl5tmjYYKGkNlXwLpBiw.text: Forgive me Aunt Chiladas! I`m so ashamed to admit that I live in your neighborhood, have been coming here forever and just now writing a review! Better late than never! Ok what I like about this place: Best Happy Hour around- drink specials and free buffet! On Fridays they have live music and it gets packed. On beautiful weather the patio areas are great to be hanging out! Sundays- awesome brunch with a chocolate fountain. Margaritas- frozen, on the rocks, top shelf, etc- love them here! Chips and salsa- love the flaky, crispy chips here! Not a real fan of the chunky salsa( I like mine hot!) but you get two kinds- the chunky and a red mole style which is spicer so me likey! Grreat  place for groups!!! And the patio is dog friendly! For Cinco De Mayo- come here! All day live music fest!! ps, the inside is more intimate for dinner, I am a fan of the sour cream and chicken enchiladas! I love coming here!!

A0qYHxNa3HiT3hlYlojmmQ.text: Okay so we had an awesome Yelp event here tonight! I thought the service was superb! I thought the drinks were great! I thought the party favors were a hit! Just a note on the food... it was buffet style & I enjoyed all of it! I especially loved the corn tamales... they were spectacular! Cheesy, Creamy, and Corny.... just like me! LOL =) I loved the atmosphere... there was a lot of old town feel & history here! You should stop by & pay a visit. Nice going Aunt Chilada's, you know how to throw a party... real live donkey & all!

ln2qBR8A1UgOWtW3U2psbg.text: Went to try this place out since a friend recommended this place.   Awesome atmosphere and great service.   The chips and salsa were so good.  Don't do what I did and filled up on the chips and salsa and didn't have room for the main course.  I think we went through te full baskets of chips and forgot about the real food.  Had the fajita which was HUUUUUGE.  It was enough to feed the Hulk.  Since I filled up on the chips I only ate about 1/4 of it.   Also ordered the combo siete.  The tamale was okay, not to my taste, but the taco and enchilada made up for it.    We'll be coming back here when we are craving mexican food that's for sure.

517OYCVI9A5bbvupTO-57w.text: This is my favorite Mexican Restaurant in Phoenix,Arizona.The service here is fantastic and the food here is delicious

nW0a0_UTcLaS6W7-5wav3g.text: Great people, great food, great service!!!! Highly recommend! The food was absolutely amazing and the margaritas were to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We love this place! Great food, great service! Tiffany is the best! Ask for her :)

MM8y_fovBBagSytIkltNmA.text: Thank you for all you did in helping us celebrate our mothers life here. We couldn't have asked for a better staff, location and food. They were very compassionate and kind and helped make a difficult day run smooth! From the bottom of my heart I want to thank you all.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DOXa0AwZ5gIj0yzFGTEHIg.text: Perfect day to sit on the patio with friends. Food is always delicious. Ask for Patrick as your waiter. He will amaze you!

6tJZM5B11bFZGsELyMDRXg.text: Loved it! Amazing food. Great service. Great atmosphere! The fish tacos were banging.

0iN1qRI2MRrtze9lSG0mPA.text: Local friends brought us by after a long trip- perfect spot to recharge and fuel up in the desert.  Cool atmosphere, relaxed and comfortable.  Lots of families here for Sunday evening dinner.  Our waitstaff was fantastic!  Quick service, no empty glasses or chip bowls - and they kept the salsa coming too.  Two words: questo fundido Get some.  Now!

Ijn7ts_tyFiRV7saL0cNuA.text: Had our company Christmas party here and it was a great venue. The bartender and staff were nothing short of amazing. The food was delicious! Overall, a great experience and the place was perfect for a company party. Kudos Aunt Chilada!!

cVUw9fFFbE19dokGSsH5Hg.text: We had a really good time here. It was an easy walk from the resort over to the restaurant. It was about 9 o clock when we got there and the place was packed and music was loud, not too loud but enough to set the vibe. Luckily the place is huge do we were still able to get seated right away. Service was good and consistent and the food was delicious. My wife had street tacos and I did a shredded beef chimi w/ red sauce. I would recommend both. They had plenty of beer options to choose from from and a solid Margarita. They have a lot of Tequila options so of course we took a few shots as well. Had a great bar tender who comped a few shots for us to try out as well. Good night and good food. Worth a shot wether your at the resort or not.

97EdWXJQHDpiHufNZLdKXg.text: I have always loved this place. This time was the worst experience here, or anywhere I've been in a very long time. I came in to order a quick bite. I sat down and for 30 minutes not one person came to my table. Not for drinks, food order or anything. Finally when someone came to my table, I explained how I sat for 30 minutes. Sheepishly, he apologized. I had to leave. No time for food. He offered me a to-go water. No manager came to apologize. This was NOT a busy day/time. I will NOT return. BUMMER

kOkjX9hHyiPsBsEzR8qMzg.text: I would give zero stars if this was an option. The server was ok until the bill I was talking to my girl sharing a romantic moment and the rude waitress was like hurrying us up to pay our bill. Then the manager had the nerve to ask why I didn't leave a tip. Here's a tip, train your waitresses not to be so damn rude and I'll leave a tip next time!

5gxYaHhaxosPXz1L7cyEkQ.text: Great service, great margaritas but so-so food. Don't get the street tacos. The meat tasted like canned/processed meat.

dDreIS3ODuDX1VzLRm6Tvw.text: This is a great neighborhood Mexican restaurant. It has the coolest patio with lots of plants, Bocci ball and tons of outdoor seating, plus it is dog friendly. They have food for free at happy hour and all sorts of interesting margarita options... My favorite is mango. Of course, it is also a restaurant and not just a bar.   I have to admit that the food is not the best Mexican food out there. Some of it is pretty good though. I like their fajitas, beef chingalingas, shrimp tacos and green corn tamales. Their real claim to fame is their chips. They bring a huge basket of both corn and flour chips... The flour chips are not like any other chips I've had anywhere else--they are thick and soft and crisp all at the same time... their mild chunky salsa is also really good.  But, I have been thoroughly repulsed by their fish tacos which were soft and squishy and weird.   Overall, I like it here and come back often, though  now that I have found items I like, I rarely try new things.   This is the place to be on a Friday night and I highly suggest you come for happy hour.

fdcPZgqV8QYMPQUOcNglLg.text: We were cautious given the lower rating with good reason.  Environment great.  Food spotty.  My meal was dead cold and waitress did not come back for 15 minutes.  When we ordered two sauces they showed up after we finished AND they had the courage to charge $2.50 a piece.  Not sure if I was supposed to eat them with a spoon.    Chips and salsa not good.   I think they get business from the large hotel but repeat customers might be hard to come by.    Many choices for better Mexican.

KtRdXKySunRuuzACs9N-qw.text: I had my wedding reception here last April 7,  2018. The Banquetta hall is an absolutely beautiful place to hold your small & intimate event or gathering. The food was great, the staff were helpful & even the space was perfect for our 35 guests. Our families & friends can't stop talking about how wonderful the place is, they were really impressed. Me & my husband would like to thank Michelle for being so helpful & friendly. She was able to get us in with only a month's of notice. She made our wedding reception as easy & simple as possible & she was always available for any questions & concerns. And for the 2 bartenders, sorry I didn't get your names guys but just wanted to extend our thank you, you were fast & very much attentive. Overall, I love the place, great atmosphere & definitely will come back for more. To anyone looking for a unique mexican restaurant Aunt Chilada's Sqaw Peak is highly recommended.. Good job everyone! kudos!!!

Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
