Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Open mic on Thursdays

VsdVx-G6TkbhNsvU0uVVng.text: we got here right at opening. sticky table. broken table..the rounded edges were resting on my lap as opposed to being tucked up. (one of the staff said all the tables are like that then sat us at an operational table that was teetering obscenely) mimosa was maybe 3 Oz of OJ with a blip of champagne. the tequila sunrise......no...just. no. nooooooo. I asked for a side of avocado and they gave me hard slices of non ripe avocado.  they serve shots of water.  the chips and salsa were ok. the beans were good.  place was cute food mediocre  staff....they are apathetic.  if you work here you must have no passion for your job......  the restaurant fountains are dirty...no one knows what shock is I guess.  and this green dirty water is accessible to kids and close to people's tables.  will I come back? Hell to the N. O.

04uv25UpWVKfZGs3qMsY9g.text: This place has changed a lot!  The addition of the outside, tiki-esque bar and boche ball give this place a much more relaxed feel.  I came here for my very last Breakfast Club UYE. We came specifically because the chocolate fountain is included w/ brunch. Quite honestly, I couldve done w/out it. A bit too sweet, but the fruit was good.  Our large group was seated on the patio, thankfully, while the patio weather was still bareable. Our waitress was a bit slow, which was puzzling considering we were one of 3 tables in the entire place. She did a good job keeping all of our checks straight though.  They have a good number of selections on their brunch menu. I chose the Mexican eggs benedict over the traditional. This one comes w/ chicken instead of Canadian bacon. It was really good, though Id go for the traditional next time due to the dryness of the chicken. The hollendaise was seasoned nicely though, and the eggs poached perfectly.  Id definitely recommend this for a brunch spot, especially if you have a major sweet tooth.

mr-d5AO1ALl1Yd2SkF90bA.text: Came here on a Friday night with a group of 4. We called at about 5:30 and were thankfully able to make a reservation at 7. We were staying at the Hilton down the street and when we arrived, we were quickly seated.  Service was prompt and quite friendly. Our drink order was taken almost too quickly has half of the table hadn't looked at the menu yet. I tried a lucky (something?) margarita and it was delicious ($7.50). I had to be sure to stir it often though as the agave syrup would settle. Beer was served nice and cold and my Mom enjoyed a (tiny) mimosa. It was disappointing to hear that all of their margarita flavours were syrups vs real juice, especially as an entire page of the drink menu is marg options.  Food wise, my dad and I each enjoyed the combo fajitas (steak and chicken) and my mom and husband had combo plates. Portion sizes are definitely ample as none of us managed to finish and we definitely didn't leave hungry. Meat portions on the fajitas were very tiny, as I was down to onions and peppers after my second tortilla. I enjoyed the fideo pasta vs traditional rice, though consistently have an issue with mixed peas and carrots being added. They overcook and shrivel to sad little rocks.  Overall, we enjoyed our meals. Not sure that we would rush back for food, but the outdoor patio definitely looks like a nice place for drinks on a hot day.

hc42-dy_zZjsho5WruOkqg.text: If you love good old chips and salsa to start off your meal, you will be in absolute heaven.  I am not usually a big fan of fried stuff, but they have a crisp fluffy taste like the bottom of a tostada as their main chips selection.  I felt like I can almost eat a basketful!  I ordered chicken fajitas.  I have had better seasoned fajitas, but it came with a lot of good salsa and guac to enhance some lack of flavor.    The overall ambiance is excellent here because you feel you are in a "casa" than more of a restaurant.

1WjfV9RO-UdcvXfpi8pYEA.text: Have never been disappointed here.  The chips and salsa are really good.  They mix home made and regular chips.  The salsa is really good and my daughter swipes all the black olives before anyone else.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZSyadVuRbCM80pYaBDc9fg.text: The food gets 3 1/2 stars, the service gets 2, so I am going to give an overall 3 rating.    I had not been to Aunt Chilada's in years and we randomly were thinking of places to eat in that area and thought why not?! I remembered the house made tortilla chips being the best ever (and they still are, and they still put regular ones underneath).    We ordered our drinks right away (a 22 oz beer and a margarita).  It was at least 10 to 15 minutes before we got them.  One guy was actually getting up from his table and just getting their drinks from the bar (it was not very busy, it was about 2 in the afternoon, so the lunch rush was over). When the drinks came, the beer was only a 16 oz, but who cares at that point, we were just happy to have drinks.    When we ordered lunch, I asked for a high chair for our son who was still in his stroller so he could eat as well.  They never brought the highchair and with the other things already done wrong, I just let it go, he was able to eat his quesadilla just fine (that they also charged us the full price for, not the children's - and again for $1 difference it wasn't worth the wait I knew we would have to mention it).  I ordered 2 stuffed poblano peppers.  I was served one. It was however, delicious and plenty big enough that I still brought some of it home.    My boyfriend just ordered a carne asada burrito, which came out fine, it was nothing spectacular, but decent.  As mentioned, my poblano was very tasty and a good sized portion.    We waited for the bill for quite some time as well.    So overall, the food was exactly what I remembered, tasty and a good variety.  But the service was terribly slow.  We'll go back when we can just sit at the bar, it seemed a better spot to be and much faster.  I enjoy a lazy lunch at times, but the long waits and errors for a simple lunch for two was terrible.

wGoHLs9OdhfAk3vaYAXNXg.text: Came here for a wedding. Parking was adequate though I kind of thought there would be more space given the size of the venue.   Service was good. My friends who were getting married got a nice mexican buffet set up with a open bar. As you would've figured, we all got wasted and ate a bunch of food which was pretty delicious. The decor was pretty nice but unfortunately it got a little dirty since the only time the marrying couple had was during the summer to get married and it turned out that it was going to sprinkle a little bit preceeding a heavy dust storm. Dust got everywhere since it was an outside venue and since it's Phoenix during the summer, you can imagine the heat though since it was afternoon, it wasn't entirely as bad as if it were during noonish.   The wedding procession was really nice. I arrived fashionably late but just in time for bar open and proceeded to drink heavily. They had rented the venue until about close time and before kitchen closed, I was hungry again because I'm a fat ass and ordered another enchilada meal which came with rice and beans. It was pretty delicious. Pricing was decent.   All in all, a good time. Outside of the venue area, in the bar and band area, people were drinking and listening to live music. I guess this place gets pretty packed with people during the weekend.

AKKJxLQP0NcmN8OQC8fUtg.text: ***  IT DOESN'T EVEN DESERVE 1 STAR****  Dirty outside chairs, everything is sticky, light bulbs haven't been changed in years.  The place sucks.  Cheap food, cheap service.  I wish I took a picture or the corn tortilla chip that they served us with 2 mold spore colonies living on it.  UTTERLY DISGUSTING !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Thanks Manager for comping nothing at all and not even being apologetic about it. HORRIBLE RESTAURANT MANAGER.  THAT's why you're getting this horrible review.  OH NOT TO MENTION THAT I HAD EXPLOSIVE DIAHRREA (no joke) FOR 3 DAYS People throwing up exerywhere, hell on earth  FOOD POISONING !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!     YOU ARE SOOOOOOO LUCKY I AM NOT SUING YOU JOKES FOR A RESTAURANT - GOD YOU GUYS SUCK  VERY Unprofessional.  A joke for a Mexican restaurant considering Chicago has 100 Mexican restaurants 1000 times better then you.  The bartender was a bitch too with attitude.  DO NOT WASTE A SINGLE PENNY ON THIS CRAPPY RESTAURANT - DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY  Quality has gone down the tubes  DO NOT EVER EVER COME HERE - GO TO A GOOD RESTAURANT

Ge4PY6WyGhx88Matsa-R4A.text: 1. They may be open until 2am, but they don't serve food after 10:00 PM.  It would be nice if this were listed somewhere on Aunt Chilada's website.   2.  Who puts black olives in their salsa? Maybe this is some sort of Tex-mex thing. But as a native southern Californian in love with Mexican food, I have never experienced such a thing.  3.  The fideo was super soggy.  4. My family went for lunch on a weekday.  There was some sort of work banquet going on in a back room.  There were possibly two or three other families eating in the other main rooms.  Our server seemed to be working hard..every time we saw her.  Unfortunately, there were times that she disappeared for way too long.    5. Half of the orders placed had something wrong with them.  I ordered black beans and was given refried.  Every family member with a chicken dish complained that the chicken was drier than wood.  My sister ordered a salad with chicken and received one meat-free. We didn't ask for corrections, because considering how long it took for us to get any food, we would have had to wait to dinner to receive the corrected meal items.  6. The wood bench, manikin and old blanket in the entry way sorta smells like musty cat urine.  I think it is long overdue for a cleaning.  7.  I have been to this restaurant many times over the years. I was sad that this last experience was so marginal. Overall, the food was okay--worthy of three stars. The prices and quantities were good.  But the inaccurate orders and the lacking service (which I think comes from being understaffed instead of bad skills) drop this place down to a two.  I will update my review when/if I ever return.  Until then--go only if convenience dictates that this is the best place for you (you are staying at the Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak resort without a car), and go with the expectation that you will be there for a long time.

XPa1u7yai7iFkTywyYr-1Q.text: Amazing venue for our wedding!  Michelle who does their events was absolutely wonderful!  She radiates kindness, honesty and integrity!  Their staff take pride in what they do and made our day perfect! All of our guest said they had never had such good food at a wedding before and were impressed worth the staff and venue as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eqhcVfhUi0H4j9rCZ0IRDw.text: We were visiting Phoenix on vacation and decided to check this restaurant out for a late dinner. The location is great, it's very close to the Arizona Grand Resort. The ambiance of the restaurant is very lovely and not too fancy. We went around 8:30 and string lights were hung outside giving the restaurant a classy look. When we got to the hostess she said it was going to be a 30 minute wait, but we only waited about 5 minutes! Chips and salsa, along with the menus, were handed out very quick. Our waitress was very polite and kind! She said if we didn't like something, we could return it for something else (wow)!!! Being from Texas, NOTHING beats Tex Mex so this place was more of a miss for me. I ordered chicken tacos, and they were not bad! The beans and rice had a wonderful spice to them. I would recommend this to anyone in the area for a quick, but nice meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tacos with rice and beans that I ordered. Very good!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. beautiful carpet on the ceiling!

FxdDJsjWyN0CAhGYEfmmIg.text: This is a place where we end up coming when we cannot think of anywhere else... Carlos was our server this time and he took good care of us. Hubby recently found the jalapeno fajitas and they are tasty and spicy, I had the carnitas fajitas, which are a really good meat meal, but very far from what I consider 'carnitas'.

93X7JwQvttNx2v5LwYh3Bw.text: What a great place to be! Everyone here treats you like family. The food is INCREDIBLE. I recommend the pineapple shrimp. JD and Tiffany and wonderful people who don't care about making money, but about building a family.

U5WhwchsMAaBCviaxGHt-A.text: Every time I have come to Aunt Chilada's I've had a great time along with some delicious Mexican food. I've tried their fajitas, enchiladas, quesadilla, torta, taquitos, and even the fired ice cream (don't typically get dessert at Mexican restaurants) and all have been very good. For what it's worth, I once went with a friend who doesn't like Mexican and she said Aunt Chilada's had one of the best burgers she's ever had. I can't vouch for that though. I recently tried the El Pollo Fundito and it was awesome. Probably about 2000 calories, but awesome.  This place is huge! Lots of indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor patio is my favorite on a beautiful spring evening. Great happy hour. A perfect place for group events. Live music on Friday nights. Trivia on Wednesday nights. Bocce Ball outside. Friendly staff each and every visit. Nice view of Piestewa Peak!  I really don't get some of the negative reviews of this place. Each of my dozen or so visits to Aunt Chilada's have been very positive and I will continue to return.

BHhXBob3fyKNLd_zTTs8ug.text: For me, the food is more important than the service so the unfriendly staff has never bothered me. I've been going here about once every two-three weeks for two years. The food is always fantastic so they deserve a high rating!  Food: The food at Auntchiladas is close to authentic, but that isn't necessarily their goal. They serve a variety of dishes, like the chipotle chicken and the fish tacos, that are somewhat Americanized but are still very good. The el pollo fundido and chipotle chicken are my favorite dishes. The beans aren't loaded with lard so they are not very fattening and the rice is excellent. I order queso or abondigas soup for an appetizer. The free chips and salsa are great!  Service:  This is where Auntchiladas loses many of their customers. To be fair, we have had some fantastic servers, but the majority of servers have been rather unfriendly. The food comes quickly, but don't expect to have time to fully enjoy it. If the restaurant is packed, the waiter will rush your meal by continuously trying to take your plate. The female servers are often dressed to attract attention. We have been at the restaurant on afternoons where all of the women were dressed in bikini tops! This destroys any attempt at a family atmosphere.

rgtuDvuZOtRtFMAcFlqR9w.text: Good food. Relaxed atmosphere. Good drinks. Not much more required. The tables wobble a bit from the uneven tile floor. So there's that.....  Chips and salsa

OWPBWk6lp-DhCbX9-VsNUA.text: We were at the Hilton just down the street for Mother's Day weekend.  We enjoyed dinner here so much on Saturday night that we went the next day for mother's day brunch!  The food, service and atmosphere were all on point.  Tiffany helped us so much by moving our table to a shadier spot for brunch.  Just a small thing, but greatly appreciated! We were especially impressed by their head chef proudly carving the prime rib and pork loin for brunch.  He was super  nice!  Thank you for helping us have an amazing mother's day weekend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mother&#39;s Day Brunch!

kfZpLHE84KsI-FxsCU-1rg.text: My business requires me to travel very frequently. I always try to find local establishments in the cities I visit that have the best food, atmosphere, and staff. Aunt Chilada's is, by far, one of the most amazing places that I have had the pleasure to visit. The food is excellent, of course. - starting with the house made flour tortilla chips! But, the staff here sets the bar high above any other place in AZ. I highly, highly recommend stopping in for dinner and then an evening on the patio.  Shout out to Sarah, Kimmie, Jenny, and Tina! These ladies are the best. Thank you so much for everything!   Yelp needs to add more stars for this place! It's at least an 11.

G7MeM1WOpyZYf3GhHoziwg.text: Attitude from the hostess Olives in the salsa Drinks not refilled! Food took 30 minutes to come out on a slow night. Server neglected us the entire time We asked for the manager.. after waiting 10 minutes we decided to just pay and leave Another 10 minutes for our check to come back. Still, manager never showed up  I'll never go back again.

AS0ZitZsIDRXOOSmxjyAIQ.text: I am a bit of a Mexican food snob and haven't found many places in the valley I enjoy. This places threw that notion out the window! I ordered a combo plate with 3 items. The options included taco (huge in a fried shell), enchilada, tamale, tostada and chile relleno. I was thrilled to find out the rellenos were made with poblano peppers, not the much milder varieties that tend to be used in Arizona. The choice of fillings for the other items was vast and included picadillo and machaca which aren't always an option. We can't wait to return.

fWPVdBTQyrybirHI5HAzCg.text: Used to come for epic happy hours in the 1990's. No such thing anymore. I had excellent service and the location and ambiance are fine. Some menu items are great but skip the fish tacos. Mushy soggy .  I ordered a glass of wine only to find out later it wasn't on happy hour.  Would have been less stars if not for my very cheerful server Maggie. I would literally ask for her!

KBJua8gITrSM348MuOp0EA.text: Some of the best tamales ever! And they are huge and flavorful. The rice ehhhh kinda reminded me of rice a roni. This place is much more then just a restaurant they have music, pizza nite and all sorts of events.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummm!

X50YoemHvsE3T-X9s3q7YA.text: I came in a few weeks ago and I can't express how pleased I was with the service. I believe her name was Midia. She not only was attentive. She was extremely patient with us because my friend couldn't make up his mind on what to eat and constantly changing his mind (he was drunk). The food was fantastic and would highly recommend it.

YSlnGbn004Lgpm8lRjd4Ow.text: Came to lunch for my sisters birthday once in the afternoon which was April 27 the waitress service was terrible oh yeah she says I didn't know you ordered an iced tea refill their iced tea from a cup that was already filled w Ice-T from someone else's tray it took 25 minutes for them to get our meal which consisted of two tortilla soup's side salad and one hot plate of chili Riano when asked why it was taking so long the server mention oh we're just really busy and backed up in the kitchen and left when we ate the soup the soup was warm and kind on the cool side not even hot enough to melt the cheese never saw our waitress late for a while until we asked to talk to her and later complaints out she's like well I will get the manager and the manager never showed up and she comped our meal butBut I would rather have better service than a free meal very sad for this place. They tried to compensate the lunch with a free cake unfortunately The cake appeared to be swapped into the container which we excepted and threw in the trash once we stepped outside of the restaurant. I would not recommend this restaurant to save myself from any embarrassment.

X0Eo53HpTjd4dPCPN0pu2Q.text: Delicious food-I enjoyed my seafood enchiladas, shared dulce de leche cake, and the chips to start. The chips were homemade and they had both corn and flour, though I was partial to flour. Service was good as was the fun atmosphere. This is also a great place for kids-They give out balloons AND there is a treasure chest with toys like the ones they have at pediatrician's offices. I'd go again.

sMLhDPsQUVkHTpr3TOBusw.text: Really good authentic Mexican food. One of many bright spots on my Phoenix trip. Would have given five stars but service at bar wasn't the best I've ever seen. I will make it a point to return each time I'm in Phoenix. Thanks

DNEkZiGHtvqxZTySRJ4B4Q.text: Great service and attentive staff, pleasant experience all around!  Planned our next event with their coordinator, Michelle, and can't wait to share the food and service with friends and family

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0aDyDaH_xTvUxvScSG4WkA.text: This was a lovely place to eat.  Tucked into a residential looking area, but super nice. My friend had her daughters baby shower there and it was beautiful, they did a lovely job and it was very personal.

BrAOYMlXshRwkLF4fqxTdQ.text: Saturday so I expected it to be pretty busy but this place was SLAMMED. Our waitress seemed stressed and you could tell.   I was in the mood for some good chips and salsa.. the chips were pretty good because they were made in house but the salsa in my opinion was super watery and had too big of chunks of tomato in it.   The best part about the place was the beerita, but other than that I probably wouldn't go back for the food. For a Mexican restaurant I felt like the menu was limited.

zi4rQ5CPNrkK4170IXVGWw.text: Very disappointed. Service very slow. We saw our waitress once after ordering food and that was after we requested to talk to her 20 min later.   Soup was Luke warm.  Needed refill for my tea the waitress refilled it with a glass of tea she had extra from another table half for me and the other half of the glass for my sister, I have never seen that happen ever I don't think that is server ettiquette.  Food not good. Would not go back ever.

1VTH7h3-eE0NpI5hVOaUlQ.text: This is my favorite restaurant to visit whenever I'm in Phoenix! I've come here several times over the years and it is comforting to come back to consistently great experiences. The vibe and decor of the restaurant is what really makes this place memorable. I adore the outside patio and the bocce court! The chips and salsa are absolutely addictive and the drinks are prepared to perfection. I've never had a dish I didn't like, all of the ingredients are fresh and flavorful. I've had consistently wonderful service, they've always seemed to have a great staff on board. I can't wait for my next trip to Arizona to go back!

CJDY5Qf1-mag-WDcxn0YSg.text: This is my very favorite Mexican restaurant. The food is delicious, service extraordinary, and beyond great. I have only been there once but was so pleasantly surprised. I had their chicken enchilada and it was more than I could eat for lunch. Hope to return soon.

0kH_wvo_8cHa4pFtJ6siMw.text: This place is in the middle of a residential area. The food was fantastic. I had the enchiladas and they were so good. I love the flour tortilla chips. I asked for the hot sauce and the waiter brought out an ample amount. The ambiance was nice. Nicely decorated and appropriate lighting. Everyone had a great time. If your in northwest Phoenix this place is a must

XcxLmqsPclpHkhqbxyV2yw.text: I love the atmosphere, the live music, drink specials & esp the homemade tortilla chips!!!

ENcGn1ACuzXdc2qj86tHng.text: The staff here was amazing! Incredibly welcoming and accommodating. They pulled together a birthday dessert for my husband complete with singing in little more than an hour's notice. My husband, a beer drinker, raved about the margaritas--smooth, sweet and salty. Great atmosphere--we sat outside--and the guacamole was fantastic.

wSPF25jC4NVi4edviN8BNw.text: Best chips EVER!   When I am craving chips, salsa, and a delicious burrito this is where I come! The service is attentive and the food is great.   The atmosphere is so fun and there is always something exciting going on here. Whether it's bocce ball, a band playing, games on tv, trivia night, or a special event there is always entertainment. They have a beautiful patio as well as an inside bar area and a large dining room, so it's always easy to find a spot.   This is a fantastic place to bring a date, a friend, the family, or just go solo.

qXJm174B6m2MzsxpHjbXgg.text: We love this place but our food and service was mediocre tonight at best!! We got the chicken and steak fajitas and the meat was barely warm and the fixings were not warm at all.  They tasted good but would've been much better hot!! Hopefully next time it will be better!!

dd504vKkI-Og1z0hT1zQSQ.text: I have heard of this restaurant for years but this was my first visit. Beautiful outdoor setting reminiscent of cafes in Mexico. Salsa and chips were delicious and abundant.  We were there for breakfast. Food was very disappointing. My over easy ordered eggs were scrambled, my ordered crisp bacon had barely seen a flame, and my English muffin was without butter.  It was not busy yet nothing arrived at our table warmer than room temperature. Cold potatoes and refried beans do not make breakfast special. Nothing rose above the level of bland.  Hope to try it again, perhaps lunch or dinner in hopes that it is more of their expertise and/or they have chef that is more experienced and/or is committed to tasty, hot, decent food.

U8d6Kny19SujU0aa8tuBuA.text: Never had a bad meal here.  The portions are large, the food is of high quality and the prices are reasonable.  It's one of the few Mexican restaurants to offer fideo (spaghetti Mexican style) as a side, and it's pretty good.  I highly recommend their delicious burros.

YbiA8-j7mOi7sLWQ-sVeeA.text: Lunch was fabulous. Homemade chips and salsa. Chicken and spinach enchilada. Couldn't ask for better flavors. I'll be back for dinner soon.

IeS5RPyEBzM7-0yXZMfP9Q.text: This restaurant was very old and dirty. The booth we sat at was filthy and you could feel the stickiness on the floor.   The chips were flour and corn. I couldn't eat the flour because they were so greasy.   The salsa had no flavor and contained black olives. Who puts black olives in salsa?  I ordered the shrimp tacos and they contained barely any shrimp but so much cheese. Also disappointed that they were in a flour tortilla instead of corn.

JfRwz9B1M7iM1S7zJ1iYdA.text: How is an establishment going to be so uncoordinated and inconsistent? One manager didn't have a problem with someone of the age of 20 sitting at the bar. Another manager said the age was 19 to sit at the bar. And then another manager argued that it was the Arizona Law that someone under 21 couldn't sit at the bar. Please tell me why I can pull up the Arizona Liquor Law and it states "An underage person can be in a bar if accompanied by a spouse, parent, or legal guardian of legal drinking age, or is an on-duty employee of the business. The underage person can't drink any alcoholic beverages." I'm his spouse, and I'm 21 years of age. And of course, it's at a business' discretion, but if there is no sign stating that a person under the age of 21 cannot sit at the bar and 3 managers all have a different opinion on it? What is there to do?

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

UTdobJmj2af4L05_Oq8gHA.text: Oh Aunt Chiladas, a True Central Phoenix classic! We came here with some friends who were having a staycation at the Pointe Squaw Peak and had a fantastic evening! We were actually able to sit on the patio in August due to their misters, we had great service, delicious margaritas, and food!   I went to order a house margarita but our waitress told me that the margarita shaker for $12 was actually better quality and you get two margaritas out of it (ends up being the same price as two house margs). SOLD! She was right, it was fantastic.   I love love their chips & salsa here. I always seem to eat too many before my meal comes! For my entree, my fiance and I split the chicken + steak fajitas that come on a sizzling skillet with tortillas, guac, sour cream, rice, and beans on the side. The marinade was delicious! It is a great dish for 2. I also ordered a house salad on the side.   All in all, we had a great experience here and would absolutely come back! They have a great Happy Hour and themed nights during the weekdays as well so be sure to check out their website for more info. It is also GREAT for groups!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House salad and it was massive!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak + Chicken fajitas...so yum!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fajita fixins&#39;

bcixFfce7epwprf1m1-Y-Q.text: Food mediocre at best. Worst service I have had in a long while. Drinks not as ordered. Had to get up and ask for water refills several times. Was going to leave a cash tip until the server Cali shot me extremely dirty looks for not putting tip on card. Would never recommend this place.

HqieFhP-nTxPud39C7eyiA.text: This place always delivers-good food, drinks and service. Sara the bartender was amazing with fast and friendly service.   A must see for everyone from in town or visiting...

pH_873SFUjebjuEWEoW1tQ.text: Service from Sara the bartender was fantastic.  Nice outdoor space and large beers!

DCitjUwyYUrUvLqiykr1gA.text: We had family in from England of which our entire family had never met. Aunt Chiladas...PATRICK! I don't have a last name but PATRICK, made this outing extraordinary! I will forever be a fan of Aunt Chiladas because of Patrick outstanding service. I rate Aunt Chiladas a 5 out of 5 and Patrick gets a 10 out of 5. Thank you again Patrick for taking care of our newly found family across the pond.

_MzpXrY5V-kcgUzVT6xEjQ.text: It's usually a red flag for me when i order dinner and it comes out in less than 5 minutes. Food must be made ready and just heated up when ordered I guess. Tortilla soup however was good, service was ok as well.

fWA22HzEjtMtW4pJ6-RVUQ.text: Mexican eggs Benedict! Must try. Their chorizo is nice and crispy. Eggs cooked perfectly poached. Nice relaxing Sunday. The staff was very accommodating with our needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3sARqW7xPfLo8xoBw8pPhw.text: Came here on business visit and we went there for team lunch. Loved it totally. Very good food. I had shrimp enchilada with rice and beans and pina colada. Everything was great and best pat was the patio seating like eating in a garden.

Ko6y7Bbmy3sutEVX08oPpQ.text: The food was wonderful and very large portions. The only problem we had was our waiter was given a large group after us so his service was devoted to them and our service declined a lot.

n_mFpaxXazeiebH4W2rpYA.text: Wonderful food, setting and atmosphere.  The real gem of this place is Patrick; phenomenal server extraordinare!!! He made our meal memorable.

jdf4Waa21-dzXJGNhnD7RQ.text: We celebrated my principal and school secretary's retirement party here. We had over 100 people and rented out the entire patio which was very nice. The servers were attentive. The cash bar was quick easy and inexpensive.the food was okay for a large buffet type of thing. I bet the food normal served inside is much better. However, they did an excellent job with a large crowd and would recommend them for that.

ZNaLIHvmPCUIB0OOILtTMw.text: I like Aunt Chiladas because it's really close to home and it's a cute little joint, but the food is average and the service is below average. Now, I have only been here when it's been quite busy. I came here once on a Friday night, and I've been here twice for trivia night on Wednesdays. Today's review is specifically about trivia night.  I suck at trivia. Seriously, I'm terrible, but I go to surround myself with my awesome friends, who also suck at trivia -- just not as much! Ordering food during trivia night takes FOREVER. And the room that trivia takes place is in tiny, almost as tiny as the tables. It's really hard to eat, especially if you're with a group larger than 3. It's also quite loud. I was sitting right next to the trivia host tonight and could barely hear him.   The menu has plenty to choose from, but I haven't ever truly enjoyed any of the dishes I've gotten here. It's not bad, but it's also not good. I will say that their tortilla chips are great though. The salsa... not so much.  I'd probably come here for the drinks, but not the food. And I'd recommend sitting outside when it cools down. Their patio is quite lovely!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor bar.
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor seating.

07Y1cz_ts0BM4GF9wL_aug.text: We were in town for a graduation and happened to drive past this fun little restaurant.  We called for a reservation and walked across from the hotel where we were staying.    It was so yummy!  The chips (a basket of flour and a basket of corn) were delicious as was the salsa, the entrees and the margaritas!  We even played bocce ball (I think that's what it was!) out on the patio afterwards.  We had a great time and the graduation dinner was a success :)  Will definitely go again the next time we are in town

f1mnzZKhUxsr0ag9CzReRA.text: My experience at Aunt Chiladas was weird to say the least. Food is fine and the service is fine. Maybe we caught them on a bad night?  I wish we were able to sit on the patio because it looked fun out there!   Note that they don't serve rice on the side here, they serve like Rice-A-Roni which REALLY caught us off guard. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't good. We mostly just weren't expecting it.   Overall, I had fun with the group I was with, but it was mainly in part of us laughing about how strange our experience at Aunt Chiladas was!

3MaergLzMzmh9N4_ZdCb8A.text: I ordered the Machaca taquitos and they were very hard to chew with a lack of flavor. The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because it was cinco de mayo and want to cut them a little slack. Water is also served in small glasses almost comparable to shot glasses. When it's a hot day out in Arizona it's frustrating to keep refilling and not refreshing when Luke warm water is being served. I would not suggest going to this restaurant.

qoLUhfmxQgLzXgM0nfPA1w.text: Met here with friends after the Desert botanical garden and had great walk a moly great margaritas. Didn't like the flowered chips but when they replaced with corn it was all good,  had a great meal I had a chili Riano and a chicken tostada which was super good Everyone was well filled and I will be back as Arnold would say

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bdYaoMT9EzkggDcy9NKVGQ.text: Great experience!  Quick, easy parking:  Speedy, attentive, courteous, & personalized service: Marvelous unlimited home-made chips & salsa: Dynamic, easy-to-read, informative menu: Wide range of tasty beverages: Delicious entrees (steak fajitas & torta sandwich) which look appealing, taste flavorful, and reasonable in quantity: Acceptable price to quality ratio:  Definitely a repeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Refried rice, beans, sour cream, quacamole, salsa, &amp; tortillas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh flour tortillas
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Torta (steak) sandwich

CIaSiDqc3rKp0CrqWCaZZA.text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed before, I've been here over 50 times.   Nightlife was hotter at Auntie C's back in 2011 when I first moved into the neighborhood. It's still great for brunch, though. Especially on a warm day when you can sit on the huge patio. It's also nice when you can find room by one of the fireplaces for a drink on a cold night.  The staff is still friendly and the food is decent. Live bands most weekends. Go see the CPP play some night if you want to dance and sing along. Gail can sing the hell out of anything.  Do not fear the black olives in the taco meat at the free happy hour spread on Fridays.

KWihPDNjC99s9eIiJ7OIvQ.text: I always have a great time at Aunt Chilada's.  My latest and favorite thing to order is the El Pollo Fundito.  It's so cheesy, meaty and saucy!  I've also tried the quesadilla, torta and the fajitas before and all are great choices.    This place has great decor such as a nice patio and an outdoor bar outside for the perfect spring nights.  It has Bocce Ball, a band on the weekends, and good staff.  The service is usually good, with the exception of one rude waitress we had.  I took my mom here when she visited and we had a blast.  We drank, ate and danced to the band.      I also threw a surprise birthday party here for my fiance, Paul.  We reserved a part of the back patio and it turned out perfect!  It just so happens there was a very fun band playing that same night.    I will be back to Aunt Chilada's for some grub and drinks and I recommend you try it too!

Z_9HGAPv9vrrE7aJhFARsQ.text: Probably some of the Mexican food I have ever had. Not only was the food amazing but so was the service and drinks. Even with a full house our food arrived quickly and our server was very attentive. I love the fact that they have flour and corn tortilla chips. I had the fish tacos and they were absolutely the best, even better than the fish tacos I've had in Mexico. Fish was not dry and they were full of flavor. My husband had the fajitas and they were also very well made and flavorful. My kids actually ate the refried beans, and they very rarely eat refried beans when we go out. This is going to be my new go to place when I'm in Phoenix.

qM4eyWr8HRI0WWufgnq8yA.text: A friend of mine was staying at the Hilton next door and wanted to meet up for drinks and appetizers. He suggested this place. The name sounded cool, so I agreed and we met up on the patio. After browsing the menu and discussing it with our server, we decided to order: Chips & Salsa (complimentary) yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... Cheese Crisp, $6 yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... Nachos (Pequeno), $8 yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... Cheese Enchilada, $8.95 yelp.com/biz_photos/aunt... The Chips & Salsa were average, nothing special. The Cheese Crisp was pretty good. The Nachos were very good as well....they heap the toppings on it as you can see in the pictures above. Of course, I had to try an Enchilada....how could I come to a place named Aunt Chilada's and not have one?! The Cheese Enchilada I ordered was very good, above average. Our server was very attentive and made sure our glasses remained full. We dined on the patio around happy hour on a Wed evening, so it was full of business people after work. The vibe was very fun and the weather perfect. Return Factor - 86%

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rUCpitCAz5lvcdJNHnXf4g.text: We've seen some real authentic Mexican food before in my home town Chicago and my new home in El Paso...Aunt Chilada's is up there with all the great Mexican restaurants.  You have to stop here if visiting Phoenix....and try the chicken-spinach enchiladas with beans and fideo...yes! fideo instead of rice. Waiters and waitresses are cool and friendly.  Say hi to Sarah for me. :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9bjhO67pma3jCky0aNxjiw.text: So, I finally made it to breakfast club this morning here, and let me tell you, I really enjoyed both. I got to meet a new group of people and eat at a new restaurant, and I was extremely happy with both!  For starters, I got here at 10 am sharp, and realized that this place is closer to my house then I thought. I know they have a couple locations around the valley, but I think they have one in Tempe aside from this location as well.  When I arrived, the place was colorfully decorated and there were people slowly streaming in. I found my group, and we all sat on the patio.  Our server was super attentive, and I realized when she handed me the menu, that they had a weekend breakfast deal with healthy good looking food.  Yes, you can order from the main menu, but they have a great separate menu for their breakfast stuff on Saturday mornings.    The server informed us of the complimentary chocolate fountain with fruit inside as part of the Saturday morning breakfast thing.  After we placed our orders, I went inside and grabbed some fruit and dipped it all in chocolate.  They had strawberries, cantaloupe, marshmallows and a few other items to choose from.  So tasty!  I reviewed the menu and decided to go with the fruit bowl with granola and a $3 Mimosa.  One of the other girls with me ordered the same thing as well, and the others got some good looking dishes as well.  The fruit bowl came out and it was so good looking!  Holy cow! I really enjoyed the whole thing and overall, the prices and the food were awesome.  Service was great too, and I will gladly be back in the future for more.  Thank you breakfast club, you have made my day...and aunt Chiladas's

xvoRcMKHmWcQ5fdMIi1Z2A.text: The service staff are very friendly and seem to really hustle.  However, they are handicapped by the food preparation people who do a poor job.  The ingredients listed on menus are not necessarily the ingredients used in preparing the meal.  The cooks should read the menus to understand what the alert customer expects to receive.  It doesn't always happen.  And get rid of flour chips with salsa.  Corn chips are always better and certainly more traditional.

_CWO8Q1N2znSq9Fu41XAGA.text: The way I ended up coming to this joint is far from typical.  Matter of fact, it's so far from typical that most of my friends questioned my insanity for even showing up on a random school night during twilight.  That said, it's really a good story but I shall save that for another time.  Not only is it tucked away in a very cool / scenic part of Scottsdale, but the layout is vast, expansive and impressive.  The patio has personality.  This is important when one lives in a place where outside dining is preferable for eight months out of the year.  The help / service were impeccable and everything I tried was tasty and affordable.  If you can get behind the culture and history of born & bred Phoenix family stories, this is one not to be missed.  I'll be back without question!

mzkXFIz2JinLYgHmr_3tRA.text: Areas of opportunity: 1. In AZ tap water makes a different 2. Waiting 20 minutes for menus, water, and chips (that never came) is not OK 3. Cleaning our own table from spilled salsa is not OK 4. Charging us for a quesadilla and not bringing it, NOT OK!!! 5. I will not be back...

HOGQVxknnZLpX814iGxiwA.text: Everyone that worked here was friendly and provides good service. The building also has a lot of history to it as well as the area! This place is worth a visit.  I recommend the healthy shrimp lettuce wraps, so tasty! We came in a Sunday around lunch and they had a chocolate fountain with lots of fruit laying out.

EnvyRjDdIC6SV1R9EWG26w.text: This is the single worst Mexican restaurant I have ever been to in my life.    I ate here 2-3 years ago and I still tell people how freaking terrible it was.    I was staying at the hotel (great hotel and resort in general) and my friend was starving.  Instead of grabbing a cab and heading out to Tempe I was shanghaied into eating at this abomination.  My other friend who is the nicest most mellow person I have ever met who never complains about anything, pushed his plate away after a single bite agreeing with me that this was by far the worst Mexican food he had ever tasted.  The service was tolerable but nothing special and you are seated on a nice patio, but outside of those minor triumphs this place was an unmitigated disaster of a meal.    I swear on my deathbed I might remember how horrible my enchilada taco combo plate was and think it may have been the one regret I had in my life.

78t-08jjQkfxn9H9ysA44Q.text: Today we did what we call the "Aunt Chiladas Dreamy Draw Ride" at the end of heart thumping  leg pumping 40 min ride on road bikes, we go into the historic joint to hang at the bar with Marie. I drink tea, he drinks Corona Light. We don't eat. It's fun to envy the Chingalingas the workin' guys down the bar are scarfing. Good banter, lots of laughs and historic surroundings. Until next week, when we ride here again and inhale the scent of mesquite and homemade flour tortilla chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

y73PVqYGAuJRHH-lJP6smA.text: Best Mexican place in AZ! Chips are flour, light and crisp. Salsa is fresh with black olives and fresh green onions. Chicken fajitas are my favorite. Marinated just right. Staff is great. Love this place. Oh did I mention that it has a beautiful environment? A must see.

6IeIEo-rB9TfCjp1zMr-ZQ.text: A Groupon brought us back to what used to be one of our go-to Mexican food places. Either our tastes have changed, or this place has really gone downhill.   The history of this place harkens back many years & is included on the menu - fun to read. The place has a kitschy atmosphere, and a nice outside area to dine. Located in shadow of the Pointe Hilton Hotel at Squaw Peak, the restaurant still draws many visitors. The night we were there, there were many large tables of guests that appeared to be from out of the area. I know, I'm jumping to conclusions, but locals know how to pronounce "chimichanga", "quesadilla", "machaca" and "chipotle"!  The carnitas tacos were boring and generic and the chicken burritio flavorless. Meh.. Margaritas nothing special. They claim to be "always" voted Best Margarita by a local magazine, but I find that hard to believe. The upside: the salsa is very flavorful. Not a fan of the flour tortilla chips, though.  Years ago we used to come here for the awesome happy hour on their outside patio, which they still advertise. Reduced appetizers during the week, free buffet on Fridays.   I doubt we'll be back. The Valley has lots and lots of places to get authentic Mexican fare. We'll leave Aunt Chilada's basic Gringo fare to the tourists and dine elsewhere.

izZKijKeerESzFqQrEJaYA.text: Start with service. Place was busy on a nice Friday night at 7 PM. Should have made a reservation. About a 30 minute wait for a party of 4 for next available seating.  When we got inside there were a lot of open tables (must have been short servers). Hostess was bubbly and very friendly.   Our food server said she was relatively new and had very few suggestions as for best plates available. She rarely swing by our table. I think 4 times the whole night including dropping off the bill and picking it up.  Food review: I really liked the chips before dinner. I had the chicken and spinach enchilada. Was good but not over the top. I asked if I could substitute vegtables as one of my sides and was told yes. When I got my bill I was charged $3 for a side of vegetables. I didn't complain to the server because I think she would have struggled with adjusting the bill.   My wife ordered the fish tacos. She really enjoyed them and the tarter sauce was great.  My father had the burrito fundido as the only recomendation from our server. He said it was about average, not excellent but good.  My son had a quesadilla. How can you go wrong there?  Price: price was average. Not to expensive or cheap.  Would I return? I doubt it. I would find another place.

Np3qGcRPcBwAeryRwppZ0Q.text: WHY does this place have bad reviews!?!?!?  This place is awesome. I literally have never had mexican food this good....EVER! First of all, they have not one, but TWO types of chips for their chips and salsa. The flour torilla chips are the bomb. I could've eaten all that they had. They have black olives in the salsa. Seems weird, but it is delicious! Guac=fabulous. Had margaritas and they were of course great! We both got the pollo fundido per our waiters recommendation. I was mindblown at how good this was! I am still dreaming about it! I cannot wait to return here! We sat on the patio with other visitors and had a ball!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A blast!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas!
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Car outside

Fs2UThDevPy_aNSY-oP3Kg.text: What a great spot to have brunch! Just a quick little drive north on the 51 from the Biltmore area.  - Exceptional service: Cameron really creative a terrific guest experience. Very friendly and helpful with menu and drink items.  - Chocolate Fondue Fountain!!!!  - Patio: This area has a really cool ambiance.  - Food: wonderful salsa and chips. Breakfast eggs and chorizo is delish!!! Easy parking  Great bloody Mary's

BaGWj-ZUe5mZ8GcVY5ykjw.text: Sorry to say but I think I've had better Mexican food at Taco Bell.  The chicken for my taco salad was so over cooked it was practically jerky (but with less flavor). The margaritas were watered down. The draught beer was good though.

jlbWgejSNDTOOkx-2QtBVA.text: Black olive salsa?  Um, me not likey. Chips are a variety of house fried flour and corn served in an 80's type Parquet bowl. I ordered chicken fajitas.  They were served with fideo; Mexican spaghetti that tastes like Mexican rice; guacamole,  pico, sour cream.   To me the food was bland,  but i did grow up eating TexMex.  We waited forever for our check. Server was doing as well as he could with it being a busy Monday.  Food was not impressive.  It felt  like i am in a Mexican Cracker Barrel with log chairs, rustic wood paneled walls and a non function train that should run around the top portion of.the room. I don't expect to ever go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Aunt Chiladas interior. .. a mixture of Mexican and The Cracker Barrel.

sQrL982fPHmfs4YJeHsclQ.text: This Phoenix gem is a must try! Been coming here for years with family for various events!

5ak09dKqy-FDXsTn9GziOA.text: My extended family members like the margaritas here so we have eaten here a few times. I love their fresh flour tortillas and salsa. I ordered the  vegetarian burrito our last visit and was seriously surprised at how they made it. The burrito had steamed cauliflower, broccoli and carrots (think California blend) wrapped in a tortilla. No cheese, no rice, no beans, no peppers, no corn, nothing I might usually expect to find in a vegetarian burrito. It was not good. I'll stick to chips and salsa next trip.

mwLnriRf4YMyn2ypEUqI4g.text: We have been coming to Phoenix for several years now and we always make a point to have dinner at Aunt Chiladas. Yesterday about 4:30 we stopped to have dinner. We sat at the bar (as we usually do) for a couple cocktails and dinner.  The bartender was a younger women (early 30s), she wiped our spot down leaving in dripping wet. I asked if she could hand me a couple napkins so I could dry it and she waved the menu over it attempting to dry the counter top. When that was unsuccessful she tossed a couple napkins down and walked away. We ordered a couple drinks and as we sat there we watched as she overly fraternized with the men at the bar to the point of neglecting the needs of other patrons. However that was tolerable, even if inappropriate. As we sat there the worse was yet to come. When when of the other patrons order a large plate of nachos she began sampling from his plate (obviously she liked  nachos).She was taking the food with her fingers, from his plate and placing it into her month then cleaning her fingers in a "finger licking good" fashion, and continuing to wait on and serve other patrons. At that point we were done and left. In all the years we have been dinning at Aunt Chiladas we have never experienced such a horrible display of professionalism in the food serving business. Needless to say that will be our last trip to Aunt Chiladas.....

xrZhUfM-Ss56JLSXtaAMqg.text: I love you Aunt Chilada's Mothers Day was stressful and We arrived late at 8:30pm I am sure that it was a busy day for them. I love the chips and salsa, My dinner was good but my husband gets the taco salad and they must have ran out of meat, they gave him a very small side of taco meat, weird and the staff was getting restless, we ate quickly and left, but all in all I got my Mexican food on Mothers Day.

l4gwgMKefZPh0QMoyJwoWA.text: Placed a to go order earlier tonight and when I got to my hotel room no tortillas for my fajitas and no salad dressing for my salad.  Everyone was friendly, food was great but it is frustrating when you don't get the service you should at a restaurant.

q9-g2DCEicSz3GwEQ4z7Yg.text: Was here last night for a Yelp event.    Reason for the missing star - The handicapped stall in the ladies room on the patio - Its door latch/lock is broken.  Couldn't keep the stall door closed.    Being almost 30 weeks pregnant and maneuvering in a regular stall - Not fun.    Other than that - I've always loved this tucked away location!!  :)

-SxnpBUXQhylhxQXZPWazA.text: Very good food with nice outdoor bar. Inside bar and table area is large and nice as well. Chips served are not your standard chip you would expect.

7E9TpC4xNaA_wgXdqIKqHQ.text: I have been here twice and the wait both times took FOREVER. The food isn't bad though.

YdjxTl4K6RdeQufZuXn4Tg.text: I felt very at home and not in a restaurant setting, service was great, also the food was delicious. I thought this was the best Mexican food I have ever had, and thanks to Angel Dominguez, he made sure we were taken care of and had an awesome attitude.

VfRHm5DtQ2FIgMqqIDBUCg.text: My 1st impression of the outside was unclean, cluttered and a little quirky but I was willing to try it out because of the great reviews I've heard. We came in to fast service and a  welcoming staff however the food was crappy!!! My husband ( who will eat anything) ordered the fish tacos took one bite and refused to finish it! He's not the type to complain, so in stead he walked away disgusted and starving. With majority of the meals they are served with fedio (Mexican spaghetti) which was flat out horrible. Bland and just strait up weird!  I don't recommend this place. At all...

3Hjs2fme6Az9x6ZlpkbeWA.text: Food was ok. Employees where ok. The people playing the bocce tournament where great.

q6RcxZ4j2eOnsZgr3BkFlQ.text: Even though the resteraunt was empty when we were seated, the service was slow and another couple was complaining they were seated for over ten minutes and no one came to take their drink order. Food was just ok.

R3imHHSCXsgM9FRzR0Dt-w.text: Overrun with people on Cinco de Mayo. That's not bad. Big gringo party night.  What's bad? Weak cocktails in little 4-oz Dixie cups for $5.50. Starting a tab at one bar and needing to close it out when you go to another of the 4 bars inside because the cash registers don't talk to each other. No food service at any of the bars.  So probably not the best night to review the place, though I've been there several times over the years on non-"holiday" nights, and it never really succeeds in impressing much--in any way, really. . .

t9YIFsf2v1B-k0eUqUNLVA.text: Hard to find but great street tacos....also loved the shrimp fajitas.   The place can get a little packed with the hipster crowd, but the service is great and the atmosphere feels authentic.  Plenty of space for a large party or event outside with catering and music.   The bar area is cozy  and the servers are friendly.  Not the best Mexican food around, but a good spot for a bite to eat and some trivia!

O-qD_Ra2ZDHcz3bq7Da-cg.text: Located in a fairly residential area, Aunt Chiladas has a nice outdoor    seating section along with a bar and bocce ball court.  The menu includes pretty standard items, tacos, burritos, enchilada's as well as some other specialties.  The chips that everyone mentions were OK. They are more of a puffy chip vs. the crisp thin chip you normally see with salsa.  For apps the table shared large tortillas covered with melted cheese, kind  of like a Mexican pizza and some guacamole.  They were tasty.  For entree, I got the sour cream chicken enchiladas.  The plate was huge.  2 large enchiladas covered in sauce and served with refried beans and rice.  They were good, but the chicken was a bit dry.  Others said the seafood enchiladas were delicious but I didn't taste them.  The chicken in chipolte sauce was good.  If I had the choice, probably wouldn't be my choice for for a meal.

4FsQVdcPxsB5w_DmaKQYlA.text: Pretty good dinner.  My margarita of the month was very good and they had a large selection of tequila and margarita options was fun.

cmjBfC704InoVP4Hdeemnw.text: Outstanding food. The chips and salsa are fantastic. The restaurant is very Mexico. You feel like you're south of the border. The service is excellent. I will come back here next time I'm in Phoenix.

P4UO1o-52ObE1r3qKmBOUg.text: Aunt Chilada's does a very good job with all the Mexican restaurant standards as well as some creative dishes. The bad reviews almost scared me away. I'm glad I went anyway.

IMWxaPcAOgRjNfXNoE3HoA.text: OMG. Worst restaurant experience I've ever had in my 50 years of existence. Here's the experience went  1. Right out of the gate...Our hostess who seated us told us the fruit and chocolate fountain were included with the meal. My girlfriend grabbed two pieces of melon and two strawberries.When our waitress did finally decide to show up 10 minutes later we both ordered a cup of Albondigas soup without rice. She made a snotty remark that we should get the bowl of soup because the cups were small. She then barked at us that if we don't order an entree that we would have to pay $8 for the four pieces of fruit. I said whoa, hold on. We are ordering entrees. She replied that a lot of people come in just for soup. All of this is going on while my girlfriend and I are still reading the menu to decide what we wanted. I want to know what other people just ordering soup has to do with us.  2. After 30 minutes the entrees arrived. I complained that it took way too long and the waitress said they had a large party and that is why the food took so long. Mind you I ordered 2 enchiladas and my girlfriend ordered a gound beef tostada and it took 30 minutes...no shit. How hard is that to make? I told her that we are just important as any other customer in the restaurant. She sent the manager over and he said the same thing. Large party sorry. I told him I don't care about the large party. Not our problem. That was it...he walked away. I looked around and the place was practically empty.  3. I ordered beans and rice with my meal. The waitress didn't even have enough courtesy to listen to me. She brought me fideo (mexican pasta) instead of rice.She also brought fideo and beans for my girlfriend who ordered her tostada ala carte.and charged us for it. When my girlfriend ordered just the tostada the snotty bitch complained that my girlfriend wasn't ordering more.  4. After trying to eat what was very poorly made food (we couldn't eat it because it was horrible) we went to pay the bill and noticed extra charges. We complained again. This time the manager did not come to talk to us. He told her to tell us the meal was comped. Since we couldn't eat that crap, that was fine with me. My girlfriend was going to taste my enchiladas and without asking one of the bussers took my plate away.  5. Finally I asked to speak with the manager and a waiter called him (Marty) and the manager turned around and yelled across the bar that he was too busy. He LITERALLY yelled it. Then he noticed me standing there and said Oh, I'm sorry. I replied no I'm sorry that you are too busy. I told him I would never return. That was the last straw.  The waitress was a snotty bitch and never checked on us once except to give us the check. We had to ask other wait staff to get our waitress more than twice. If you are smart you will not waste your time or money at Aunt Chiladas. Over rated and over priced. This place should be out of business.  Oh and the Chocolate fountain is disgusting. I've seen people pick up the fruit with their fingers and cough and sneeze in it.

jcSLjoZn_XFDT_gZo1-zqQ.text: This is a fun spot! The house margaritas are good, and the guacamole is delicious! I'm a taco fan, and their beef tacos can be just want my frazzled mind thinks about following a really tough day. I love that the patio is incredibly dog friendly! I bring Edie here often, and they give us a bowl of water for her every time we sit at a table. The servers are very friendly and attentive. The patio is excellent, with a bocce court, outdoor bar, and sweet view of Piestewa Peak! My friends and I frequent this neighborhood joint regularly; the bonus is I can almost justify chewing down on their awesome chips and salsa with the walk there and back!

photos.caption: Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bocce court behind Edie
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Aunt Chiladas Squaw Peak - Phoenix, AZ, United States

crFVDmhAr47Fi3ypFZC9kQ.text: Possibly the worst food ever. Quality is poor not sure if they taste there own food. Drinks are super sweet and hardly any alcohol for the price. Bartenders cant make a drink right if there lives depended on it.

E2bs4AavDpJyBn_ANg2_3w.text: I have to give Aunt Chilada's credit - we stayed for a quite a while at an outside table drinking our margaritas until we realized that at 10:30pm we were the very last people there and that the restaurant had pretty much closed down around us. They had already picked up the check and never pushed us out so we had a relaxing evening.  Unfortunately I was unimpressed with the food. The chips were light and crispy but the salsa tasted pretty generic. A spinach enchilada was very bland and a chile releno was mostly breading with a small chile and cheese but not much flavor. The two people who were with me agreed that their food was mediocre as well. We went with the frozen margarita only because we wanted a pitcher and the margarita on the rocks pitcher was much more expensive. The margarita was also unimpressive - perhaps the more expensive one would have been better but the regular on one the menu just tasted like frozen sour mix.   We had a good time, but if I were to ever go here again I would probably just go for chips, drinks and appetizers which I could get somewhere else anyway.

lPznjOsfi77O9rfQELlAaQ.text: We had reservations at this restaurant,  party of 12. We arrived at 6:15 and were seated immediately.  This was the best part of the whole experience.  Our waitress took a really long time to bring drinks...one person waited about 15 minutes for a Pepsi. Once we finally got around to placing our order about 7pm (waitress took that long to take our order), food didn't arrive until 1 hour later. The manager came to our table and half heartedly apologized for the delay..by this time half our party cancelled their food orders and left. Food was ok...nothing great and wasn't worth the long wait. Once we finished our meal , we sat with dirty plates in front of us for the remainder of our "experience". We waited so long to pay for the bill I actually had to get up and search for the manager to pay....3 hour experience I wouldn't recommend to anyone. Spoke with the manager and received the same lame apology.  The manager explained that they had a ton of reservations for big parties and weren't staffed appropriately.  Bad service even worse excuses and would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

6soRreAuKcZnXZHPhLaWaA.text: Bad, just bad. Food is underwhelming. My friend did not like her wine after one sip and asked the waiter to exchange it for something else. He actually balked and said he would have to check with the manager before he could do that. What???Are you kidding me? Big mistake. Then I tasted my incredibly weak margherita, all sweet, horrible. Yea, they sell you an 18oz. drink, but whats the point if it sucks. Decided not to deal with the bartender directly instead of flustering our waiter again. Walked up to the bar and in a very calm, and nice way explained to the bartender that I was underwhelmed with my drink, that it was too sweet and I could not taste a hint of tequila. Well I guess tha was an insult, and instead of dealing with me as a customer, she told me that she made the drink and there was basically nothing wrong with it and nothing she could do. Really? This is the type of badly run, corporate restaurant I cannot stand. No owners to deal with, no one that cares, just crappy service and a culture that forgets about the customer. Owners need to go into a Houston's and see how a large corporate restaurant should be run.

3BLwgnguqSKQ1TRaVJvq3A.text: I was curious how Mexican food would be as good in Phoenix as it is in Tucson when I went here for a rehearsal dinner.  We were seated in a separate room in the back for our party but it seemed like a really fun place to hang out.  There was live music, plenty of different areas to sit in, and a lot of people enjoying themselves.  We had a buffet and I was very impressed with the menu options.  One of the dishes was green corn tamales, which I don't regularly see at Mexican restaurants (maybe they take too long to make?) and they were perfectly cooked.  Another surprise was a healthy green salad that really complimented our meal.  Sometimes when I eat Mexican food I don't feel like I am getting enough of a vegetable serving and this went perfectly.  The chips were also a big hit with everyone as they seemed to be fried and were a change from the traditional chip.  I was impressed by the flavorful and chunky salsa as well.

fr8Y2q8JU7WGeRMGelGJ2Q.text: There are a few secrets to this Aunt Chilada's:  First, when you order chips, order "just flour chips please". They should bring you a basket without the corn chips. The flakey flour chips are the best.  Second, order your custom margarita at the front outside bar. They will make them at that bar only for some reason. It comes on the rocks in a plastic tumbler with 1-2 glasses and will easily serve 2+ drinks. They make them with your choice of tequila and flavoring, I choose Don Julio Gold Anejo, Grand Marnier and they have a great lime mix they use. They have a menu with all the options, this was the best combo I tried. The price is more than standard drinks, but you will get your money's worth.  I have not eaten in the restaurant, but the take away is easy to order and has always been great. The patio is a great place for Happy Hour as well.

yGhR2xjJqlw9MxpSa-9iIQ.text: I went for lunch with my mother-in-law, she had the veggie fajitas, and I had a chicken burro with green enchilada sauce. we both enjoyed our meals.

j02dAZgHJ8JNrAl9QeMjCg.text: What a bummer! This is our neighborhood hangout, and we've always loved the salsa and chips. We ate lunch out on the patio yesterday, and got one bowl of regular chips and one of flour chips. Then, as we read the new menus, we noticed that they are now charging $2.25 for any additional bowls of chips! And these are small bowls! My favorite part of going to ACs was the salsa and chips. Also, with a new menu you get, you guessed it, higher prices! And they eliminated our favorite lunch specials! The waitress said they are making their own chips now, instead of buying them, so, since they have to pay someone to make the chips, they can no longer just give them away in the same quantities. She said something about how so many chips were being left on the tables. I can understand raising prices. I can even understand charging for extra chips. But, I can't tolerate raising prices and charging for extra chips. At least put out a larger bowl of chips for the first batch!! This may seem petty to some, but to us it is a very big deal. We will patronize those restaurants that seem to value us as customers. Free chips are such a tradition, it's hard to have that taken away. Oh, and it was very nice out on the patio--loved (seriously) all the little birdies coming around for morsels.

8AljDsaRg1CnflKSJDzYcQ.text: Ooohh Aunt Chiladas.  I came here last Friday night and was inside at the bar area with girlfriends.  It was my birthday, and as soon as my waitress, I think her name was Nicole, found out she offered me a birthday shot!  What a great way to start out the night!  Anyway, the food is mediocre but oh boy do they have a great tequila selection.  lets just say I dont remember much past the tequilas shots.  Anyway, if you want to have a great time, be sure to hit up Aunt Chiladas on a Friday night.
